Reach Tower Level {Level}!
Invest required Items

With the familiar sound of glassbells ringing and the scent of flowers, Ianna's image appears:\n\n"You've outdone yourself this time. Attuning to the Allfire in such a clever way! Others in the Circle see you as a threat, but I might be persuaded to put in a word for you? Perhaps you want to show me your appreciation and accelerate your application that way?"
All battles inside your [mDomain] are enchanted with [aura]{what}[/].
[influence]Domain[/]

Ianna's image appears before you.\n\n"I see you show great promise. It took some members of the Circle decades to come as far as you have with the Allfire. Truly a prodigy. Not everyone sees it that way, some feel threatened by your ascent. I see no reason to fear you. Power never scared me...quite the contrary." she says with a smile.
You honor me with your words.
I can offer my gold.
I can share my mana.
I don't have anything to give.
Extorted?! No matter hown talented you are - no one speaks to me like that! I think you need a reminder of your station!
And she is gone again...

As she looks at the forces you have brought with you, Ianna laughs, her hair flowing about her like fire.\n\n"The nerve on you! I had my fun with our little games, but do you really want to go through with this? You may spend a long time regretting this."

Of course, my little mouse. And you played along beautifully.\n\nIanna laughs at you mockingly and waves you goodbye as her form begins to dissolve in front of your eyes. Another apparition - she fled before the battle even began!
This is all a game to her...gambling with the lives of others.
We will see about that.

Before your eyes, a veil of fog manifests itself into the shape of a face.\n\n"Greetings novice. My name is Undergast, but in the Circle of Mages I go by The Weaver. And I know quite well who you are."
A Circle Mage. Best be careful around them.
I will not tolerate a no one like you waltzing in here and destroying my years of hard work! Run back to where you came from, or your life is forfeit!
You will fall with your precious libraries!
Explore the trapdoor.
Something smells off. Let me take a look around.

Yngrid walks up to the ruined tower and looks sceptically at the walls. "Ah! I knew it! See this? Those stones all around? Covered by moss? You would think that ruin is a couple of hundreds of years old - perhaps from the times of the War of Six Races...But you'd be wrong"
So what? The ruin is older?

Older? the female dwarf scoffs "Older? It is barely as old as me! T'is is all make believe - someone built this to look like a crumbled tower and went through some trouble to hide its true age."\n\n"This is a very elaborate trap! And it will come down on your thick heads if you get too close. Here, let me show you." Tossing a heavy stone towards the fallen tower's entrance, Yngrid takes a few quick steps back as the whole structure shakes violently and comes crashing down on itself.
That would have buried everyone beneath it.
Good thing you had someone with a half a brain with you, then. Yngrid winks. "But our journey was for naught?".
No, the item must be here, I am sure of it.
As your men close in to get a better look at the markings, the whole structure begins to shake violently and comes crashing down on itself, burying your people below tons of stones.
A trap! I knew it.

Cleaning the rubble off the trap door your men pull at its rusted ring. Its hinges squeaking violently, the door opens up to a dark stairway. As the first troops step down into the darkness, you hear a surprised cry as a jet of flame blasts from the entrance, scorching everything near it.\n\nAt the same time, the tower begins to shake violently and crashes in on itself, reducing the structure to a mound of rubble.
A trap. I should have guessed.
The surviving troops gather in some distance from the ruins, treating their wounded and watching the crumbled tower despondently.
We must not give up. The heirloom is here, I am certain of it!
Warily, your band searches the surrounding area but it soons becomes clear there is nothing else to be found here.
Perhaps it is beneath the rubble. Search there.
You must have missed it. Search again!
Use magic to attune to the item.
Grumbling, your men continue their search, but to no avail. They suffer some scrapes and bruises going through the rubble.
It MUST be here. I can sense it!
Digging around in the rubble does not reveal the crystal.
It is here. I know it is!
Show Grid
Show Outlines
Toggle Outline

Not far away is another group, pushing a small cart, full of what looks like sacks of coin.

"No need to eye my gold. This is not for you to have."

The shimmering image of a man appears next to you, a hint of frost in his voice "So you better keep away, understood?"
We'll stay out of your hair.

You dare step into my abode, you little miscreant? I will make sure this is your last mistake.\n\nOrcs, wargs and other creatures close in, brandishing their weapons and bearing their fangs menacingly. All the while, Rohen Tahir shouts orders and gestures in your direction, preparing them to strike.

You see neither sight nor sound of Yria as you come to end the conflict between you, but you hear her voice in your ears.\n\n"What do you believe this siege will bring you? Glory? Purpose? You shall have none from me. I have no words for one so violent as to destroy any hope Fiara has at true peace."
Then let words cease. Attack!

I hope to be able to guide you on following this path, as I have guided others. I hope you will follow my example. If you do not, know that I will not tolerate harm nor war. Not to anyone. Not by anyone.\n\nAnd with that the apparition ends.

Taking proper stock of your master’s laboratory, you find very little more than empty vials and containers that have, like everything else, been searched through.\n\nIt was certainly not the work of goblins. You can make out tracks of a cart leading to a nearby hamlet you passed on your way here. Did the villagers plunder the tower after it was abandoned too?
I suppose I should check in with them too.

The Circle of Mages - a covenant of the most powerful magi on Eo.

They supposedly protect all practitioners of magic, furthering knowledge of the mystical arts. But they are also the only living beings to have begun to master the Allfire's might, having recently discovered the key to its might on the far away continent of Xu.

Now, they bar others from partaking in the Allfire's immense power, claiming it is too dangerous for the uninitiated to handle.
I will have to tread carefully...
From the camp you make out the loud and obnoxious squabbling of goblins. It appears they are fighting over loot from the tower, screaming at each other at the top of their lungs.
Ambush them!
Dazzle them with magic!
Wait and watch.
You watch and wait for the goblins to do even more damage to each other, but one tugs at another one’s nose and points in your direction, screeching.
Attack at once!
Call out.
The now quiet camp is littered with goblin corpses. They were carrying and using some of your master's tools, as well as a small amount of coin.
Where are the rest of his possessions?

The goblins jump up and down nervously.

"Big people in robes! Terrible magic they wields. We hides away until battle is over. Then we comes back and... eh... saves master's things. So we brings things here! Loyal goblins!"

The goblins grin at you, showing yellowish teeth and pointing at the scattered tools and ripped carpets.

"We takes good care of master's things, yes yes!"
Will you be loyal goblins to me now?
The goblins look disappointed and slink away.\n\nTheir leader calls after you: "We lefts some master's things to fetch later! You gets them yourselves now! We don't works for you!"
Show me where they are.
The Hamlet

The village's inhabitants eye you with an air of hostility when you arrive. Children are called inside. Some of the villagers arm themselves with tools and sticks. Your band regards them cautiously in return.\n\nA burly, black-haired man brandishing a cudgel steps forward and says: "There is nothing for you here!"
Scare them into submission.
Show them you mean no harm.
The villagers remain defiant.\n\n"We won't return the ingredients! The apprentice left them as payment for helping him flee. We got them fair and square! You can't just take them from us!"
I am not here to just take things. Let's trade.
Return them to me, or pay the price in blood.

The villagers barely budge but, after a moment, one of their elders steps forward hesitantly.\n\n"We were afraid you would bewitch us. The old wizard's apprentice thought they would come after him and take back the items he gave us. We wanted to trade them in the city to buy clothes for our children!"
Return the goods. Pay a fine. We’ll call that even.
I don't care. They belong to me by right!
I have no intention of harming you. Let’s trade.
At the sight of your troops moving in, the villagers' bravery fails and they lower their makeshift weapons.\n\nHow to punish them for their insolence in keeping your master's materials?
Grudgingly, knowing they are no match for you, the villagers collect together a few coins and present them to you along with the stolen ingredients.

Trade? But... you... we... Trade?! 

The elder stares at you, slow to collect himself and call out to his people: "The mage's troops are here to trade!"

As those around him begin to relax, he leans in to squint at you: "You are not playing a cruel trick on us? You really wish to trade for our goods?"
Of course not, you fool! Now hand over your possessions!
Yes, trade. Is that so hard to fathom?
It's just... We... We humbly apologize for our behavior. Now, what would you wish to trade for the goods?
Ì can perform some cantrips for a few ingredients.
I can pay you gold for a few ingredients.
The villagers gladly accept the coin you give them for their wares but seem happy for you to leave.
The villagers agree to trade you some of their harvest for a few mending spells, though they seem uncertain about the results.

As the air shimmers and an apparition forms before you, you hear the sharp crack of static running through the air and for a moment smell something like sulfur. This mage is keen-eyed and ill-tempered.\n\n"It would be wise for you to recognize your inferiority, novice. I am Uram, a senior member of the Circle of Mages."
And what is it you want from me?

The red dust that gathers before you chokes the air with a smell that makes your eyes water. The crackling sound seems to tear a hole in reality from which Uram's apparition steps, furiously staring at you.\n\n"If you think that ruining one tower will stop the inevitable, you have shown yourself a fool. I have other towers, other resources. Other opportunities to install my rule across Eo. Come what may, this will not be my end, but it may well be yours."
It is just words, Uram.

A limited resource required to use certain powerful skills.\n\nA unit has always as much focus as its most expensive ability requires, further increased by the amount of bonuses.
No valid recipe found!
You have no free crafting slot available!

You cannot afford the selected blueprint!
Ianna The Singer
Rohen Tahir
Undergast The Weaver
Uram The Red
Yria Of The Light
We should follow those lights.
I guess we'll have to find another way then.

A man steps forth, his eyes hidden by a tall, golden domino mask. He raises a hand and from behind him a gaunt, half-decayed zombie stumbles forth, croaking out a message far beyond its own volition in a horrible, broken voice.

"You stand before the greatest mage of our times, Hokan Ashir. If you prove yourself to him, you will be rewarded with glory in his service. Else, you will be destroyed and forgotten, cast into oblivion for eternity like your master before you."

Hokan twists his hand into a fist and the zombie collapses back into death at your feet. Still silent, Hokan returns to the company that follows him.
Did you kill him?
Plague
From afar, you can already hear the trolls' loud stomping. It is a small wonder that the dwarf managed to flee in the first place.
We are not ready yet.
We better kill them quickly.

A loud crushing sound comes from a little further up. Snow and debris rushes down and narrowly misses you and your company.You raise your head and see part of the mountain moving. A large monstrum raises a boulder over it's head and throws it in your direction - this is a golem!
The Dangers of Mining
We will slay this monster. Attack!
Let's gather a greater force first.
Zerbo's Mirror
A soul is required for crafting!
Ore is required for crafting!

Your master’s theory: his tower’s attunement allows you to bond with Allfire sources in the tower’s sphere of influence. He claimed that, if close enough, one could channel an increased amount of the magical energy and bend it to your will.\n\nYou will need to find the most powerful source of the Allfire on the continent to test his postulate.
The time has come. Seek out a great Allfire node!
Purity Inquisitor
Purity Knight
Wheat
Hero
This unit is a hero and loyally follows your command.

You feel the incredible power of the Allfire emanating even from far away. But there is a presence connected to it too. Strong magics are at work.\n\nIt is not until you are closer that you see a group of robed figures around the source, busying themselves with some kind of ritual. They are not yet aware of your presence.
Competition? Wipe them out!
A Circle mage perhaps? Hail them.
Sneak away and return later.
You have been beaten back - but you know you must have the Allfire.
We shall return!

Finally, you stand before a powerful source of the Allfire. You can sense it calling, a strong current that permeates everything around you. You feel a connection to it. Something that resonates with your very core, offering you power beyond your imagination.\n\nYet you still fear it will burn you alive. Its terrible energy remains uncontrollable. For now.
Have one of my troops touch it.

You reach out with your mind, your newfound mastery of the Allfire allowing you to sense the ebb and flow of its power across the land. For just an instance, you feel as though all creation lies at your feet and your mind’s eye perceives everything around you.

But then the moment passes.

Frantically, you scribble down everything you saw in your terrible and beautiful moment of clarity, straining to put it to paper before it can be forgotten.
Note down all the Allfire surface locations!
The robed figures swirl around to face you, immediately calling an attack.
So much for diplomacy.
Bandits on the Loose

A dwarf dressed in luxurious robes appears before you, accompanied by the clanking of pickaxes and hammers.\n\n"I see, another bright mind striving to outgrow the head it holds. I am Isgrimm the Smith and you, young one, have come a little too close for comfort."
Apologies, Master Isgrimm.
You want what is mine, don't you? Your greed and jealousy have driven you to desperation. You shall never lay hand on my creation. Flee, before you suffer my wrath!
You cannot stand against me.
I want nothing of the sort. I shall leave now.
Fatigued
Undead
Monsters

A surprise
A young paladin - Lytra Storme - warned me of an impending attack today. I am unsure of her motives, her once following The New Purity, but she did excel in battle. We shall see what she brings.
The New Purity

The Purity are fanatics, gathered after the Mage Wars under Rondar Lacaine. They teach that our using magic prevents Aonir from healing the world. \n\nBefore they were disgraced, they took it upon themselves to eradicate mages. Now, we know their vision of Aonir was false, sent to them by an ancient creature from beyond the veil.
Purity Methods
Fervent in their belief, the Purity does not quail at extreme measures, torturing the magically gifted until their minds break and they lose their gift, or die screaming.
Rengar Storme

The Stormes have served the Highmark for generations, watching over the Westguard and the coast. Their head, Rengar Storme, Lord of Stormwatch Faste, is one of the Purity faithful. I fear it has twisted his mind and soul.
If we can stop Rengar, we can stop the New Purity.

By facilitating the transfer of life energy this spells allows the consumption of precious mortal flesh to have invigorating effects for those in need.\n
Sometimes you need to end a life to renew it. Consuming the target to create a more pliable and resistant minion.\n
Undead created out of this soul gain [unitpromotion]"{what}"[/].
The dwarves fortify their underground halls with old artifice magic.\n\nThe meaning of those glyphs can be changed, wishing for good fortune and gold...
Having a nose for precious metals has always been a sought-after blessing. This grants you that rare sense temporarily, revealing any untapped gold nearby.\n
This envokes Zerbo's blessing on a gift given, making sure the receiving party is sufficiently grateful.\n
You know what? I've changed my mind. Never mind.
Shaikan Warrior

The Shaikan are a formidable people, born of Janus Malacay's desire to find the Materia Prima by mixing dragon blood with his own. They work as first-rate mercenaries and that one is willing to join my service is a rare windfall.
The Hollow Guards
These undead are created by merging a special type of powerful soul with the´remains of an elite warrior. Elynn believes the Might of the Giants will be able destroy them.
The Might of the Giants was lost when it's last wielder, Corporal Tahar, died. We have located his grave. Perhaps it will give us the next clue as to where the hammer is now.
Finish the adventure Elynn’s Quest to continue.
Although not trained with it, Elynn wields the hammer like a true champion.

During her coming-of-age ceremony, Elynn's sisters were taken by Hokan Ashir's forces. She has hunted them for years, obsessed like Malacay was with finding the power of the Materia Prima. If we can find the Hollow Guard their essences are trapped in, Hirin can finally ferry the sisters to Mor Duin, where they can rest in peace.
Find Hokan's Hollow Guards and disable them.
Elynn was rather fond of her sisters. Abitha and Hazel trained her in combat, while Nevena and Willow helped her gain the swiftness she now displays in every fight.
Find the Shrine and give the sisters one last honoring!
Elynn Seltris

You turn your attention to the Hollow Guard. Inside its carcass you see a faint glow and you spend some time prying it open. It is a soulstone. The meaning of the commander's words is realized. Elynn's sisters were killed so that Hokan could power his new toys.
We should free this soul.

Philo is bound to a stone slab when the ritual begins.\n\nYou consult Horrucs' tome and your own records one more time, meticulously following every step. When you raise the soulstone to the boy's head a dark smoke pours from him, coming from every pore. You realize: This is what killed Horrucs.
Soon you will be free, Mathu'Gar.

You flee from the room, magically sealing it behind you. A dark and throaty scream picks up, louder with every passing second. It crests in a shrill shriek, shaking through the tower walls. Then the world is silent.
Are you alive?
Elynn's Quest
Philo's Quest

Windholme
Grey Dusk Vale

Looking at the grave wounds of your ally, you know it is beyond your skills to heal them.\n\nBut there was an old hermit – a friend of your master – who is said to possess knowledge of a ritual that can return anyone from the brink of death. Perhaps that is the chance your brave champion needs to survive.
I should seek him out.
The old man lifts up a slightly worn sheet stained with wine, nodding.\n\n"Pay me for the vellum and a good bottle and you shall have the spell."
Of course, here you are.
I cannot pay what you ask.
He takes the coin and starts scribbling on the sheet furiously, eventually handing it to you.\n\n"Study it. I am sure it will provide what you need."
Thank you. I will make haste.
Back from the brink
Campsite
Campsite
In the fight's aftermath, you realize that the innkeeper has rifled through Lore's posessions to collect his debt.
The gall of the man.

You order a hempen rope to be lowered into the pit to the deranged prisoner, which he grabs and holds onto for dear life.\n\nThe moment his head crests the lip of the pit, he jumps off the wall with inhuman strength. Immediately, he dashes off and runs for the horizon, not caring that his feet are already bloody.
Oh no! Not again! Catch him!
After him! Quickly!

Even as injured as she is, Yngrid picks herself up, and then picks up Thoradin too, growling through her teeth.

"Go home, Thoradin! It is not going to happen, and the sooner you accept that... the happier you will be. Go. Home!"

With that, she pushes him away, watching him run for the Windfall Mountains as she collapses on Whiskey.
Let's get you to a healer.
Let's get you to a healer.

Yngrid falls to her knees as Thoradin runs for the Windwall Mountains, Whiskey chasing him away from the fight.\n\n"He... He won't return again," Yngrid growls before she collapses. "He'll be... too ashamed to call me wife now."
Back off! We're leaving!
[gold][igold:c][/] {value}
Juss come back, when you got some... he replies. "I'll get you that axe... assess... the damn card!.
We will see.
Do you really want to cancel this production? All progress will be lost!

Rest now. Your time here has ended.
This won't be our end! Run!
{value:c+-}
You return to the main path, once again faced with a decision about where to go.\n\nThe pool, the cave in, or towards the glow?
Let's try to cross the pool.
The monster could have caused the collapse.
Let's follow the glow.

Awoken by the sounds of fighting, the villagers come running with torches and makeshift weapons. Those you fought - nothing more than forest animals whose eyes glint in the dark - take off.\n\nYour troops have been bested, but the mystery is solved. The villagers make sure to send their thanks to your tower.
What a waste of time.
Wisps are ethereal creatures of pure magic that can meld into an Allfire Source.
Finish {Amount} Researches
Guardians! How should I open those doors? I see neither lock nor crack. Only solid stone, and those ever-present golems. I do wonder what their purpose might be.
Yngrid Firemead
Dwarven Explorer

A lone dwarf, Yngrid Firemead, and her pet mole, Whiskey, approached me today.\n\nYngrid seeks a mysterious key promising great power to those who find the fitting lock. She hasn't told me all she knows, but neither has she lied yet. I will watch that one.
Dwarves

Reproduction rates are low among dwarves, and it is customary for them to be partnered at birth. For this, the girl’s family often secures a large endowment. Yngrid’s escape from this patriarchal system shows an enterprising spirit. I shall make sure she can defend her freedom at my side.
After deciphering the glyphs, the golems' purpose is clear. They are vessels for those of sufficient magical talent and skill to open the doors.
Now that we can open it, return to the cave and finish Yngrid's Quest.
A Shapers’ temple. Magnificent! An architectural wonder, fashioned by powerful magic!
Philo Heath
Mathu'Gar
Philo is merely a boy. Despite this, there is a shadow in his eyes that he is trying to hide. I know not what he is guarding so closely, but I will try to get to the bottom of it.
A demon manifested in Philo's body – Mathu'Gar – has revealed itself to me. Whatever spell was cast on Philo, it evolved into a curse of horrible magnitude.
I wonder what his notes will yield. If I study this tome I might be able to help seperate Philo and Mathu'Gar!
Horrucs' book is a curious thing. He was a mage and purportedly a harsh master. I wonder what his notes will yield.
'... and thereby deduce that the last possible course of action could be to use a soulstone. This would be a difficult, risky solution, especially with such a frail and delicate...'
Attack of Opportunity
Retaliate
Isgrimm The Smith
Fall back. We need to build our strength.
It's still not enough. Fall back!
The Ritual
Other than the aforementioned soulstone, I am unsure as to how the demon can be extracted from Philo's body without killing both. It will be a strenuous task to find a way, but I am curious to try.
One of these will be needed to separate the Demon from the boy.

I have discovered a ritual site that should provide me with all necessities to separate the demon from the boy. If my calculations are correct, I will soon need to choose whom to save and whom to discard.
I was not strong enough after all. Mathu'Gar and Philo's souls remain intertwined. Without the Allfire's might, I see no possible way of separating them.
Forest Guide

Ianna sends you a missive shaped like a small flower, which turns into a bird when you touch it. It sings with a melodic voice.\n\n"I like you. I really do. In my view others should like you too!"
What a nice gesture.

A colorful paper bird lands on your windowsill with a message from Ianna.\n\n"It's horrible! Horrible!" the bird pipes shrilly. "These despicable minstrels are besmirching my good name and insulting me with their vicious mockery! They're not far from you. I'm sure you wouldn't deny me a small favor? After all I've done for you? Find these... hacks and punish them for me!"
I will not be made your executioner.
They will suffer for this insult to you!
I wouldn't have thought you so... heartless! Not helping a damsel in distress... Surely it's going to ruin your reputation in this civilized society!
Damsel in distress? Hardly!
A Bard's Tale
An emissary tells you of a sudden turn in your relation to their city. It appears Ianna came to the city's leaders in their dreams, speaking to them of you.
She will not stop her meddling...
Your reputation is starting to exceed mine. We can't have that, can we? I'm sure you don't want to compete with me?
She is easily angered...
I am very disappointed. I thought you were more deserving of my gifts. But I will show the world who you really are! They'll see your true colors and the land shall close its doors to you!"
What is the meaning of this?
I see you are an artificer yourself! Why not barter then? If you give me one of your glyphs, I will give you my notes on them in return and we will both benefit.
Here, a Lesser Glyph of the Bowman.
I am working on a new weapon, something large and mobile, the forges are running hot. But I'm still in need of more ore to smelt. Hand some over and you'll have my respect.
Take my Adamantinum then.

I have no glyphs to share with you.

Although you did slay the beast poisoning the water, leaving it in the cave proves to be a poor choice. The village's water gets worse over the next couple of days, and although they'll recover with time, there are no cheers for your hard work.
We better move on.
You are coming a little too close for comfort. Keep away from my ores.
Of course we will.

Above your servants working the scattered rocks to extract the ore, a giant bronze mask suddenly appears in the sky and a deafening voice bellows: "This is mine! Leave or die!".\n\nThe sound of heavy feet echoes in the distance.
Isgrimm!

The growls of numerous beasts echo across the gap between you and Gor, the only orc in the Circle of Mages and a master of shape shifting.

From the shadows of a nearby tree, two yellow eyes gleam at you. You begin to make out words in the growling.

"You are treading dangerous terrain, mageling. Best keep your distance. My beasts are always hungry and I will not deny them a meal."
Is that a threat?
Many a creatures’ howls, snarls and other, less identifiable, noises reach your ears.\n\n"My beasts have taken up your trail." Gor warns. "They will never forgive your intrusion!"
Then we kill them quick!
We better run!

A deep growl resounds all around you, announcing Gor’s presence. A pair of glowing yellow eyes and sharp fangs appear in the air, floating before you.\n\n"You have Zarach's Banner in your possession. Hand it over. I have need of it."
You shall have it.
I will not let go of this artifact.

I will not be extorted!
A shame. I saw promise in you. Well, perhaps you just need to be disciplined and shown your place?
And she is gone again...
Pah. You will soon learn that your ways cannot lead you far, if you keep pushing away good opportunities.
I will make sure to remember your lesson.
Undertaker
Counterattack
Intimidating Attack
Flee for your lives!

Dozens of bugs overrun the inn. People scream as they flee and most are run down and consumed where they fall.\n\nIt seems the infestation that has been plaguing Goldenfields for some months now has not quite been dealt with yet.
May the Guardians have mercy.
Let's see if there is anything less dangerous to take.
Touch nothing else, just in case! Let's go.

One by one, the men awaken from their stupor. They are all horrified, groaning and weeping, burying their heads in their hands.

"It was... as though we were slaves to the statue's will," one says. "And... all it wanted w-was... blood!"

Some time passes before they whisper and mutter their thanks, then all trudge home to recover.
Corrupt a [unexplored]Primordial Hex[/] and summon several units of [mUnit] [unit]local wildlife[/] to aid your cause.
Corrupt a [unexplored]Primordial Hex[/] to gain an assortment of plant ingredients.

Increases the yield from mining ore.
A helpless cry escapes the woman's lips. She stretches out to catch you, but the undead are already too close. They rip her to pieces in moments.
Hurry, or we'll be next!
Nothing can be done to save the woman's leg, but it is rebandaged, and she is stabilized.\n\nShe awakens after some time, thanks you properly, and takes up a branch to walk back to her village.
It is good we arrived in time.

She gives you a weak smile and her eyes flutter. As she goes to speak, they droop again, but this time do not open. As she gives her last breath, you feel a warmth like a hand on your shoulder, strengthening your resolve.
Rest in peace.
We will stay with you in your final moments.
Her pockets don't hold much, but you come away a little richer.
We should leave.

Frozen
This units movement on the strategic map is hindered.
Guardian Mend
Guardian's Blessing
Summon a Guardian Spirit that can protect your soldiers in combat or meld with sources of Allfire, granting you control over them.

The Shaikan haven't been seen outside their city Shaikur since the War of the Six Races two centuries ago. They hire themselves out as mercenaries on rare occasions, but never seek contact with outsiders. This woman must be quite desperate to reach out to you.
What brings you here?
The warrior holds back an impatient look and nods.
Tell me more about these constructs.
Who are the Shaikan again?
Why do you need a mage for your search?

She stares into a distant memory, her thumb brushing one of her curved blades.\n\n"They look like armor come to life, shining with unholy light. Hollow Guards, my sisters called them. I heard of similar creatures serving the Purity centuries ago."
The Purity? Their servants were destroyed! I don't think any remain.
I have more questions.
I know what I saw! They exist, she replies with steel in her voice. "My sisters were not simply swallowed by the earth. Will you help me?"
Why do you even need a mage?

She gives you a curious look but slowly says, "We are born of the blood of dragons." More confidently and proudly she adds, "We're the greatest warriors in all Fiara. Our swords serve only the most worthy!"
So... expensive mercenaries. But why come to me?
Right. I have more questions.

Elynn stiffens, taking a deep breath.\n\n"He refused me," she admits. "I offered my services but he would not help me. This page... I took it from his study. He was investigating the Hollow Guards and I recognized the drawings. I cannot go to another Circle mage now, lest they find out where I got it from." Her voice trails off and she stares straight at you.
I agree to your offer. Welcome Elynn of House Seltris.
I have enough trouble as it is. I want no part in this.

As you shift your attention back to the stone structure, you sense something. A sort of... fluency?\n\nThe Shapers were famed for their great skill in transforming the very fabric of Eo. Perhaps this strange stone here was created by them? If so, it might be malleable with enough magic.
Command the lid to open.
I will need more Mana to attune to the substance.

At your command the lid and the chains that bind it melt into fluids, parting from on top of the sarcophagus in rippling waves until they collapse to the floor and harden there, creating a platform of rock and metallic veins around an open casket.
Astounding. The Shapers must have been great arcanists!
Perhaps I can bend it to my will?
We cannot face a force like this!

Elynn glares at the dying man, her eyes filling with hatred.

"We are more than just a mage's playthings," she spits through her teeth. "Who can say what Janus Malacay intended when he mixed his blood with the dragon's, but we are not defined by him! Whatever Hokan wants, whyever he enslaved my sisters..."

She hesitates, anger turning to fear and confusion as she looks at the undead form of the Hollow Guard. "Do you... do you hear that?"
Hear what?
You shatter the stone. The air seems to whisper as its glow dissipates. Is it, perhaps, a thank you from Elynn's sister?
Hirin guide you. Let's free the others.
Release the souls to Hirin.
Both crystals are crushed, lighting up the ground with bright blue light that quickly fades to nothing. You think you hear a sigh of relief breeze past on the wind.
Be at peace now.

Hokan's troops do not seem to care whose magic it is that makes the ground and roots shift around to keep the griffon pinned tight to the earth. They take their victory and run to the aid of their allies, chasing the griffons away.\n\nThe Hollow Guard is disabled before the last of the griffons is dealt with. The soldiers quickly set about trying to work out how to transport it away.

The group of entertainers have set up a number of colorful tents. You catch a raucous tune coming from them. A song about a drunken bar maid and her nightly endeavors. It's a vulgar song, but entertaining, and laughter carries from across the camp.
Kill them all.
You have mocked Lady Ianna for the last time, miscreants!
A nice tune. What's it about?

Shortly after your victory, Ianna the Singar appears radiantly before you.\n\n"What a mundane punishment. It lacks elegance. It's boring. And now they're all dead, who is going to sing about me? I'm disappointed in your lack of creativity."
The music and singing die down and the troupe exchanges looks of fear at your approach.\n\n"W-wait! What? Who are you? What is this about?"
For your transgression, your instruments shall never play melodiously again!
Henceforth, your drinks will turn to ashes when you play.
But you said...ah, never mind.
We're writing a song for Janna, our favorite tavern owner. She knows it's all in good humor. We want to surprise her for her birthday!
You were mocking Ianna the Singer, were you not?
A simple misunderstanding. I’ll let you live then.
Be that as it may, Ianna wants you punished.

When they've moved on, Ianna sends you the apparition of a radiant bird, emitting laughter like a hundred crystal bells.\n\n"Glorious! How glorious! I really enjoy your artistic side. My thanks. That was quite entertaining!"
I am pleased you liked it.

Gratefully, the entertainers quickly break camp and leave, promising to tell everyone of your mercy.\n\nSoon later, an image of Ianna appears in your tower. She gives you no chance to explain before she launches into a tirade about how little her honor means to you, and how you were fooled by the minstrels' gilded tongues. She vanishes in a huff before you get out a word in reply.
But they-! Ah... Never mind.
Some of them laugh at your threats, but look incredulously at their instruments when every note they play sounds like a cat screeching.
Let's see them play that song now.
They are horrified - too scared to even question you. Hastily, they break camp, hurrying to get as far away from you as possible.
That ought to do the trick.
Earth Armor Elixir
[health]Full[/] [mHealth]

The shrine to Hirin lies a little off the path, a somber stone structure sitting silently near a crop of trees.

Elynn marches towards it with purpose, but suddenly stops and stares. "See that? There is movement there!" She glides forward, her blades at the ready.

"Undead!" she hisses. "Defiling the sacred place!"
Cleanse the shrine of this evil.
We shall return with more troops.

As you approach, you notice a strange mark branded into the foreheads of the dead. A glyph or a sigil?

"That is Raith Skaddar's foul sign," Elynn spits. "He has been disturbing Hirin's sacred places for some time now. Not this one!"

She storms towards the dead, who all turn as one towards you. A dark mist suddenly engulfs the area, seeping forth from the shrine.
We really must discuss your discipline...
Elynn, get back here! We're leaving.
Elynn glares at you with contempt. "Why would we shun this battle? Do you take me for a weakling?!"\n\nFor a moment you consider an angry retort but this is not the place to squabble.
Don't worry. We will return.

Convert a plant into an ore vein. The quality of the vein is determined by the region.

Do you really want to cancel the current spell casting?\nInvested [mMana] will be refunded.
Oh, boo! You're supposed to be a good sport, killjoy! The apparition vanishes with a puff of smoke, and the stench of sulfur permeates your tower.
Ianna appears before you shrouded in a dark mist.\n\n"I'm bored," she whines. "Let me play with your soldiers a bit. I want to lift my mood."
They are yours to do with as you please.
I will not hand you my troops for entertainment.

When your troops return some time later, they are more than a bit disturbed. You may never know what scarred them, but Ianna is elated.\n\n"That was the most fun I've had in aaaaages! I knew you'd be worth keeping around!"
There are limits...
I am glad you feel sufficiently entertained.
Removes all negative status effects
Poisonous Touch
Blood Explosion
You have helped me out once before. Do it again and I will make sure to reward you.
Have this Adamantinum.
Take that Mountain Copper.
I can provide Sky Iron.
I cannot give you any.
Give us all your valuables.
Week of the Swallow
The week when the swallows return, sometimes carrying coconuts.
I request your help for the last time. If you can provide me with aid, I shall reward you grandly.
Adamantinum I guess? Take it.
This is the last of it. Take this Mountain Copper.
I am willing to give you this Sky Iron.
I cannot provide either at the moment.
You deserve my respect indeed. My moles sniffed this out for you, enjoy your present.
I am honored and curious to see what it is.
I appreciate the alliance. My moles found a vein, may it prove useful to you.
A meagre help, but I take what I can. This is for you, it might help in your endeavors just as much as you have helped me.
Let's see what this is.
We should check it out immediately.

A sound like a large bell announces a missive from Isgrimm in the shape of a metal mask appearing.\n\n"Greetings. I have a task for you. I need something fetched from the Granite Dwarves in Norgate. Retrieve it and you will significantly rise in my regard.".
What do they hold of value to you?
I am not your messenger. Find someone else to do it.
This spell will instill a sense of stone and earth equalling the most experienced of dwarves on anyone, making climbing a mountainside feel like a mere stroll.\n
Isgrimm taught some of his apprentices how to bind the destructive power of elemental fire into any kind of weapon. One of them told me the secret.\n
By harnessing the powers of the life in all of Aonir's creation, one can heal the gravest of wounds.\n
The Circle has invented a method to grant the less enlightened a glimpse of the insight derived from the Allfire, greatly enhancing the target's wisdom and experience.\n
Protective spirits called forth guard your banners against your enemies.\n
You don't look like a common messenger.

Ah, apologies. I forget my manners. I am Rengar Storme’s daughter, lord of the Westguard, she says.

That does explain her bearing. But her pride is tempered by something else. Sorrow, maybe? Regret?

"I urge you to listen to me," she continues. "The Purity has spread. They are hunting anyone practicing magic.
I remember them. The war in Nortander decades ago?

Lytra nods.

"After Tahar drove them from Nortander, they fled to the Highmark and bode their time. Now, with the king sick and nobles at each others' throats, they are gaining strength again.

They have declared a crusade. Heed my warnings. They intend to capture you and subject you to their cruel rituals."
And why would you get involved?
You seem very well informed about their plans.
They recently came into possession of an artifact from the time of the Shapers which I would like to study. It is a long standing interest of mine.
I will make haste.
I will not do your work for you.

You would not do me that small favor? Well, consider whom you are dealing with.
#Isgrimm Rep 2 Adventure 4.a8c60b59-ff6c-45d4-a36b-af5c90327278;I never did.
#Isgrimm Rep 2 Adventure 4_2.7315ac85-4f47-48ea-b08b-a67aabb26739;Isgrimms favor
#Isgrimm Rep 2 Adventure 4_2.6d41119c-deaf-497e-9876-eb1087692f01;You cannot even begin to understand how Isgrimm got to know about this secluded fort, for it is almost invisible against the grey and white of the stones and snow.\nFrom your vantage point you can see that the entrance is guarded well.
#Isgrimm Rep 2 Adventure 4_2.ee0ba7a1-4f75-4706-89ad-6baa8e56611d;I will try to bribe the guards.
#Isgrimm Rep 2 Adventure 4_2.458db7f4-f944-4f36-bdb0-59588e508f68;We scare them with undead during the night, that should make an ambush easier.
#Isgrimm Rep 2 Adventure 4.392a4782-8361-4fe4-a0d5-8b3cbbfd655e;Why not send your own people?
#Isgrimm Rep 2 Adventure 4.f79336e4-ec10-4198-9476-6f0b29bd67d1;I had a falling out of sorts with them decades ago, but dwarves don't let go of a grudge easily. I cannot risk being seen to be involved in this lest we create an uproar."
And what is it I should retrieve?
I will send my people.
And why not get it yourself?
I will not risk my people for your cause.
With a well timed bolt, we might be able to cause a rockslide, the perfect diversion.

The guards spring into alert as soon as you step out of hiding. They look suspicously at the offered gold.\n\n"You think that will be enough to let us forget about you? Pah, you'll have to offer more than that, dirty intruders."

Come nightfall, you stand ready at the edge of the fort. The torchlight of the guards flickers in the wind as the first undead rise. Against your expectations, the dwarves to not run away, but rather chase behind them, trying to slay them.
Random seed
Try load from clipboard. Format should be 'xxxx,xxxx,xxxx,xxxx,xxxx'

When the thieves arrive, they seem slightly bemused at the fact that the camp lies completely empty of the wolves that chased them off, but the woman gives you an impressed nod.\n\n"Not bad, not bad. Well, if there's any risk of the beasts returning, let's get this over with. What'll it be? Gold or ingedients?"
We'll take some coin. Pleasure doing business with you.
Ingredients are fine. Best of luck with your delivery.
I think we'll take everything you have. To arms!
Betrayers! I will not forget this slight! Retreat!
Oh, we will make you regret this! Attack!

When the band gets to the camp, they seem slightly surprised to find no dead wolves about. The woman chuckles and claps grinning at you.

"Clearing the camp without a single drop of blood. I'm impressed. Of course, it makes our job harder, but... so be it."

She smiles maliciously, taking out her daggers.

The band that led you to the camp positively grin at the sight of the battlefield, looking over the dead wolves and your tired troupe with glinting eyes.

The woman takes out her daggers, tossing one up in the air as she smirks at you.

"Well, thank you for making it easier for us. We'll be taking your supplies from here, I think."
You can certainly try. Kill them!
Betrayal! We must flee!
Killing the thieves is absolutely nothing to you. Rummaging through their things, you find a few useful items, but you are sure to take their thieves guild token too, just in case.
A pleasure doing business with you indeed.

The loud thuds of weapons and aggravated orcish cries have drawn you close to a totem dedicated to the renegade Guardian, Zarach.

Two groups are pitted against each other there. Ironstorm Clan orcs are fighting Gor’s troops.

Helping either could prove valuable to one, and dangerous to the other.
Zarach's Totems
Gor is sure to reward us for our help. Charge!
Defend the Ironstorm Clan!
I want to see how this plays out. Stay hidden.

Gor appears in the image of a giant beast, calling for the totem to be destroyed.

"Let our victory be followed by many more! Tear down this forsaken place. No shrine to Zarach shall stand!"

"And you, mage!" The apparition growls as it turns towards you. "You helped rid Fiara of Zarach’s idols. You have my gratitude."
I am sure Zarach had it coming.
Though your troops are lost, you bring Gor’s warriors enough time to turn the fight in their favor.
I hope it was worth it.

The Ironstorm Clan’s leader approaches you with a respectful nod.\n\n"You stood at our side without fear, as a true warrior. Gor has called for a crusade against Zarach’s followers and seeks to destroy his shrines. He must not be allowed the blasphemy! Thank you for helping us defend our shrine!"
I am glad to have helped.
Though you sacrificed your troops for their victory, with your aid the Ironstorm Clan is able to turn the battle in their favor.
A costly victory.
Back away carefully. This isn't worth it.
Mining the {what} grants you
Harvesting the {what} grants you
You receive
Exploring the {what} you find:
the
the
After a quick but bloody battle, Gor emerges as the victor. You watch him order the totem to be destroyed before leading his troops away.\n\nThere is nothing more to be gained from remaining here.
We should be careful never to anger Gor.
One of your soldiers wedges a length of wire into the lock. No one believes it will work, but to your amazement, the lock is actually beaten.
Incredible! Take what you can and let's go.
{who} is displeased with you due to violating their border.
Volley
Eagle Spirit
Eagle Spirit
Drink Eagle Spirit
Behind you, from the tower, you hear a horn sound. They have finally realized their mistake, it seems, and are sending out guards to find their missing prisoner.
We can deal with them later.
The fight proves to be hard. Many a ghastly monster comes up against you. In the end, they cannot prevail.\n\nWhen Gor's minions are bested, your soldiers begin to cheer.
Not so mighty anymore, are we Gor?
Change Spellcasting
Do you really want to change the spell being cast?\nInvested [mMana] will be refunded.

But of course. You have much to learn, if you want to become one of us, young mage, but you show great talent and that is rare to find.\n\nAnd with that, Undergast's magic vanishes, leaving you to claim what you can find in his sanctum.
So, he wanted me to fight him?

Eagle Eye

Piercing Shot

She is silent for a moment but looks at you with sadness.\n\n"I wish it didn't have to come to this but my personal feelings should not interfere with what is right. If we do not act, who knows what evil he and the Purity will bring about. It must be done. It is only proper I should be the one to do it."
I respect your conviction. We march on Rengar Storme!
You should at least talk to him first.
Thank you for helping me right this wrong, she says, mounting her horse. "We must strike quickly, before he can gather his troops."
To the Westguard!

She ponders your words for a moment then nods slowly.\n\n"I doubt he will see reason, or relinquish his reign so easily. But you are right. If we can prevent more bloodshed, we should at least try. I will send a message for him to meet me on neutral ground."
Good luck!

Rengar's eyebrows shoot up, a bemused smile curling around his lips.\n\n"I dismissed reports of you leaving the Purity. Of you joining a sorcerer, of all people. It surely couldn't be my own flesh and blood betraying our cause like this, could it?" His face turns hard. "It seems I was wrong. I raised you in the light and this is your choice? You are no longer my daughter, Lytra. I denounce you!"
Hilt Bash
Unit is Incapacitated and cannot Attack
Hiltbash
Teleport to a random position next to an enemy in {range}, attack it once and [skill]Guard[/] afterwards.
So be it. A price I will gladly pay.
This isn't you speaking, father. Listen to me...

Father, the Purity has poisoned your mind against anyone who opposes their false creed. I am still your daughter! Raised by you to serve justice and righteousness! To respect the Guardians and follow their teachings! The Purity offers nothing but...

"The Purity offers salvation!" The large man stands and shouts. "It is you and your mages that will bring damnation to us all. Their kind almost destroyed the world once. They will do so again unless we stop them!" He breathes heavily, slowly regaining his posture.

"I can see you will not be swayed. You always were stubbon as a mule. So, you have a choice now. Leave, or fight against your own father for that sorcerer of yours. What shall it be?"
I will not have your family's blood shed for me.
We must end this here and now.
Lytra turns stiffly, leaving the inn watched by the soldiers stationed around the place.\n\n"We have no choice but to fight," she says in a low voice. "But we may choose the field of battle."
If that's so, let's attack now.
We had no choice.
Leave the place. We will face him later.
Wait. I know this story. But it's different!
How thankful are you? Is there a reward?

Wait! The sitting skeleton raises his free hand with a few clicks. "I mean no harm! I was only here to stop my father causing chaos!"\n\n"He only wanted to protect us, but we have been trapped in his keep for many a long year because of his foolish vows. Thank the Guardians you have dealt with him! It was going very poorly! And now I can be with my love again!"
I... wait... I thought you were prisoners of your father?
Well then, how much of a reward is there for freeing you?

I am certain you would sob too, if you were stuck like this for hundreds of years! Away from the one you love, with a caring, peaceful father driven mad by the torment of time. Trapped as a skeleton! A skeleton!
I suppose that is quite tragic.
Such is the way of curses.
How gracious. Let's have a look around.

Please! Take whatever you want from this tower as thanks! Now, I will lie down to rest as well. My love awaits me, and I have much lost time to make up for.\n\nWith a stark, cold breath of air, the skeleton collapses back, once again lifeless.
Why were you sobbing?

You retell the story you have heard of this place, and an eerie chuckle escapes the skeleton's skull.\n\n"You aren't the first to come here with such a story. Just the first to open the door. From my understanding, the people who despised us dragged my father's name through the mud. He was a kind and loving soul once, and we were happy here."
It is good to hear you were happy.
Heavy Blows
Focusburn
Toxic
This unit belongs to the New Purity and has:
This unit is a Titan and has:
Wing Cutter
More undead! Kill them!
But why were you sobbing?
How unfortunate that he was driven mad.
Good fortune! We must be on our way.
Settings Applied
We really must be off.
Sadly, we can't. Enjoy the party.

The party goes on long into the night, and then into the next morning. Many villagers do not even make it home, collapsing onto benches and chairs in or outside of the inn. One wakes up on the roof, surrounded by the village's cats, one wakes up in the church, wearing a stranger's clothes. One even wakes up in a jail cell with one of the local guards, neither with any memory of how they got there.\n\nYou find several minor ingredients missing from your kit, but the party that came from them will go down in legend.
Totally worth the hangover.
Fine. Have it your way.

The dead keep dancing to the rhythm you set with your hand, and slowly but surely, the villagers ease out of their panic. It would be difficult to say that they're ever entertained by your stunt, but violence is avoided, and before you set out on your journeys once more, you lay the dead back down to rest.\n\nIt is safe to say you will not be forgotten here in some time.
So be it. Onwards!
Attack the target and heal for [bonus] 50% of the damage done [/]
Finish up here first.
Focus on the spiders!
Harvest what you can. We're leaving.
You take what materials you can find from the dead spiders and the empty cocoons, and all the while, the screams die to a whisper, and then nothing at all.
The militia will pay well for this. Come!
What were you even doing here?
Oh, I was stupid! Thought I could take on one spider. But, heh, it wasn't just one!
Mm. Well, keep your coin.
Well... thank you for the coin.
Let them go then.

Without warning, extreme pressure begins to build up in your head. You almost topple over when a disembodied voice echoes through your tower. You recognize it as Undergast's.\n\n"I sympathize with your eagerness to amass knowledge, but you are beginning to annoy me. Tread carefully or no magical knowledge in the world will save you. This is your final warning."
I must have angered him.

A familiar pressure takes hold of your head and a sharp pain makes you wince. Looming large, Undergast's face appears in a fog before you.\n\n"You have pushed your luck too far! I have warned you to cease your foolish endeavors. Now my soldiers will punish you for your insolence!"
This turned quickly...
Bite Off
Bite Off
Is there some reward for all this work?
Let's leave. The owners might return any minute.

With a strong smell of lavender, Ianna's image appears before you, her visage almost too radiant to behold.\n\n"I am impressed with your audacity and dedication to your goal. But there can be too much of a good thing. An inferior should always know their place. Stop antagonising me or you shall rue it."

So you WANT to see me angry? Oh, my little plaything, I think you underestimate my wrath. That is a mistake you'll only have the chance to make once. I will make sure the others know how obstinate you are and my minions shall mete out my punishment.
Do what you must.
Walk on. This doesn't concern us.
Volley
Elven Archery
Shield Wall
Shield Wall
Subdue
Rally
Mountain Guide
Aonir's Smile
Aristocrat
You fight your way through the fog, turned around in meaningless direction until you find yourself on a high mountain, overlooking the fog below you.

You suddenly feel as though a large beast has laid eyes on you. It is only when you hear Gor’s voice in your head that you understand.\n\n"I have been patient with you little pest, but it seems you do not mind my anger. Nor the punishment that comes from disobedience. I think it is time to remind you of the first warning you received from me."
This does not sound good.

A warg’s howl and the palpable sound of tearing flesh echoes in your head, warning you of Gor’s presence.\n\n"Do you know what happens when a disobedient pup snaps at the alpha? I think it is time you learned."
Uh oh...

Noticing your arrival, a man steps out from behind the cart, carrying a large bottle of shimmering blue liquid. He looks bewildered for a moment, then a smile shows you his black, rotting teeth.\n\n"Ho there, travelers! I'm Derrek! Would you like to buy some wares? The greatest magic in all Alluvyan! Or, would you perhaps help me fix my wagon?"
What have you got in stock?
We can help fix your cart.
What happened to your teeth?!
You best hope not.
Go. Go already!

Derrek and his outlaws are slightly dumbfounded as all of you just keep walking without engaging them.\n\n"But... but we threatened you!" Derrek shouts after you. "Mark my words, stranger! You best hope we never see you again!"
We'll see about that, Derrek.

A bronze dwarven mask appears and announces in a booming voice:\n\n"I have asked you to leave me to my labor. Yet you continue to involve yourself in my affairs. Do not get between me and my goal! This is my last warning! You do not want the dwarven people aligned against you."
Is it too late to apologize?
Are you still threatening people for sweets?
These are the last rations I'm giving you.
No more gold after this.
Just keep them talking. I have a sneaking suspicion...
Let me take care of this...
Good job, Nuvian.

The robbers pay no attention to Nuvian flicking their fingers about in a subtle spell that leaves every robber's eyes on them.

"You don't want to take our sweeties," they call out to all. "You want to go home - rethink this life choice."

Without so much as another word, every robber packs up their weapon and makes ready to go. Derrek scratches his head, puts his hand to his teeth and then gives his hand a worried look, turning to join his group as they drag the wagon away.
So you want us to kill you then? Fine.
Fine, you want more? Take it. We are just trying to avoid unnecessary harm.
Show no fear and strike them down!
Their eyes bulge at the offered amount and without further question, the dwarves step aside.
Quick, inside.
We'll go and get you more gold then.
Not what I had in mind but a chance never the less. Quick, inside.
The guards you had thought gone have returned to their posts and are now looking quite shocked, as you exit the building.
Defend ourselves!
A rain of bolts follow your departure and some of your troops get wounded in the process.
Hurry, we have to bring some distance between us!

As the snow and sleet rolls down just to the side of the building, covering parts of its left side in the process, the guards run inside, seeking shelter. As soon as the rumbling of the mountain stops, they return with shovels and pick axes to clear the way again.
This is our sign, storm inside!

The inside of the fort is well decorated with artwork from many centuries ago and you are faced with an abundance of books, reports, maps and scrolls, some unreadable, some in foreign languages. \nIt takes some time, but you are able to find the required documents for Isgrimm - a lavish leather bound book. \nThe content speaks of recipes for an artificer.
Time to go.
The granite dwarves take back what you took in Isgrimms name and make sure to fortify their location further. Now there is no entering anymore.
Isgrimm will be quite angry to hear we lost...
Isgrimms troops reconvene with you at an agreed upon place.\n\n"Hand over what you brough us, and we'll be on our way."
Here you are, the knowledge Isgrimm is seeking.
We decided to keep it instead.
Then fear the wrath of Isgrimm!
Never!

Try as you might, you find no proof of any trick up Myriel’s sleeves. The townsfolk clamber to buy her charms, keeping her business open all afternoon and into the night. Come morning, the wagons drive away with Myriel smiling over a large sack of gold, heading to the next settlement to con out of coin.
The baron won't be pleased.
You are most welcome.
The baron's guards arrive soon after, taking her into custody.\n\n"Thank you for finally bringing this charlatan to justice, master mage. May the Guardians watch over you."
She does not seem amused...
Lytra should be here to meet her father one last time.

Rengar Storme's camp is surrounded by Purity forces and protected by his own trained griffons too. If you wish to get to him, you will have to go through both. And all are ready for a fight too.

Lytra rides forward nonetheless, shouting across the din: "Face me, Father! One last time, remember the honor of our house! Do not rely on the Purity to fight your battles for you!"

The noise dies down as everyone seems to wait for a reply.
Wait.
Attack now!
You wait some time for a response, your troops growing ever more restless, but there is still no movement from the camp.
Keep waiting.
Don't waste any more time. Attack.
Rengar's camp is as well defended as the last time you were here, griffons circling and ready to strike.
Attack!

Finally, Rengar emerges. He is slumped over, a robed man in the white robe of the Purity at his side.\n\nThe robed figure points at you and Rengar weakly gives the order to join battle. By now, the griffons are more uncertain, giving you an opening.
He is no longer his own master. Let us finish this.

The moment the fighting is done, Lytra races to Rengar's side, practically skidding to a halt by his body. Tears stream down her face as she tries to whisper him back to life. Then, she clutches his hands and buries her head in his chest, sobbing loudly.\n\n"...could you not just have listened?!..." is all you catch between her heaving breaths.
He will find peace now.
Spit Fire

Slowly, carefully, a young, naked boy leans out from behind a tree, grinning at you from ear to ear. He steps forward, one step at a time, looking from soldier to soldier mischieviously.\n\n"You're the first to find my tricks," he says, standing in the middle of the mushroom ring.
That is because they were smart tricks.
You know, you shouldn't trick people like that.

His face turns sour, and he scowls at you.\n\n"But it's fun!" he complains. Then he beams again. "And Zerbo loves fun! Here!" From behind his back, he pulls a bag. "A gift for being the first to find me!"
Thank you. We accept them gladly.
I don't want your gifts, trickster!

Without another word, he tips the bag upside down, and a treasure trove of gold and ingriedients falls onto the floor.\n\nWhen you look up in surprise, the boy has already vanished once more, and it seems not one of your troops saw him disappear.
How strange.

You have no chance to think about changing your mind - the boy releases his hands and claps them together with the force of thunder, blinding you momentarily.\n\nWhen your vision clears, the boy has disappeared, leaving a glowing wisp floating gently in the center of the mushroom ring.
Excellent!
Outstanding!

You watch the boy release his hands, and then clap them together with a roar that sends birds flying from the tree tops. You look all around you as the trees sway with the force, and when you look back, the boy is gone!\n\nIn his stead, a pile of old, dusty books sits silently in the middle of the mushroom ring.
Marvelous!

The boy releases his hands, and with a huge grin claps them together with a force that stuns you for a brief moment. You blink and shake your head, and when your vision is clear, the boy is gone.\n\nBut on the ground in the middle of the mushroom ring, a large mana crystal now glows.
Wonderful!

Before you can say another word, the boy beams and releases his hands, clapping them together with a force that staggers you all!\n\nBy the time your soldiers are back on thier feet, the boy has vanished, leaving a large pot of gold in his place.
And what do we get in return?
x{StackSize}
Bloodlust
Tuck the letter away and explore the ruins.
Let's leave before we push our luck.
Leave the ruins.
Leave the tower.
Nobody make a sound!
We best not move, lest we scare them.
Nobody move. Let them come to us.
Soft footfalls and barely contained giggling get louder and louder, and you smell moss, and fresh cut grass. This is probably what people meant by 'faeries'.
Now! Strike fast!
Boo!
You turn quickly. A young, naked boy is standing behind you. He squeals with joy at your exclamation.\n\n"Haha! Good trick! Did you like mine? Oh, I like this game!"
Who are you? What are you doing here?
Playing such tricks on others could get you into trouble.
I doubt they will share. Let's leave.
You witness the massacre of the people digging through the rubble. Some of them escape, but you have more important things to attend to. The way to the meteor is now clear.
Get to work! Salvage that meteor!
Exploit Poison

The tower seems intact from the front, but rifling through it tells a different story. The entire back wall has been demolished, and a massive skeleton lies broken with its head, chest and arms on the inside, and its lower half on the outside.\n\nThere can be no doubt then that this ancient, forgotten battlefield comes from the War of the Six Races.
No sign of any strange bones though. Let's check elsewhere.

You are organising your soldiers into more efficient search parties when you hear an angry, ethereal howling behind you.\n\nYou turn towards the earthen mound, and too late see that your rifling has awoken a horde of angry ghosts.
Undiscovered
Alright. Let's take the hidden passage.

You have found the HQ of this Faction.
