Not yet. I guess we'll come back later.

The large tent is full of gossips, excited to see a newly discovered species. The flyers passed about have a ghastly creature depicted on them. As you are looking at it, you hear a strange noise in the center of the tent - a creature has entered the room to loud gasps from the audience.\n\nIt is a fever dream come to life, wings, fangs and a horn that twists away from its head. Under Zacharias' careful instructions, it moves, barks hisses and dances. The audience is enthralled.
Alright. That's actually impressive.
No sign of Lady Luck today then.
Well, we found them for you.
But why do you need a mage?
Shaikan? What's that?
Elynn would want to put her sisters to rest herself.
We shall return with her.
Reputation: {LevelName} ({current}/{max})
Ballista Shot
Have our beasts chase it back towards its own territory.
It's sickness cannot affect our undead. They will strike first.
Your undead troops rush forwards, attacking the beast from all sides, managing to pierce its heavy plates.
We better back off for now.
We better retreat for now.
Perhaps we'll come back later.
You find the insects happily feasting upon this year's harvest.
This is it - charge!
We'll return another time.
After regaining your strengths, you approach the wolves once more.
This time you'll go down!
We need more time.
You return to the silo.
Now we'll face these bugs.
Better back off.
You use your magic to collapse every tunnel you can find, suffocating and crushing some of the bugs in the process.
Strike hard!
Cancel Spell

You approach the site that Magistrate Reinhard's people described to you: A circle of large, colorful mushrooms around a clearing in the forest. The scene radiates a strangely peaceful sensation. \n\nYou can see footprints leading deeper into the woods.
Search the clearing for clues.
You finally catch up to the group of elvish thieves, who have set up camp in the forest.
Sneak up on them.
Surround them and attack.
A monster of ice and stone blocks the path ahead. This must be the golem threatening the villagers' safety.
Kill the monsters!
We should avoid this fight.
The wolf hunt
When you finally track the wolves down, the hunters stay by the villagers' side - behind you - claiming it is 'for their protection'.
Let’s show them how it’s done!
Now is not the time to strike.

You reach the so called 'king of the forest', and the hunters urge you to go on without them, smirking confidently.\n\n"Go and slay that beast, if you really think yourself so mighty. He's given many a hard time."
Charge!

You catch up to a large orc war band that seems not to care about the tracks they’ve left behind. Why would they? Gillyshire has almost completely given up on defending itself against the orcs’ ongoing attacks.
Into the Mine
Your brave soldiers quickly turn the battle in your favor. Cornered, the demons are methodically killed.\n\n"This won't be the last you have seen of us, filthy wizard."
The ruthless demons tear through your troops in seconds.\n\n"Next time, bring something more our size. Hahaha!"
In Niethalf's Name
Magic Location
Something smells funny here.

Nuvian glances nervously at the trees.

"Don't you feel it? It's… too serene? There’s an enchantment at work here!"

A shimmer in the air tells you they may be right. But should you send your troops away lest they suffer from its effect?
The center of the clearing shows some strange discolorations on the ground but, other than the footprints, nothing else seems out of the ordinary.
Try to attune to the circle.
I will dispel the enchantment.
The tracks are days old and you follow them for quite some time.
Where were they headed?
As your soldiers look around, a terrible sense of exhaustion overcomes them. Some lie down to sleep while others stumble around with empty stares.
We need to leave now!
Now that you have a sense of the enchantment you can dispel the glimmer hiding whoever cast it.\n\nSuddenly, you spot shapes among the trees – eyes, blinking at you in surprise. The elves!
Strike, before we lose the advantage!
Did you think you can hide from us?
Hello there! We are friends!

The elf looks at you all in confusion.\n\n“What… who are you? How did we get here?” She quickly draws her bow, the others following suit behind her. “Not one step closer,” she threatens. “Explain yourselves! What sorcery is this?!”
She is trying to trick us. Attack!
It is you who cast this enchantment – and stole the books!
My gentle lady, I assure you we mean no harm.
The elves flee, your company decimated.
The hunt is not over.
The elves defeated, you find the books from Sevenkeeps among their possessions.
The library shall be happy to have them back!
What books? I am no thief! she spits, her eyes narrowing. "Leave now and this can still end peacefully!"
I don't think so.
We will leave now, but this isn’t over!
Just give me the books and we will go.

Nuvian approaches the elf with a smile and open arms.

"I think there is some confusion here. We may all have been made fools of. May I direct your radiant eyes to the dusty tomes at your feet? They were stolen from the Royal Academy’s library. We were sent to retrieve them."

The elf slowly looks down and furrows her brow.

“We… we visited the library looking for lore on Elen’s Harp. We… we were led to a chamber containing the books we sort. Then… the next thing I know, we are here and..” she slowly trails off.
I don't care. Hand over the books.
You fell victim to a spell. Are the books cursed?
Apologies. Perhaps we can get to the bottom of this
The elf nods slowly, still confused.\n\n"They are not ours to keep. Take them - we want nothing to do with them. Just make sure they don't harm anyone else."
We shall keep them safe.

I don't think it was the books.” The elf quickly shakes her head, then suppresses a shudder. “It feels more like someone cast a spell on us. Someone in the library… I… I think it was Magistrate Reinhardt.”
#Following the elves 1.e56a0e09-efab-4938-9179-581814bc17f0;We shall look into it. May I take the books?
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.fc53acac-afa5-47f2-bb39-6461aa1da79d;You find a pack of large wolves devouring what looks to be a sheep. They must have stolen it from a nearby farm.
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.cada874c-fa72-4299-8000-3d000b844a0b;Those pests will learn manners now.
Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.116ddd5d-6a00-407d-85ed-1e66bc4e6198;Another time.
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.2c302c88-9c5e-4b41-979e-27a1f173043a;More wolves have joined this pack, which has become wild and unpredictable. No wonder the people of Alluvyan live in fear.
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.cc4e803f-a7da-4727-8982-b089fc123057;Maybe we can coax one to follow us with meat?
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.9c20b7bb-ea3e-4927-a0ff-d66a93d877da;You throw a piece of meat a little further from the sheep. It peeks the interest of one of the wolves, but it seems like one meager piecce is not enough.
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.2a75419a-0148-4789-86e4-381c97113f37;Ambush them!
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.bd9da26e-a800-42cc-85c3-cf2fdc9f7a54;Throw two more, that should suffice.
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.3913c7ac-8ecf-4674-883e-263778de0a37;Their attention still focused on the meat, the wolves do not notice your approach and you are able to wound them before a fight ensues.
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.6fdd2516-7e34-4c9d-a98d-6656c8f1e265;More food does the trick, and one wolf follows the trail of meat all the way to you in anticipation of more while the others disperce.
#Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.38c76180-81ce-45e8-91a9-5dcde92a4aaf;That's right, come with us.
Alluvyan Wolves 1_2.4e75fba8-1ab1-459b-8a1f-b0d86648baa9;Run!
Goldenfields Mills 1_2.445f3e3c-0d2b-48d3-9898-2ca15e7bc5d3;We end this now.
#Rushwater Downs Jelly 1_2.f6a8e548-2c3b-47e1-b5b1-449a76599834;Finding the jellies proves to be easy enough and you watch them for a while, mesmerized by their floating dance.
#Rushwater Downs Jelly 1_2.14ba5678-ed90-4cf6-a33f-3c493bc97aa0;They are native to my homelands, let me handle this.
#Rushwater Downs Jelly 1_2.62e1ffa7-d62c-4ce4-9d63-547c818ea8cd;We better get this lord his meat.
#Rushwater Downs Jelly 1_2.83d9d330-70f1-4316-b32d-fd9461b6098b;You process the meat, separating it from other body parts, before packing it up for delivery.
#Rushwater Downs Jelly 1_2.3b23e4c3-d259-4a3c-9d80-d390da0fd47d;The medusa slithers forward and joins the jellies in their dance. For a moment, their dancing pattern shifts in warning, but Seshi matches their movements with perfection, calming them again. Eventually, she manages to separate one of them from the pack, quickly slicing it up.\n\nThis should suffice, should it not?"
Quite the display!
Let's deliver it quickly, before it spoils.
So, have you finally decided to face us? One of the demonic creatures growls with satisfaction.\n"You won't last long either way."
Retreat!
We'll see about that.
This isn't over, mage!
You're right. Not until you are all dead.
The last elf dead, you find the books they stole but no hint as to why they stole them.
Back to Sevenkeeps for that reward.
The elves defend themselves well, escaping your troops this time.
We will catch them next time then.
We come in peace.
As you step closer, the elves all rise as one and ready their bows. Their eyes empty, they begin their attack without uttering a word.
They are bewitched! Defend yourselves!
Watch them a while.

Your troupe hides in the dense forest to watch the elves.

After a while, a shimmering, violet orb appears in their midst and they all rise as if by command. Then, in unison, they draw their blades and plunge them into their own hearts without hesitation!

In seconds, they have all collapsed to the ground, dead before the violet light disappears.
Rush towards them.
Approach carefully.

The elven leader implores you to come closer with her dying gaze, weakly stretching out a hand to reach you.

She utters one word, barely audible.

“Reinhardt.”
The magistrate? What does that mean?
You find the books among their lifeless bodies, but no clue as what they wanted with them.\n\nWere they silenced to stop you digging deeper into this mystery?
Well, we can return to Sevenkeeps now.

You carefully make your ways towards the camp, slowly coming to realize that no one inside it is moving.

When you reach it, you are harrowed by the sight of a mass of lifeless bodies, bloodied blades still in hand. What... what happened here?!

The books you seek lie in the middle of their macabre circle. Does some curse lie upon them that made them do this?
Better to return the books to Sevenkeeps quickly.
Week of Aonir
Week of the Guardians
Week of Shanna
All units have:
Aonir's creation is filled with renewed energy, strengthening the creation of Mana.
Travelling is blessed by the Guardians, as many seek to visit nearby temples.
Shop prices are changed by {ShopPriceModifier:+-pi}.
Week of Zerbo
Celebrating Zerbo, the Guardian of traders and thieves, shops have their prices reduced.
Week of Niethalf
Celebrating the Guardian of crafting, builders, butchers, bakers and candlestick makers alike pride themselves in increasing their output.
Week of Ereon
The all-seeing Guardian helps those seeking to unearth hidden secrets and objects.
Week of Tiara
The fire-dancing Guardian empowers elemental effects in all battles.
Week of the Spook
Skeletons dance on the horizon and the dead emerge from their graves.
Shanna, gentle Guardian of the suffering, grants her healing touch to all of Aonir's creatures.
Week of Hirin
The Guardian guiding the dead to the next world is said to rest that week, so souls often linger after battle.
Week of Elen
Elen, Guardian of nature, blesses the sacred hunt.
Week of Nor
The renegade Guardian Nor’s machinations bring an aura of darkness to all battlefields.
Quick, out of here!

Your troops break formation and run, and you order a unit to cover the retreat. The bugs overrun them, but for one moment you are free to concentrate on the tracks the insects have left in the fields.
Where is that nest?
You beat them back. When the last of the bugs turn and run, they follow their trail back on itself.
Follow them to the nest!
You come face to face with the large bugs from the ruin again. They are devouring everything in their wake, destroying fields and property.
Kill those pests!
Retreat! There are too many!
You won't walk away unscathed.
This does not bode well, we should leave.
Niethalf commands you leave this place at once.
Empty your pockets and be gone, lest Niethalf grow angry.
You are practically showered with gifts before the dwarves move on, singing and praising Niethalf.
Morally questionable, but financially lucrative.
The dwarves scramble out of your way, and soon they're gone - no doubt spreading the news of Niethalf's avatar, wandering Fiara.
I bet they liked that. Now. The door!
We should leave before they return with a following.
Defend our position!
This is not worth a fight! Run!
More demons have invaded these lands, threatening to kill everything with a pulse.
You catch up to the demons. They have almost reached a field where workers are too occupied to notice their steady approach.
Kill those monsters!
You find the demons idly picking through the corpse of a merchant.
Run you fools! We will make sure you can escape!
The farmers watch with wide eyes as the demons turn on you. Your magic catches the first of their attacks and those you protect run for shelter.
You are showered with thanks for your brave interference but the celebration is cut short by more demons on the rise.
We have to put an end to them.
Shrieks and cries from villagers pierce the air and lead you towards a horde of undead.
I think it is time you return to your resting place.
The undead halt, confused. Your words somehow pierce the simple mind of some, forcing them to drop dead. The rest are too driven by bloodlust.
Now we strike!
The Granite Dwarves' camp is exactly where the delegation told you it would be. Something about that feels slightly off, but you push the thought aside.
Sons of Niethalf, you dared rob your own brethren?
Now is our chance to strike!
Return what you stole from the conclave, or else!

Loud exclamations of wonder erupt from the dwarves. They throw themselves on the ground before the avatar.\n\n"W-we did no such thing! We are honest miners! Oh, Avatar of glorious Niethalf, tell us, will you take us into your ranks? Please! We wish nothing more than to serve you!"
Join us. But you know nothing of the stolen Adamantinum?
If you know nothing of the Adamantinum, you are useless.

Caught off guard by your approach, the dwarves exchange confused looks before answering warily.

"What are you talking 'bout? We did no such thing. Only looking for a place to stay. I swear, the conclave didn't ever like us. They're just spreading lies."

You can see the exhaustion in their eyes and when you take a closer look at their camp, you indeed find many necessities that one wouldn't normally take for a camping trip.
What happened to your homes?
That's all I need to hear. We'll leave you be.
Here, have this. Good luck on your way.
Trolls. Since demons came to Regan Gor, the trolls moved to Norgate. They lay waste to many of our villages, crushing everything in their way. We only want a place to stay, I swear.
We'll leave then.
May Niethalf watch over you.
They shake their heads.\n\n"If the conclave sent you, it was most likely a lie. We might not see eye to eye, but all we want now is a new home. We swear, by the honor of Niethalf."
What about your homes?
I see. We will leave you to it then.
Take this to ease your burden. Good bye.
You find the wyvern tearing through some meat you can't identify.
A landslide should be enough to kill this beast.
I'll make its meal fly to distract it.

The wyvern lets out an angry growl as its dinner floats up into the air and starts flying erratically about. Dizzy from the chase, it doesn't see your troops' quick strike, hurting the beast before the fight ensues.
A mass of stones and sleet quickly end the wyvern's life. You almost feel sorry. The creature looks magnificent, even in death.
Time to deliver.
I changed my mind. You are too dangerous.
Mind your own business. We are leaving.
We will come back later.
Heroes
Alive
Dead
Revives in {turns} turns
The wolves still prowl the village, the children not in sight right now. It is strange behavior. The wolves are clearly on guard, skulking about as if they expect a fight.
Then we shall give them a fight. Charge!
We cannot afford this fight now.
The elves have given up hiding their protection of the Lenya, patrolling the pond with weapons ready to kill.
We must come back with a stronger force.
The time for victory is now! Attack!
I don't have time for this.

You look for the first spells he taught you, carefully flipping the large pages to one of the bookmarks attached to the spine.\n\nYou can indeed make out some of the basics. Others you can almost decipher.
This needs further study!
Let the wisp meld with the node and study it.

You barely manage to avert your gaze from the wondrous energy, so powerful is your desire to delve into the Allfire source.\n\nBut you do restrain yourself, focusing instead on what can be learned from observing the meld.
To hell with the Circle! I will conquer the Allfire!
I refuse to involve myself further in your schemes.
If you are lying to me, you shall regret it.
Guard against incoming attacks
Guard and protect others against incoming attacks.
Cannot guard anymore

You have heard a lot of talk about Royal Academy’s famous library here in Sevenkeeps – a treasure trove of knowledge governed by the Council of Magistrates, which is comprised of humans, elves and dwarves. It is said it holds the greatest collection of books available in Fiara.
Worth a visit!

Your arrival in the Coldmark does not go unnoticed for long. You are greeted with exciting news.\n\n"In our last excavation we came upon ruins. Statues of long lost times, Shaper buildings. Sadly, we had to stop there – strange creatures wander the ruins. But with your help, we might yet learn a thing or two from them."
This could benefit us all. We will deal with them.
A cold mountain wind brushes through the alleyways and gathers coal dust and pebbles on the main streets. The sturdy buildings here seems to squat closely to the ground.

Hundreds of small towers and rooftops jut from the stone of the mountain. Winding streets and tight back alleys give way to great halls and manufactures in the largest dwarven city on Fiara, filled ever with the clanging of hammers in its famous smithies.
The smell of mead is thick in the air of this quiet rural town that is renowned for the honey from its surrounding forests.
The Night Market
Visiting units will receive a [statuseffect][ispellpower:c] blessing[/] once per week.
Shrine
Herbalist
Test Ext 1
Tsty 3
Test 1234
Many tales of Ianna the Singer's spectacular festivities reach you. The Circle mage has astounded people all over Fiara with her banquets and entertainment.
She seems to be quite well liked.

You pass a group of party goers stumbling their way home. They sing, laugh and exchange many fantastical tales of dancing lights, delicious food, gifts and the most wonderful drinks.\n\n"Ianna sure knows how to throw a party! I never experienced anything like it. Her generosity is surely a blessing to all of Fiara!"
I should visit one of these parties.

Runic Armor
The dead have many things to offer but often hide them well. This wide reaching spell makes sure they give up all their wealth willingly after their death. \n
Once bodily pain and exhaustion is no longer a concern, minions can be made to march endlessly.
This useful curse bestows a horrific visage on a creature. Even the bravest warrior's willpower will waver when they face it.\n
Rotting flesh and bones has lost all power of regeneration. But channeling enough necrotic energy can mend broken forms and extend their usefulness.\n

Every city has a few desperate souls ready to escape their bodies. This spell shows them the way. \nThe more popular the necromancer and thus more willing the subjects, the better quality those souls will be.\n

Mortal flesh. 
So weak, so susceptible. 
A simple curse can bring forth all manner of diseases victims may suffer from.
A very convenient way of creating minions, is raising the dead from the graves of freshly buried locals. \nGreat for replacing losses away from your tower, if you can ignore the screaming.\n
A practical application of Raith' theory of the soul's journey, this spell harvests souls before they can be carried away by Hirin.
This incantation calls into the ethereal to call upon the lingering shadows of warriors long gone and binds them to your service.\n
The living tend to be emotional and difficult. This clever formula will kill them and use their fleeting soul to bind it back to their body, forming a fresh undead.\n
This complex curse is layered to spread from one victim to others like a disease. Harnessing its corrupting power can create an army of Undead.\n
Hokan Ashir has crafted an extension of the simple Zombiefication, making sure all your slain minions will remain useful servants in death.\n
Please select a valid extension slot
You cannot build anymore of this
Demolish Room

Finally! At long last, a missive folded into the shape of a little harp arrives. The fine paper smells of fresh flowers and the writing is all elegant lines and curves.\n\n'You have been invited to join Ianna the Singer for a celebration at the Dancing Boar Tavern. Don't miss the opportunity of a lifetime!'
It ought to be a grand party. We should go.
The Dancing Boar
The merriment must have been wild, as employees are still cleaning up dishes and decorations.
It seems we missed it. Too bad.
Ianna sure is generous on all accounts.
You stay for the rest of the night, your soldiers thankful for the chance to relax. When first light starts to climb over the roof tops, everyone is sent away in high spirits.
Most are already drunk. Maybe we can take advantage?

You manage to empty a few purses, but Ianna's guards catch you and throw you out. Most of the other patrons laugh, and some even boo as if you had just finished a poor performance.\n\n"Ianna won't look kindly on you betraying her hospitality!"
We better leave quickly.

Loud music and laugher can be heard from the Dancing Boar for some distance. The tabroom is full of people celebrating Ianna and her ever generous gestures, filling up on free food and drinks. Performers entertain them with songs and dances. Even Ianna's own troops are enjoying the festivities.
Let's join in!

The crowd grows wilder with every passing hour. Drunkards begin to jostle each other and, eventually, a juggler's lit torchers tumble to the floor. A banner catches fire. Soon, half the beautiful tavern is in flames.\n\nScreams of pain and panic tear through the night as people start to flee.
Come to me! I can shield you from the flames!
We have to get out of here!
Your quick reaction saves many guests from serious wounds, and you get the staff to safety as well. Many words of thanks find you, and you are praised for your timely intervention.
The flames roar as they devour the wooden structures. You are lucky to make it out alive, and not everyone does. Some of your brave soldiers are wounded by the scalding heat.

Outside, Ianna's guards are talking to the guests, putting coins in their hands as they say: "Just an unfortunate accident. Nothing to worry about. You all had a fun evening, right?"

One approaches you, offering you a package too.

"What a party, am I right? Consider this a gift for your troubles. Let the world know how much you enjoyed the event."

From further away, you think you hear snickering on the wind.
Are you bribing me to praise this disaster?!
Right. What a great night we had!
That could have ended badly.
Some of the children protest and cry as you round up their parents and make them carry back the stolen goods.
Be glad we let you live!

The goblins stop in their tracks and look at you sheepishly.

One of them, wearing a cooking pot for a helmet, shouts: "We knows you! You the master’s old pupil, yes? We serves master wizard. But robes cames and tooks 'im. We serves you now? We hungry!"

He points at his belly and smacks his lips.
Robes? What robes?

Another goblin, wearing part of a plush carpet as a cloak, steps forward.\n\n"Master's apprentice tooks them. We helps you? Finds his things and saves them. You pays us good?" he asks. "You wants we helps you?"
You mentioned robes...
Well, he… In the past… I mean, he sent his people to help us against all manners of beasts. I thought he may know how to deal with the Nightwalkers as well...
Undead? I will deal with them.
Oh… You… That is…\n\nThank you, your magnificence. I will return to my village and let them know the good news!
I will be happy to help.
Performing a binding ritual on a summoned creature will make their tenuous connection to this world more solid and enhance their presence.\n
The spell is misnamed, for it does not allow the target to sprout wings, but rather condenses the surrounding air in such a way that it becomes like solid ground below their feet.\n
By drawing all heat from their surroundings, you can literally freeze hostile troops in place.\n
One of the first spells in the education of any young arcanist, this can be emploed to cross a body of water without getting wet.\n
Summoned creatures often find themselves slowly fading back to whence they were plucked from. This spell prevents that effect and even invigorates them constantly.\n
Studying the endlessly moving patterns of the Allfire grants an insight into the very fabric of creation and every magical effect that exists.\n
A crystal ball was first employed by Undergast the Weaver to cast his gaze far beyond the confines of his tower.\n
A magical shield appears in front of the spells target, protecting it against most types of missiles.\n
Shar of the Isles learned from the medusae how to call forth a creature from the depth of the seas.\n
A well stocked library is conducive to any wizard's research.\n
Shar of the Isles has brought the medusae to Fiara and by means of this spell calls on them at will.\n
A proper summoning circle massively enhances the effectiveness of any summoning a mage cares to perform.\n
Creates a floating disk of solid air below your troops, allowing them to march on it where you want them to go.\n
First employed in the Mage Wars, this ward protects the recipients against all manner of spells cast against them.\n
Call a wyvern from their natural habitat to aid you. Be careful not to be stung by them!\n

The Shapers used the Allfire to make the very ground come alive and bend to their will. A few of these forms still exist to this day and can be called if one is willing to exhaust the power to do so.\n
The Circle of Mages has devised these crystal structures to extend the reach of their magical influence.\n
Isgrimm's ambition was always to create new life from cold metal. This spell was one of the first attempts, but requires great amounts of ore still in its raw state.\n
Through this conjuration derived from a Shaper ruin, one can meld and form stone and earth to become a formidable fortress with its own defensive aura.\n
Space is a construct that bends to your will, allowing your tower to be bigger on the inside than the outside.\n
The dwarven guildmasters have perfected their craft through centuries - what if we could emulate their experience by applying the essence of their lore to our craft?\n
This greatly useful spell grants all your minions the ability to harvest earth's bounty.\n
It is rumored that an avatar of Niethalf could be summoned through this ritual, that was granted by Niethalf himself to the first king of the dwarves.\n
This practical spell has been developed by dwarven artificers when the adamantinum veins of Silver Drift Hollow became exhausted , as it will prolong the life of any mining operation.\n
By excerting subtle influence on the minds of the many, this spell, said to have been created by the Circle Mage Ianna, can make whole cities fall for your charms.\n
Fatigue is but a state of mind - soldiers can be swayed to ignore the weakness of the body and march for days on end.\n
Reading minds and syphoning of their knowledge is a great way to learn the lay of the land from the comfort of one's home.\n
Clouding the minds of mortals will render them less able to follow orders when battle commences. \nMany brave warriors fell prey to this.\n
More often than not what a merchant is willing to sell is less than what he actually has. This spell makes him reconsider holding out on you.\n
An inn might seem mundane, yet the simple soldier values nothing more than a good ale and some decent entertainment. It makes it easier to attract and maintain a standing force.\n
An army in high spirits will be marching into battle with courage and conviction.\n
As many mages have found, the populace is often unwilling to provide them with the minions they require. Why beg for what you can simply make them give you?

When you need to find a well trained army fast, a city's militia is often the best resource. By exerting control over their minds you can make them flock to your banner. The populace might protest, though.\n
This simple charm will make the wealthy become exceedingly generous towards you. They may rue their actions later, but then you already have added their money to your coffers.\n
Ianna is said to be able to instill the deepest love and loyalty in any mortal with this powerful charm, making them willing to lay down their live for her.\n
A deftly cast image in the mind of the recipient will make him think the worthless chips you pay them are coins of gold. \n

Developed by the Iron Falcons this incantation will make the mind resistant to outside influence. It allows them to maintain their vigil over the Fial Darg without falling to their corrupting whispers.\n
A strong mind can make lesser minds do their bidding. This simple charm can be taught to your minions to allow them to accomplish this.\n
From the depth of the old forest, forest creatures can be called to your side.\n
The land of Eo whispers its secrets to you… and with this spell, you will be able to glean their meaning.\n
When roots grab their ankles, thorns cut their arms, and each step seems to be harder than the one before few armies will not be weighed down by the exertion.\n
Conjure back the great forests of old, when all of Fiara was an untamed wilderness. Their memory still lives in the roots of the trees in the deep woods.\n
Said to have been developed by the Circle Mage Gor, this spell will grant any creature the strength of a giant beast he is said to have wrestled for sport.\n
The eyes of a hawk gained by virtue of this enchantment make sure nothing escapes your gaze.\n
Nature can withstand the fierce onslaught of the elements and so can the targets of this spell.\n
If in dire need, the forest of old will yield rich harvest and rare ingredients, though harvesting it this way will harm it irreparably.\n
Breeding beasts for battle needs skill and talent. And a place to keep them…\n
Yria is said to have taught the elves how to bend nature to their will so it will guide and help your travel, allowing them to travel quickly through the toughest terrain.\n
The rivers of Fiara are what nurtures the life of the lands. Focus their power to make your seeds grow into bountiful plants.\n
The wilderness of old contaned fearsome beasts of all manners. You just need to call from the forest's depths.\n
Tapping into the eternal rejuvenation of nature, your minions will see themselves constantly renewed.\n
When medicinal plants sprout where you see fit, your armies will never want for their healing properties wherever they go.\n
The elves know the old forests are alive with untamed power and the oldest of trees can be mighty allies when awoken.\n
Some water, good earth and the rights seeds accelerated with simple spell is all that is needed to grow a useful ingredient.\n
Transform any creature into a fearsome beast by cursing it with this affliction.\n
The gills of a fish magically grow on your troops and allow them to traverse vast areas of water.\n
True friendship between animal and the peoples of Fiara is rare. But once a powerful bond is created, the animal will come to the humanoid's aid whenever called.\n
The blessing of the gentle Guardian Shanna heals all ailments and wounds.\n
By calling on Tiara's light, the blessed weapons will cause great pain to the wicked.\n
The light of Tiara is antithesis to undead abomination and demonic beings.\n
Elen's ever flowing grace will take form and manifest near one of the rivers that are her domain.\n
By Shanna's grace, the fallen my walk again and find themselves whole.\n
A protective ward strikes any enemy approaching your area with lighting from the heavens.\n
A blessing by Niethalf will convey all sorts of protection.\n
Legend has it that the Avatar of the Seven Guardians, the Lightbringer, will purge the darkness from all of Eo.
Those who have the Guardians on their side fight with great vigour and vim.\n
By surrounding the target with layers of wards, Circle Mage Yria has managed to make someone nigh invulnerable, frustrating those that raised weapons against her gentle apprentices.\n
The blessing of the Guardians will enhance your benign influence over a far greater area.\n
Tiara the Golden rarely shares her wisdom with mortals. But if she can be induced to do so, it is an unforgettable experience for all.\n
Call your minions to your side instantly, tugging on the magical bond that connects you all.\n
Propelled by the magical connection between all your areas of influence, you can manifest your minions near any of your holdings.\n
No one need truly be gone forever. The Circle has long sought to give new life to their favorite servants. This spell is the result.\n
Masters of the craft have long known that the transmutation of pure metals into magical essence and vice versa can be achieved, albeit with a costly process.\n

A group of dwarves on the side of the road waves you down.\n\n"Please, great mage, spare a minute of your time! We are companions of the thane's son, from Norgate. He has been terribly cursed and we can't lift the spell. We are in dire need of your magical craft!"
What happened?
Why is this of my concern?

We were invited to one of Ianna's famous celebrations. The evening was quite pleasant, but she declared she was bored and... Well. The sheep you see right here? Those were our friends! She turned them into animals to entertain herself! Please, great mage, will you help us?

It may not be. But help us and you'll surely find our Thane grateful. Please, if we would have known what Ianna would do, we would never have gone to her feast. I am sure we are not the only ones suffering from her whimsy.
Ianna the Singer? What happened?
I won’t interfere with the Circle's business. Goodbye.
This curse looks easy enough to break.
If Ianna chose to curse you, I won't interfere.
I am afraid my powers are not sufficient.

It takes some effort to revert the spell, but you can revert the Dwarves to their true form. They bristle with anger at the treatment they received at Ianna's hands.\n\n"The wench insulted us and sullied our dignity! Should you ever feel like giving her some of her own medicine, we'd gladly be a part of it!"
Careful, you never know who can hear you!

Ianna's apparition comes to you in a cloud of angry green, lightning flickering at the edges.

"You interfered with my punishment! How dare you question my judgement?! Never do that again!"

A wave of cold hits you, shivers crawling up and down your spine. She is gone before you even have the chance to blink.
I guess she didn't like that...

With a small puff and a waft of scented flowers, Ianna appears.

"You're wise not to question my judgement. Those louts came to my party and drank MY favorite mead. Dwarves... they simply don't know their place. So, I had a little fun at their expense. But abandoning them to their fate like that? Leaving them by the wayside? I thought you had more of a spine."

She is gone again before you can even utter a single word.
There is no pleasing her...
An extension is already being built in this slot.

The conversation of some young nobles catches your attention as you pass by.

"Did you hear? Another one of Ianna's parties got out of hand."
"No! Oh, I'm glad I wasn't invited."
"I heard someone played instruments out of tune. She got angry and said no one would listen to something that bad. Then, she made everyone rip off their ears!"
"Guardians, how gruesome! That woman is insane!"
"Shh! You never know who might hear you!"
She has no regard for others.
Word reaches you that Ianna's influence has grown among the people of Fiara. She seems to want to win over the whole land by means of her craft.
I wonder who she got to this time...
Shaikan's Blood
This spell will instill a sense of stone and earth equalling the most experienced of dwarves on anyone, making climbing a mountainside feel like a mere stroll.\n
By drawing on the Allfire connecting all of creation, this powerful ritual will strengthen all minions magically summoned to your banners.\n

As you stand at the foot of this mighty tower, Seshi gives you a report on what her resistance accomplished in the last fight.\n\n"They are putting on a show," she tells you. "We did a great deal of harm to these forces before we made our escape. They should be more manageable now."
Let's confront them face to face.
Then let's see what the damage is.

In the inevitability of this confrontation, Seshi's reports about her resistance's accomplishments here give you some element of comfort.\n\n"They don't wish to look it, but they were significantly weakened by our efforts. They should pose less of a problem than it seems."
Inventory
As Ianna's popularity grows, the people seem to have all but forgotten you.
Damn her magic!
Move
Alchemist Minions
Necromancer Minions
Artificer Minions
Explore this site to reveal a large area around it.
Hidden Treasures

You can already spy the pillars and statues you were told of half hidden under rubble and snow. The artistically crafted and carved buildings of old are partly worked into the stone of the mountain.\n\nYou can see the creatures that scared the last expedition too. Constructs. They have probably guarded the place since the Shapers’ fall.
This will be a peace of cake.
We'll come back with more troops.

With the constructs dealt with, you take in the vast grounds the ruins are built on. There are tunnels stretching through the mountains into collapsed rooms.\n\nYou spend an hour or more searching, finding a few interesting bits and pieces that will help further your studies.
The Coldmark will be grateful we have kept them safe.
Hover over an item and use the \nsell hotkey to sell an item.
You have mocked Ianna, and your lives are forfeit.
Frankenstein's Table
[malus]Can use ANY ore![/]
Enchanted Cauldron
Increases the yield of all alchemical Threshold 1 recipes by [bonus]+1[/].
Soulstorm Generator
Don't worry, I shall quench the flames!

The guard looks over his shoulder in fear. "Shh! She might hear you! Don't anger her! Please. Take another gift and leave!"\n\nWith that, he quickly moves to the next guest. You are left looking at the strangely glowing gifts in your hands.
What was that about?

Yes! Yes... we all had such fun! another guest says. His eyes are wide with fear and his face frozen in a painful grin. For a moment, it feels like someone pats you gently on the head, but as you whirl around, no one is there.\n\nYou look at the coin and gifts you've been given. They seem to glow slightly.
Very strange.
They look at you in disappointment and a sheep bleats out in distress.
I am sorry. Farewell.
Save Game
Load Game
Small Allfire Node
Generates [mMight] and emits a wizard's [mDomain] when melded with.
Explore this site for magical items.

Sevenkeeps is a bustling city full of busy folk wandering the cobbled streets and narrow alleys.\n\nAs you lead your soldiers through the city, you come upon a narrow and unsuspecting door. The symbol of a dagger is burned into the door frame and you recognize it to be the same as on that strange coin you have been carrying around for a while now.
Let's have a look inside.

She glances up again, this time at the coin that you put in front of her.\n\n“Welcome to the guild,” she says, going back to her papers without missing a beat. “If you want to hire, you’ll have to leave a coin with our outpost. And don’t forget to visit our sister guilds too. But don’t lose that coin. No coin, no entry.”
Good to know, thanks.
You enter another thieves guild outpost, greeted only with a grunt and a patient, outstretched hand.
The Guild
We'll be back.
We are looking to hire. Here, the coin.
You come upon a well with a small, shindled roof and a rope that falls all the way into the water. Legends say that Lady Luck resides in wells, granting a boon in return for a tribute freely given.
Find somewhere to dump him before he uses us again.
A string of curses follows you out. Before the dwarf or Roderic find you, you vanish into the sea of people in Sevenkeeps' streets.
That paid off.
That's our cue to leave.
Fine, I'll do it this way.

With a cantrip the lid springs open. You are greeted with the glimmer of gold but there are no scrolls. The dwarf must have hidden them.\n\n"Oh, there!" The dwarf stops beating his friend and stands up. "Only half of that is yours. Put the rest back if you want the pages."
Put half down again.
You promised the full chest and the page.

You chance upon a large gathering. Strangely, every citizen seems to be standing in the street, a puzzled expression on every face. From the look and smell of it, they have been here for days. Many of them are parched or soiled, some have fallen over stiffly from dehydration or exhaustion.\n\nIn dry, cracked voices, the horrific choir intones: "We love Ianna, we love Ianna," over and over again.
This is Ianna's doing? We better not get involved.
Give them some of our rations.
You treat the helpless people as best you can. You know it's nothing but a short respite, but at least you have shown them some small mercy.
We best not do more, lest we anger Ianna.
Break the enchantment they are under.
We can't help them now, but we must return.

You manage to break Ianna's spell and the exhausted citizens awake as from a nightmare, shaking and sobbing. They collapse, crying out in relief and praising your mercy. Too weak to do much more, they offer any reward they can for their freedom.
Coin never goes amiss.
I can always use ingredients.
Your gratitude is enough for me.
The knight waves his sword. "She has taken a fancy to you, but I cannot bear to share her love with anyone! I challenge you to a duel! For the grace of my beloved! What say you? Will you face me?"
I'm going back to my work.
Leave, or I will destroy you.
You want to leave now.
Break whatever spell Ianna has cast on him.
You try all manner of counterspells, but to no avail.\n\n"Are you trying to bewitch me?!" the knight shouts. "Ianna is my one true love! No magic will sway me from my course! Face me now, coward!"
He really loves her? Unbelievable!

You hear someone shouting near your tower's gate.

"Come forth and face me, coward! I'll expose you for the fraud you are! She will know I am to be her champion forever!"

Peering outside, you see a knight in dented armor, with a sorry excuse for an entourage. He spots you and proclaims: "Ianna the Singer is the fairest of all beings in Fiara! My heart belongs to her!"
So what?
I do not fear you, wizard! My love gives me courage! Face me! You coward! He brandishes his weapon again. "I will wait here until you face me!"\n\nHe sets up not far from your tower.
The knight blinks in confusion and then turns his horse away from the tower. His soldiers follow him with tired obedience.
What a fool.
I will not be ignored, mage! I will wait here and you shall have to face me one day!\n\nThe knight takes position not far from your tower.
Tiresome fool.
Idiot.
Fool for Love

The knight mounts his horse as your troops approach.\n\n"So, you are not brave enough to face me yourself?! Hah! Ianna will hear of your cowardice! No matter! I shall vanquish your minions and prove my valor!"
Let's get this over with.
You really don't want to fight me.
I shall not spill blood for such a foolish cause.
The knight looks at you with a puzzled expression. "Do I know you? I'm seeking Ianna the Singer's suitor. Do you know where they can be found?"
Look over yonder! They are days away...
Thank you kindly! I shall go at once and seek them out!\n\nYou can see his entourage exchanging expasperated glances. One of them winks at you before following their knight away.
That should do it.
The knight battles with the fervor of true love and it seems enough to carry the day.
I am not sure how this went so wrong.
The poor fool led his entourage into death.
What a waste of life.
You cannot insult me for my purpose is true! Face me now and we shall end this here!\n\nThe knight gets ready to charge.
I see there is no reasoning with you.
I'm leaving.
Run, cowards! The knight shouts after your troops. "Everyone shall know you are honorless dogs!"
This is getting tiresome.

A hooded figure comes to your tower, led to your study by your guards. Not expecting any guests, you meet the stranger with suspicion.\n\n“A little birdie told me you got your hands on one of my tokens.” Their voice is dry and raspy. “A coin, embossed with a dagger. I had to come see it for myself.”
You mean this?
I have no idea what you are talking about.

A dry chuckle escapes the shadows of the cloak as the figure nods.

“Would you look at that… I dared not believe, but it is true. I welcome you, then, to the guild. You have earned this token, by whatever means, and I respect that.

Come visit us, won’t you? Bring the coin to trade.”

With that, the figure slips from between your guards and disappears, though whether by some trick of magic or cunning, you cannot say.
A curious encounter.

“Then, my informant must have been wrong,” the figure says. They cough awkwardly. “Please excuse me.”\n\nWith that, they slip from between your guards and vanish, whether by some trick of magic or cunning, you are not sure.
How odd...

As you finally fought your way to Isgrimm in his smithy, you realize it is merely a metal figure in his shape, working tirelessly away at the forge.

"You think I would take time away from my creation to bother with you? My work is more important and this is but a minor setback in my quest. But you have overstepped your boundaries. Mark my words, the Circle will break you for your transgression. The others may see this as a sort of test, but you have cost me time and resources. I shall not forget, nor shall my people."

A loud crackle fills the air, as if lightning could strike any moment. But nothing follows.
At least you are out of my way now.

Dwarven craftsmen lament the sudden depletion of adamantinum in the Windwall Mountains. Some are suspecting evil magic while others think that it is being stolen from the mines.\n\nThroughout the dwarven realms adamantinum is much sought after for their craft and already competition for it is fierce.
I should send workers to collect some while I can.
As your workers are busy minining the rich ore vein, you can spot banners appearing not too far away.\nIsgrimm's dwarven troops approach, intent on challenging you for control of the ore deposit.
We must brace for a fight.

Rumors are abound of some great work Isgrimm is preparing. Some dwarven artificers swear they saw a great mound of adamantinum being shaped into a giant form by some unknown magical process.\n\nDid Isgrimm master some of the magic of the Shapers? Or is this merely another step on his path to unlocking their secrets?
We must keep an eye on him.

A dwarven trader visits your tower and carries a load of rare ores. He reports that several mines were stripped barren seemingly over night. 

"Folk they say Niethalf may be angry with us because Isgrimm is trying to rival his craft with his newfound powers. "I suspect those Granite Dwarves who are sneaking about Norgate and the Stoneblade region. 
Whatever it is, you will not find a better offer than mine! I can offer you Sky Iron and..." he leans closer "I even have some adamantinum left"
I have no interest in this.
Mana Cost
Mana upkeep cost per round for this unit.

A urgent message was send to you: 'Isgrimm has awoken the earth beneath our feet".\nA hasty scribble shows some giant golems, aglow in strange light, forming out of the very ground.\nThey seem to have made their way to various regions, where they now remain motionless, perhaps awaiting Isgrimm's command.
What does he intend to do?
Where are my master's possessions?

Moving closer, you notice a dwarf struggling with a great cask instead of flowers. His breath is very labored as he shifts the weight from one arm to the other. A muffled bump comes from inside, almost drowned out by the loud swish of liquid.
Stop at once! What is that in your cask?
I must be imagining things.

The dwarf suddenly lunges forward in a desperate attempt to reach the top of the steps. Royal guards jump into action left and right, restraining him.

When the dwarf has been taken into custody, the guards approach you too.

"This man was a notorious criminal alchemist. If it weren’t for you, who knows what might have happened. We are honored to gift you this, as thanks from the king and our people."
The honor is all mine.

The dwarf stops in his tracks, confusion and fear spreading on his face.

"Wh-what? I... It's just... I m-made..." he stutters. 

The royal guards have heard the commotion and are now slowly coming closer.
Enough! Let me have a look inside right now!
Restrain him! He is smuggling something, potentially dangerous!
Is that… vinegar? Something pickled? Do you need some help?
I will buy the Sky Iron
Get me the Adamantinum.
As you wish. The dwarf gives a slight bow and measures out a portion of his ore.
That is a lot of coin for such a small portion.
Splendid! he exclaims, clapping his hand and hefting a sack of ore from his wagon.
Quite a price...
You hear reports of Isgrimm's minions scouring the land for rare ores.\n\nThere seems to be an increasing number of them recently.
He is building something big, I guess.
More of Isgrimms banners have been spotted across the land. Soon no ore may be left to mine.
This is getting out of hand.
Isgrimm's troops have been spotted everywhere. Is it just ore he seeks or something more?
Barely anything left to mine...
That is some kind of alchemical concoction!
Hokan Ashir
Raith The Black
Gor The Changeling

With a heavy sigh, the dwarf sets the cask down and opens it. The smell of vinegar and pickling vegetables wafts from inside. You see carrots, turnips and more, each delicately carved into flowers.

"There! A humble offering of homemade goods," he says. "No need for concern."

The royal guard takes a whiff of the cask and waves the man through while addressing you: "Thank you but we have things under control."

Relief spreads across the dwarf’s face as he says: "Thank you, grand mage! My stamina is not what it once was."

You have the cask carried up the stairs yourself. The dwarf follows, recites a few lines and opens the lid, revealing a beautiful array of vegetables intricately carved into the shape of delicate flowers, pickled in vinegar. His gift is received with much admiration.

At the bottom of the stairs again, he says: "Thank you for helping me honor our traditions."
Enjoy the celebrations.
Do you need some help with that?
My apologies.

The guards storm forward to restrain the dwarf. His cask is ripped from his hand and bashed open, flooding the ground with delicately carved vegetables and pickling juices.

He wails at his destroyed work as the guards lead him off. One of them stays behind to address you.

"I appreciate your concern for the safety of our people, but we have it under control. Please refrain from 'helping' any further."
I only... My apologies.

The event continues happily until, all of a sudden, a cry echos from atop the stairs. The cask that was carried past you has exploded and showered the women’s gifts with acid. A pungent smell begins to rise from them as they rot at rapid pace.\n\nAfter that the celebrations are cut short, leaving many disgruntled. The royal guards announce a reward has been put up for the one who finds the culprit.
Quick! Find that dwarf's trail!
Poison for the Roses

The criminal, whoever he is, is no expert in covering his tracks. Your scouts find him hunched over a fire in a small hut in the wilderness, warming his hands in the cool early evening and get away again without him ever noticing.
You have heard reports of Isgrimm's miners spotted in your area. They seem to search for valuable ores in the region to bring to the circle mage.
He seems quite active.

A noise like a giant hammer shakes your tower, splintering stones and breaking the glass in its windows.
A large stone fist seemingly growing out of the ground pounds your walls and a large earth elemental grows 

With some effort you manage to banish the summoned elemental, but a booming voice like rocks crashing into a mountanside declares. "You may have stopped my servant for now, but I shall see every last one of your works ruined and ground to dust! Your stain upon the land shall be erased!".
He will attack our outposts!

With a sound like a mountain bursting, a large castle rises from the ground up, fully manned and defended. \nA large iron mask of ancient dwarven design appears above it. "There is no place you will find respite from my armies!" it booms. "I can keep this up for decades!"
Isgrimm surely knows how to hold a grudge.

Undergast the Weaver, one of the Circle mages, has done everything in his power to further his knowledge. Now he has outgrown his private libraries and seemingly has no choice but to expand! Multiple new libraries have appeared all over the Highmark and Westguard.
I should be careful not to cross him.

You happen upon a large excavation site, a Shaper ruin, being picked clean by Undergast's troops. You can see carts being loaded and guards overseeing the whole process with sharp eyes.\n\nWithin moments, everything seems to be packed and ready. The soldiers leave in a long procession.
We could check if they left something behind?
They probably took everything worth mentioning. Let's move on.
Undergast’s troops have been thorough. No matter how much you look around, not a single coin or piece of vellum has been left behind.
Let's leave.
To your surprise, someone must have dropped their satchel, or forgotten about it entirely. A small wealth of knowledge is hidden inside.
A worthy endeavor!
Militia Outpost

Some soldiers loiter in front of the watchtower but there isn't even a proper guard posted. At the sight of your approach, a few of them do get up, unsure on their feet and obviously more than just a little drunk.
Offer them gold to join your ranks.
Admonish them for their dereliction of duty.
Impress them with magic.

A bearded man in a dented breastplate scratches his head.\n\n"I don't know. We have a pretty good life out here. The baron don't care what we do, the town pays our wages and no one bothers us. Your thing sounds a lot like dangerous work."
Offer them more gold.
Threaten to report them to the baron.
Talk about the fame they can earn.
The leader looks greedily at the bags of coin.\n\n"I guess you have enough to make it worth our while," he replies. The soldiers start packing their gear. "Lead away, mage! We will follow."
Excellent.

The guards clap and laugh at your magical displays, watching in wonder as your cantrips fill the air with all manners of conjurations.\n\nYou promise them a full belly and good ale and they happily join you.
Cast a small charm to win them over.

The soldiers' eyes gloss over and they look at you with admiration.

"You are right, great mage. We shall follow you wherever you lead us!"

As though in a dream, they all ready their gear and saddle their mounts.
Simple minds. So easy to impress.
I accept your offer...

The soldiers all laugh mirthlessly.\n\n"You think anyone cares?" The leader snorts. "The Baron hasn't visited in months and brigands freely roam the lands. People complain every day! Their cries fall on deaf ears."
I would not want such soldiers in my ranks.
I can pay you handsomely.
I will not be insulted by a drunken peasant! Attack!
The soldiers laugh viciously.\n\n"Fame won't fill our bellies. Be gone, fool! Before we make you."
Leave these louts.
Show them you are not to be insulted!

A few minutes after you have left the watchtower, you hear shouting behind you. You recognize the soldiers from among the larger militia group.\n\n"Sorry for our leader's behavior. He's vile and cowardly and we no longer want to waste our days following him. We want our chance at glory. If you would have us, we will gladly follow you!"
You shall not lack opportunity for great deeds.
The militia are no match for you. You take over the tower and discover a few coin sacks in the leader's room. He must have been keeping them hidden for himself.
At least we gained something.
Enchants all units in a stack for their next battle with increased protection against missile attacks.
{MeleeAttackType.MeleeMoraleBonus:+-c} [imorale:c] Willpower against [mMeleeAttackType] attacks {postfix}
{MissileAttackType.MissileMoraleBonus:+-c} [imorale:c] Willpower against [mMissileAttackType] attacks {postfix}
{SpellAttackType.SpellMoraleBonus:+-c} [imorale:c] Willpower against Ability attacks {postfix}
Enchanted unit becomes blessed by luck in combat.
Upon death, the soul of enchanted friend or foe is always caught by you, even when losing the battle.
Build Limit: {limit:c}

Your scouts come to you with concerning news regarding Undergast's hunt for knowledge. It seems he does not care how books find their way to his libraries. Thieves and other riffraff have started to take his coin in exchange for any kind of book or tome.
He must have collected quite the wealth by now...
{Value:+-c} from current week
Extensions
I dare not risk it.
A group of your followers hesitantly step closer. With a terrible scream, they are incinerated in the blink of an eye. Quite obviously, you still cannot control the Allfire.
You try to reach out to the Allfire with your mind, to find some way to command it. All you feel is the overwhelming desire to touch it. To immerse yourself in its power.

Now that you have brought the tower close to this source, you will be able to draw from the Allfire’s power. But will it be enough? Already, your mind wanders to other Allfire sources you might able to draw from.\n\nPerhaps, by following the flow of the Allfire inwards, you can discern other locations it has surfaced in?
Follow the flow!

The Circle famously bicker and quarrel but they do, at least, each respect that they are among equals.\n\nSo, to survive this, you must prove yourself their equal. That would mean joining their ranks. With everything you have accomplished, you could already make a strong case for it. At the very least, that would buy you more time to continue your work.
Send the Circle a missive inquiring as to membership.
Max Level Reached
Tower Spellpage

You happen upon a library and search it in the hopes of learning more about the Allfire. Instead you are met with death. The scholars all lay slain, blood has splattered the shelves and desks and many book cases have been emptied completely. Nothing is left but dust, corpses and a few pages.
We bury the dead. They deserve that much respect.
Does not affect Undead.
Undiscovered Faction
You gaze around the room, imagining a treasure trove of arcane knowledge hidden among the scattered scrolls and torn books. A lifetime of magical study at your disposal!
I will not leave until I have recovered my master’s knowledge!

The goblins look relieved and grab their weapons and gear, preparing to follow you.

"We fights! We kills! We eats!" they sing happily, if out of tune. 

One looks wistfully into the distance and adds: "We losts some master's things when running from tower. Don't beats us... We shows you where!"
I welcome your service.
Can you tell me more about what happened?

You pass a noble man in elegant clothes. He calls after you in an urgent tone.\n\n"Can you spare a moment, grand mage? A band of thieves broke into my house and stole from my private collection of rare literature. I do not own the muscle to take them back. Would you perhaps be interested in a trade?"
What do you have in mind?
I have collected many a book and tome. Some of them even hold magic in their pages. Return my collection and you may choose one to take for yourself.
You have yourself a deal.
The goblins look at their hands in horror then try to hide them from your sight.
I am not interested. Good day.
No, no. I want to hire you!

Only that I awoke a few nights ago to someone breaking into my private library. It is curious - the thieves took nothing but books. Not even the expensive paintings I have displayed in the very same room.\n\nNow that I think about it, I have heard Undergast has offered to pay anyone who brings him books. Could they have been working for him?
It matters not. We will return your collection.
I cannot risk crossing a Circle mage. Good day.
Following the thieves' trail you soon find their hideout. They must have recently returned from another heist, as you see them carrying sacks and crates of papers, scrolls and books.
You gather together what you can find to return to the nobleman and leave the cave elated. This went quite well.
You there! Can we buy those books from you?

The band immediately reach for their weapons and take a defensive stance but stop upon hearing the promising chime of coins from the offered pouch. After a moment’s consideration, one of them steps up.\n\n"Fine by us I'd say. As long as we get paid."
Off with you then.
Now to collect our reward.
Rise, fallen scholars. Tell me what happened to you.
Search their pockets. Maybe they still have some coin.

As you collect the dead, you notice one of them is clutching a piece of paper close to their chest. You unfurl it and see a single word written in blood - Undergast.\n\nWhen you have laid the bodies to rest, a new found vigor finds your troops.
Indeed, none of their personal belongings have been taken but after emptying their purses and pockets, a cold wind makes the hairs on your neck stand and with a groan the bodies rise.
Their souls are angry with us! Defend our position!
It is time to leave.

The ritual takes hold of a librarian, who sits up and takes a deep breath. With a raspy voice he recounts what happened not but a few days ago.\n\n"Undergast's troops passed through and took everything they deemed worthy. We were killed for standing in their way. The Weaver does not take kindly to any that stand in his way."
Join us, and we will find a way to avenge you.
May Hirin grant you eternal rest. We will bury you.
The librarians need no more coaxing. Driven by revenge and anger, their bodies rise to your command.

Lyraine: The ever-bustling city of Goldenfields holds many busy markets and shabby ale houses. It is a lively town that thrives on fertile crops. The region has been unfortunately plagued by pests in recent months, but you can still smell an abundance of wheat in the markets, in the form of a variety of delicious baked goods.
Worth a visit if I have the coin to spend.
Your tower, the seat of your strength, has been destroyed.
Cannot afford this unit
You have no free hiring slot available!
Select a unit to hire

A grunting and groaning draws your attention towards a nearby boulder. You round it to find one of the circle mage's disciples slumped against it. They are heavily wounded, not likely to survive the next few hours.

Word of Undergast's disciples reach your tower. They wander Fiara in search of knowledge, returning whatever they find to the Circle mage. Some whisper that they don’t shy away from force to get what they want.
As Undergast's knowledge grows, so does his following. They preach of the power his wisdom holds and many reports tell of ruthless ways of gaining more. Rumors even whisper of murder...
What happened to you?
Let us ease your pains.

I have done many things I am not proud of in the name of higher wisdom. Undergast wanted us to empty this holy place in search of Ereon’s Quill. The priests bound themselves to the doors, trying to prevent our entry.\n\nWhen the order came to kill them, I could not do it. I stood between my comrades and the priests and tried to reason, but it did not matter. All I could do was run, gravely wounded. I do not deserve to go on. All I wish for is a swift death.
See what we can take then leave them to rot.

They do not resist the rough treatment, rather emptying their pockets for you. A piece of paper comes to light, on it the description of a rare and powerful artifact called Ereon’s Quill.\n\nSuddenly the disciple speaks up in a weak voice: "Do me the kindness of a swift death."
Tell me what this is first.
Tell us about this quill first.
And why do you wish for death?
I will grant your wish. May Hirin grant you eternal rest.
They do not deserve our help. Leave them.

They shake their head weakly and raise their hand to keep your healers away. In that movement a piece of paper flutters to the ground and you see the drawing of a quill on it.\n\n"I do not deserve to live on. Please, grant me the kindness of a swift death."

Ereon's Quill has been lost for centuries. It supposedly grants great knowledge and power to the one who wields it.\n\nWe discovered it is hidden in a shrine, but we could not find the right one yet. If you hurry, you might be able to stop this madness. Uncover the Quill before Undergast.
What is the meaning of this quill?
Why do you wish for death?

You reach the shrine dedicated to the Guardian Ereon, the deity of wisdom and justice, and find it bustling with judges, historians and scholars. After a few questions and a bit of luck, you finally find Ereon's Quill. It is resting on a velvet pillow inside a glass case, hidden away in a locked room.

The smell of blood is heavy in the air. The shrine is a picture of death and destruction. Priests lie dead, the temple silent. In one of the inner most rooms you find a glass case with a lavish, velvet pillow inside. You can still make out the outline of a quill that must have laid centuries in it.
There is nothing else to do here. We leave.
Undergast beat us to it. Bury the dead, then we will leave.

The shrine is silent. As you enter, you find its inhabitants dead. Undergast's troops have rushed through in a brutal onslaught. There is no sign of Ereon's Quill and everyone inside was killed anyway.
Bury the dead before we leave.
Hurry now, we cannot lose any more time.
May Hirin guide them to eternal rest.

You reach a lively shrine where scribes and priests alike tend to the grounds. Your arrival does not go unnoticed - you are greeted by an elderly man.\n\n"Guardians be with you, stranger. What can I help you with?"
We are looking for Ereon's Quill.
With each body you care for, new energy seems to surge through your soldiers. It is almost as if Ereon himself grants them strength for honoring his priests.
We can still beat Undergast to the next shrine.
Praise Ereon.

The face of the man shifts from friendly to uncomfortable.\n\n"I am sorry but due to the recent rise in criminal activities, the Quill has been stowed away for safe keeping and will not be displayed to the public. Could I instead interest you in our wonderful library?"
Your kind words will mean little if Undergast comes looking.
Why yes, a stroll through your library sounds wonderful.

The man blanches visibly, dabbing at his brow.\n\n"If Undergast comes looking, he will find these halls lacking. We don’t hold the Quill in our possession, nor will we give its location away. As I said, we are here to protect knowledge."
That was all the information I needed. Good bye.
Take measure to defend this place.

You are led through rows of historical records, books of the crown and many magical scrolls and tomes, the old man educating you on their purposes, their stories. After your excursion, you feel more knowledgeable about the turnings of the world.\n\nBut while you learn much, you find no sign of the Quill in this shrine. Perhaps it is not the right location after all.
We must be gone now. Take care.
I shall claim it before Undergast can.
Explorer
Hard
Balanced
Story Mode
Impossible
Difficulty

A sharp pain makes your eyes water. The book you are reading blurs, the pages fluttering and shifting until you see a face appear on them: Undergast.

"Still yearning for more knowledge of the Allfire, I see. If only half my students were so passionate. But careful now. We would not want you to overdo it and lose your mind, would we? The Allfire is not to be trifled with."

The Circle Mage's face vanishes and the pain in your head subsides.
He is watching me in my own tower?
Choose Your Difficulty
A man in scholarly robes runs up to your troops, followed by an angry mob of villagers. He falls to his knees before you.\n\n"Please, grant me your protection and you will be rewarded greatly!"
How could a scholar reward me?
Why are you being hunted?
I am a novice of Undergast the Weaver! I will personally make sure the Circle Mage knows of your support! Please, time is of the essence!\n\nIndeed, the villagers have caught up quite a bit.

Some years back, Undergast granted that village a boon. He asked me to retrieve it but they seem to have forgotten it was just a loan. They think I stole it!\n\nPlease, help me and Undergast will know of your good deed!
Restrain the man. We will surrender him to the villagers.
Undergast’s graces could be useful. Protect this scholar!

The novice tries to run but your troops are faster. The villagers soon reach you and take the prisoner off your hands.\n\n"Thank you, mage. This man has stolen many books from us over the last couple of weeks. Now he will finally be judged. May Ereon have mercy on him."

You shield the man behind your troops and the villagers stop their approach with angry expressions. A few profanities come your way before they turn and leave, obviously unhappy.\n\n"Thank you! Thank you so much. Here, have this. I will make sure Undergast knows of this."
Careful now, lest he flees again.
Glad we could help.

Out of the corner of your eyes, you see the air shift. As you turn fully towards it, the notes on your desk suddenly fly up, forming the humanoid shape you recognize as Undergast.\n\n"I have heard you helped one of my apprentices. I ask for your help again. One of my libraries, not far from you, was overrun by pests. My librarians are helpless against them. Clear it out for me and I shall compensate you for your trouble."
And what exactly will my compensation be?
It shall be done.
I am busy. Find someone else to do your chores.

A shame. You could have profited from our relationship. So be it.\n\nThe papers and scrolls flap around wildly for a moment before floating to the ground. In vanishing, Undergast has left your study in chaos.
The floating figure emits a paper thin laugh.\n\n"I will help further your studies, grant you some of my knowledge."
I have no interest in working for you. Be gone from my study.
I hate these appearances.
Undergast's Library

Upon reaching Undergast's library, you can see masses of beetles roaming the building and the grounds before it.

Where unsuspecting animals have moved too close, bones and strips of meat cover the grounds.

Whatever lured these chitinous beasts here, they seem to be rather content to stay. From somewhere in their midst you hear desperate cries for help.
The library has already been destroyed. By the bones and ichor on the ground, you surmise the 'pests' Undergast mentioned have eaten whatever they could find and sought out new prey.
It seems we won't be rising in his regards...

Among the slain beetles you find a man in scholar's robes. He digs his way out from under legs and wings, emerging with only a few cuts and bruises.\n\n"Y-you are my savior! A few minutes longer and those beasts would have devoured me." He gulps loudly.
What happened here?
Previous Page
Continue
Reset Tutorials
Show Tutorials
Over the last couple of days, more and more animals have begun behaving strangely. There are reports of wolves attacking grain farmers and deformed shadows in the night.
I wonder what this is all about...

It is market day. As people walk the streets looking to trade and gossip, bits of conversation float towards you.

"…and turned into a huge beast, the size of a horse! He ran after the creature and all I could hear was thrashing and snarling!"

"I sure am glad they didn’t see you! That Gor might have ripped you to pieces..."
The Circle Mage Gor?
Village Gossip
Gnawed bones and pieces of meat are scattered on the ground before you, as if a large animal was blown to bits with great force.
Gor has been sighted releasing mutated animals into the wild not far away. You should probably be careful when venturing out over the land.
At least we can salvage a bit.

The buzzing of flies and a puddle of fresh blood draw your attention to the roadside. Nearby tracks lead you to a boulder, behind which you see the mauled remains of a large deer. On one side, the tracks are those of large paws. On the other, leading away, they are those of orcs.
Could that have been Gor's doing?
You hear the roar of a mighty animal! Moments later, a bear runs by, moaning and whimpering as if scared.\n\nYou could swear you see a shadow following it, but too quickly to process it is gone.
Better move on quickly.

Guards with rusty swords and commoners with torches are gathered round. They wave you down with urgency.\n\n"Oh, thanks be to the Guardians. Finally! Someone has come. We will need every able hand against the beast!"
What are you talking about? Beast?

Is that not why you have come? Gor killed a griffon in his beast form and now the monster’s mate is aggravated. It searches far and wide for him, though he has long since shifted back into his own body. It destroys everything in it’s way!

It will be here any minute now! Please, help us!

In that moment, the shriek of an eagle reverberates through the hills and you hear the flapping of wings.
Goblin Shaman
We should be careful not to cross him.
Toggle Location Incomes
{what} constructed

A white banner draped over the lowest branch of a tree notifies you of the New Purity’s presence. You brace your troops for a fight, but then notice there is blood on the banner. Stepping up, you find a trail leading you to the lifeless bodies of a whole squad.\n\nLarge animal prints mark the edge of the battlefield, but from them a pair of orcish feet wander off.
Fresh Horses
Visiting units will receive [statuseffect][ispeed:c] Fresh Horses[/] once per week. Grants [bonus]+1 [ispeed:c] worldmap movement[/] when inside your [mDomain].
Stables
{Value:+-c} from finished research
This must have been Gor's doing.
Fight for your lives!

As you turn to leave, a few goblins emerge from hiding behind one of the dirty tents. One of them, wearing a hood made of a torn silken cloth, waves excitedly at you.\n\n"You! I remembers you! One of master's pupils, yes yes? We serves master. Not like these... chagrak here!" He spits at the dead goblins emphatically. Bowing, he adds: "We serves you now, yes yes? You gives us shiny, we fights for you! Shows you where more master's things is!"
Show me then.

What are your next steps? The destruction of your master's tower must mean he uncovered something of the Allfire's secrets, which the Circle guards fiercely.

You can restore the contents of his grimoire but his tower needs rebuilding too. And if the Circle is behind his disappearance, you must expect them to come for you as well.

Maybe they know of your discovery already?
I will not let them stop me!
Ask them why they are so hostile.

The villagers stare at you darkly.\n\n"You are here to take back the wizard's goods, aren't you? The apprentice gave them to us as payment for helping him flee – it was a fair trade! We will fight for them!"
Why would I take anything?
No need. Let me trade you for them.
Are you sure you want that fight?
Slay them all and take everything.
By some miracle of the Guardians, the untrained and terrified villagers manage to drive your forces back.
I may have to try again.
Take the goods.
With their armed defenders dead, the remaining villagers cower in fear. You quickly find the stolen ingredients and take their valuables for good measure.
Serves them right.
Subjugate them and take back the goods.
A group of soldiers in rough cloaks have spotted you and approach with their weapons ready.\n\n"Stay away, Circle slaves!" one calls out. "I killed yer last minion. I’ll do the same with ye!"
We don't belong to the Circle.
We have no quarrel with you.
Attack right away.
The brigand captain laughs mockingly.\n\n"Afraid of a proper fight, are ye? No way are ye getting my treasures. I’m going to Sevenkeeps and living like a king! And no Circle lackey can stop me."
I am not part of the Circle!
Let me try.
Ye reek of magic! Don't think ye can fool me! I'll take the bloody lot of ye!
I can see there is no reasoning with you.
With the bandits dispatched, you collect the items they probably stole from the Circle.
That will be helpful.
Nothing and no one is left standing in the monster’s wake. You can only watch as the destruction is wrought.
Coming here was a mistake.
Throw tar at its wings! That ought to stop it!
Everyone, reflect the light to blind it!
You divide the thick, black tar between the villagers and your troops. At your command, everyone flings their portion and the griffon crashes down with an angry outcry.

Soldiers and commoners alike take up whatever reflective objects they can find – polished metal helmets, swords, mirrors.\n\nBlinded by the flashes, the griffon crashes into the tree tops, then the ground.

The corpses and debris marking the fight inside the great hall of your master’s tower fill you with grief for him. Instinctively, your hands go to the flute he sent you with his letter. You trace the fine carvings with your fingers and memories of your time here flood your mind.\n\nSuddenly, the flute seems to hum and vibrate and a small sound emanates from it.
Examine the flute.

You take stock: The entry hall’s golden chandelier has been stolen and its soft carpets are gone. Your master’s tower was not just attacked but also robbed, it appears.\n\nOn closer inspection, there are several tracks out of the tower. Traces of torn fabrics and dropped cutlery lead to a goblin camp not far from here.
Go to the goblin camp and find the thieves!
This is becoming a nuisance.
Now, kill that beast!

Your units make short work of the griffon and the villagers throw themselves onto the animal, pressing its wings and legs into the ground. They are driven more by fear than bravery, but their actions are impressive nonetheless.\n\n“Thank you. Were it not for your help, who knows what would have happened? Some of us look up to your bravery. Might we join your company?”
You have done enough. Fare well.
I would be glad to have you.

Gor’s warriors are heaving something large across the countryside. At first, you think it to be oddly shaped driftwood, but the color seems off. You become increasingly certain they are transporting dragon bones.
What does Gor expect to gain from such strange behavior?

You happen upon a village in uproar. Many deep holes have been dug in and around it, even destroying some houses in the process.
