Establish contact with {Count} major cities.
Have {Amount} Construction Site within your Domain.
Stop them from bringing down the mine!

Whatever malfunction has caused the constructs to rampage across the mine has not got any better. One golem you can see crashes into a wall almost head first before turning itself in your direction with a yawning, crunching roar.
Clear them out! Hurry!
Stop your approach and find your last resting place!
The undead have barely moved from where you left them, but as soon as they... 'see' you, they begin stumbling forwards again, desperate and despairing.
Prepare yourselves. I will lift this magic.
Step on through.
I must dwell on this. Retreat for now.
You return to the tunnel emitting the strange magical aura, trying to ignore the wailing that drills into the very depths of your soul with every step you take.

You return to the Shaper ruin under the Silver Drift Hollow mine in the vain hope that one of the missing dwarves might still be fighting.\n\nAlas, they have not held out, though the undead guards still stand vigil over their bodies.
Then we shall avenge them!

In the eerie quiet of the aftermath, you take a proper look around. The building, as buried as it is, is artistically decorated and almost completely intact, preserved and untouched by the passing of time.\n\nYou jot down notes and make sketches of the place while your troops arrange the promised burial. Then you can be on your way.

None are witness to the collection of these poor, lost souls who would dare breathe a word of it to Silver Drift Hollow's mining collective.\n\nYour resources gathered, you can make your way back to the miners at the entrance of the caves and weave a tragic tale of how their brothers were already dead and now lie in rest with their forebears.
It's time for us to move on.

The dwarves cannot put up any more of a fight, dying quickly and quietly. You have your soldiers loot their bodies before making your way back up to the surface, where their friends still await news.\n\nThey openly weep at the tale you spin of the dwarves' valiant defence, quietly thanking you before finally leaving their posts.
Stop it right there.
Having pushed their luck before, the Granite Dwarves now turn to face you, seemingly happy to fight with their mining tools in hand.

Before Yngrid can finish her sentence, the earth shudders at your feet and large claws break through the surface, knocking many of your company of their feet.

"Aim for the underbelly!" Yngrid shouts. "They are slow and lumbering! Use speed!"

Her orders give hope to many of your troops. Perhaps with that knowledge you may yet survive the fight.
No! Run! We cannot win this fight!
You trek all the way back to the mine's glittering cave, where the molebeasts have not ventured back into their lair but rather extended it to include the mine's final cavern.

The gate you approach is shrouded in a thick mist and the stench of death lies thick in the air. Two guards wrapped in thick hoods look at you grimly.\n\n"So ye want to fight for the kingdom, eh? Not the first fool who went to Darkvale looking for quick coin. But if ye want to throw yer life away, don't let me stop yous."
Open those gates.

The figure barely moves as he speaks.

“So, you have come here to face me? Has the elven wench filled your mind with thoughts of revenge and redemption? Do what you must, but know this: I can teach you Nor's secrets, share my powers with you, if you are willing.

Is that not better than risking your life for some long lost cause that gains you nothing in return? What shall it be?"
Spare me your babbling. We will put an end to you.
What secrets?
Uram Gor
Continue Campaign

The telltale signs of an elaborate illusion cover the entire area. It is a fake, set by your master to confuse anyone following his tracks, no doubt. He put a lot of trust in you to be able to find the snare.
He knew me well...
There is an enchantment at work here.
Your brother?

“I would have thought you knew his name, seeing as his newest hobby is to hunt mages with the New Purity of Light.” Reinald’s voice is a little cold. “Rengar Storme? He is my older brother.”\n\nHe is pensive and tight-lipped, saying no more about it.
Well, we are here to help regardless.
[malus]This unit cannot gain [ixp:c] Experience.[/]
The Grand Wall
Are you Madame Myriel?
The very same. How can I help you?\n\nShe takes in your robes and something flickers across her face. You can’t quite put your finger on it. Was it fear? Reverence?
Tell me how you intend to swindel these folk.
The baron wants you gone, so be gone.
I heard you have charms against vermin?
She smiles, flashes her teeth and winking says: “Watch my show and you will see.”\n\nWith that, she turns to the masses that have all gathered.
Fine. I can wait.

Her eyes gloss over. Without missing a beat, she tells you: “There is a compartment under this wagon, my guards use it to move a bug from below.\n\nIt is held by string and sticks and we make it move to show people how effective my charms are.”
Did you hear that, people? She is mocking you!
I will try to identify what magic she uses here.
A small cantrip is enough to reveal there is no magic anywhere to be sensed. Whatever Madame Myriel is doing, it is a ruse.
You have no real magic! Tell the truth, what are you hiding?
Elemental Weakness
Nor's Boon
Base Focus: {BaseFocus}{modifier}
Target must be at least [malus]Disordered[/] or worse.
Mind Control
Stay strong, Philo. It will soon be over.

Upon waking, the boy sits up quickly, stretches his fingers and grasps at his face. The heat in his eyes when he looks at you makes it clear that this is no longer Philo.\n\n“You did not give me back my body, but it seems I am now in command of this one. He has finally given the reigns to me.” The demon cackles. “You stayed true to your word, mage. I am excited to see what we accomplish together.”
Not the outcome we hoped for, but it is something.
Revives on [bonus]your next turn[/].
Revives on the [malus]enemies next turn[/].
Remove all [malus]negative[/] status effects from the user.
Refill all [mActions] of a targeted [unitpromotion]Enslaved[/] unit in {range}.
Exploit Fear
Teleport
Split Stack

You receive your reward before being escorted back to the Academy’s entrance by a few guards.\n\nBy now, you are unsure whether they are there to see you out with respect or make sure you don’t take anything you shouldn’t.
We better get on with it.
Follow those tracks.
Investigate further.
Granite Dwarves? The fanatics claiming their race is superior to all others?
A group of undead shambles around aimlessly in the distance.
You collect the evidence of the slain undead to present at the Darkvale Gate.
Collecting Remains
I strive to be worthy of your trust, your majesty.

The king smiles as he greets you, stepping forward to shake your hand.

“You have done a great service to us in Sevenkeeps,” he says, asking you to kneel. “In honor of your deeds, you shall be granted access to the Seat of Kings. I am certain it will benefit your work greatly.”

He raises his sword and brings it down on each of your shoulders, one after another. The hall is filled with the echoes of the assembly’s cheers and applause.

“I dub thee Protector of the Realm of the Highmark!”

You are called to a small chamber of the palace to meet the king’s seneschal, a gray-haired woman of noble bearing. She acknowledges your banner and bows slightly.\n\n“I was tasked by his royal highness to convey his greetings. We have all watched your noble actions benefiting Sevenkeeps. The king extends an invitation to join him for a celebration in your honor at the Seat of Kings. I strongly urge you not to tarry.”
I shall make haste.
Dimension Shatterer
You have proven your mettle against members of the Circle themselves, battling their minions and toppling their towers.
And what a victory it was.
You guided a great hero along destiny's path, proving your dedication to others.
We had many perils to master.
You have taken on apprentices and helped them grow under your demanding but successful tutelage, proving your ability to teach and uphold the art of magic.
They served me well.
Cities far and wide revere you, singing of your deeds and praising your fortitude and magnanimity.
My reputation is well founded.
Exploring the lands, you have laid claim to the most wondrous landmarks, harvesting their power and benefitting from their resources.
And rightfully so.

The vast amount of knowledge you have accumulated puts libraries to shame. Collecting spells and cantrips where you could, your master’s grimoire – your grimoire - is now well and truly full. \n\nThe old mage would have been proud of you.
Knowledge is indeed power.

Guided by the echoes of a song and the distant smell of a summer’s breeze, you approach the gates of the dark shrine. A sense of foreboding washes over all of you.\n\nA dark, brooding figure clad in black sits there, watching you coldly. "Ah, visitors, I have waited for you to arrive since Nor told me of your coming." He slowly stands up, exposing a shadowy armor beneath his black cloak.
Approach.
We got what we came for. Run!
Immediatly lose all actions.
Receive 1 [uncommon]Sky Iron[/] per week.
Receive 3 [shaper]strange Ingredients[/] per week.
Diplomatic Contacts
Foreign Contacts
Gain [bonus]+2[/] Reputation per day with the capital of the region your tower is currently in.
Pen Pal
Intelligence Gathering

Adds the [aura]Snipers[/] enchantment to your tower, shooting enemies in battle.\nIncreases your tower's sight by [bonus]{FactionModifiers.LocationModifier[0].LocationModifiers.AdditionalSearchRange:+-}[/] tiles.
Increases the range of your [mDomain] emitted from all your locations by [bonus]{Modification.FactionModifiers.LocationModifier[0].LocationModifiers.AdditionalInfluenceRange:+-}[/].
Receive 2 [common]plant catalysts[/] per week.
Healroot bed
Lenya bed
Redcap bed
Pumpkin bed
Windweed bed
Harvesting Tools
Mining Tools
Receive 3 [common]Animal Ingredients[/] per week.
Seat of Kings
We know the shrine is under-defended. Go that way.
This units maximum actions are reduced by [malus]{amount}[/].
Perhaps we should have asked for clearer instructions...
Perhaps we should have followed Tarv's instructions...

The cave has many tunnels stretching away, deep into the mountains, some go high and some go low. None bring you any closer to finding the alchemist's missing nephew.\n\nIn the quiet and dark, time begins to lose meaning. Your soldiers could well end up down here for hours seeking out the right way forward.
Counter Offensive: Gruun

Examining the walls, one of your scouts comes across a large thicket almost completely covering a passage. Some time is spent clearing the greenery away to reveal a tunnel leading down into almost utter darkness.\n\nThe way seems clean, at least. There are no foul odors or signs of bestial activity. But there are no lights this way either.
Well… This is the way to go. Apparently.
Let's just keep following the light.
Explore the cave more before we make any decisions.

Your company sweeps through the cave, finding a number of loose crystalline rocks that catch the light in strange and mystifying ways.\n\nYou are certain might be refined to bolster your strength. Others may be worth something to a trader or collector.
Alright. Now, keep following the light.
Alright. Now, follow the dark tunnel.
The alchemist mentioned a way through an overgrown wall.
Walk along the walls. Don't overlook anything.
Explore the cave. Spread out.
Keep following the light.

After losing yourselves in the tunnels, you reconvene close to the cave entrance and this time head towards the lights.\n\nYou find yourself in a large cavern full of stalagmites. Many of them are as covered in ivy, moss and mushrooms as the walls, but you see stones shining faintly blue, bouncing light across the chamber in an eerie, shifting pattern.
Well... It can't hurt to take a look.
You expect to be ambushed by some creature of the deep and the dark but... nothing. The further into the cave network you go, the quieter it seems to get.
Let's just press on.
I hate dungeon crawling.

Your mind fills with ideas of bringing a larger excavation team here, perhaps turning the cave into a mine from which to extract all the valuable resources you can find.\n\nThose thoughts are put to rest though when you come to a chamber where the rocks and stalagmites glitter and glisten again, but tremendous fire beetles sit on the floor, clicking and chattering in the quiet of the cave. One is staring right at the tunnel entrance you walk from, giving a screech as it sees your troops.
I'm going to need you all to stand back!

There are several ways out of this cavern, scattering your company as everyone tries to escape the clutches of the fire beetle nest. Several of your company are dragged away to be feasted upon later and it takes a good couple of hours for the rest of you to regroup.\n\nOnly when you are sure none of you have been followed by angry, hungry insects do you try to find a new way forward, many of you flagging as energy starts to dissipate.
We must be nearly through these damn caves!

The bugs put up a hard fight but your soldiers slice their way through them.\n\nYou must have come in the wrong direction - there is no way Tarv would have sent his nephew into this kind of danger. At least not purposefully.
I will make sure not to trigger any more then.
You take only a handful of troops into the chamber, carefully looking at each step in turn to make sure no traps can accidently be activated.
Tarv forgot to mention these traps to us too.
Trust a trap maker to forget their own traps...
Beehives
Tome of Secrets
Crystal Ball
Minion

Free Beer

Raiding Party

Barely armed and not at all armored, the mob of angry people are nonetheless able to get the better of you and your troops.\n\nWord among the people will no doubt spread that you stand in opposition to the people's court.
I'm not sure how this happened.

When the house too has been ruined by the fires and the elf has fled from the city, you and your troop are taken to a tavern to celebrate as though you ended the War of the Six Races single handedly.\n\nOver time, word of your deeds today spread to other parts of the continent friendlier to elves, no doubt spurred on by the elf whose home you helped destroy.
What's done is done.

The mob is a little perplexed as you signal your soldiers to leave the burning wreckage of the elf's home behind.\n\nWhatever becomes of her, over time word of your actions spread to more distant lands where elves are regarded in higher esteem. They may not be forgotten for some time.
Whatever this is, I have no time for it.
You need a smuggler.
I will keep the secret for a price...
I guess we'll see if it's enough. Good luck.

The elf looks far from certain, struggling with herself for a few moments before growling and letting out a fearful growl.

"Fine!" she spits. "Fine. I will seek help elsewhere. Perhaps there is a smuggler or a mercenary out there who can help. Thank you for nothing, great mage!"

She quickly storms off, disappearing back into the shrine, leaving a touch of venom in the air.

The elf's brow furrows and she stops short of whatever she was about to say. You explain in more detail: A smuggler may know other, safer and more secret ways out of the city. It will come at a high cost, but it would ensure the elf's people get to safety.\n\n"But... we don't have that much to give!" the elf says hopelessly. "Magistrate Reinhardt has already taken everything from us.”
Leave it with me. I'll see what I can do.
Ways and Means
Hmm. Maybe another time then.

Having sent some scouts into Sevenkeeps to make some inquiries, you find yourself in a tavern called The Skipping Stallion, which you hear is frequented by many a smuggler and thief.\n\nKeeping a close eye on your possessions you take a good look around the place. If there are any here, now, then they are keeping themselves well hidden.
I'll show my intent with this coin.

You tell some of your troops to mingle and take a seat, juggling the coin between your fingers and occasionally flipping it it the air.\n\nIt is as you are watching the coin spiral upwards that it is caught by a quick hand, and you blink in surprise as a man in a loose, low-cut, frilly-sleeved shirt sits down opposite you, spinning the coin back across the table back to you with an amused smile.
I need a smuggler.

I can be a smuggler. He speaks as softly and carefully as you do, leaning in to keep the conversation quiet and offering you his hand. "Jaime de Villion, if you want to believe it. Provider of ways and means, seller of solutions you can’t – or won’t – deliver yourself."\n\nWhen you tell Jaime, if that is his real name, of the elves hiding in the shrine and their dilemma, he slowly nods, then chuckles and replies: "It's a big risk, going up against the magistrate right now."
Will this cover it?
Are you in need of any... magical assistance I can trade?

I mean, as you offer it up, why not?

Jaime slowly and dramatically shrugs, then drags the coin pouch you throw across the table into his lap. He then leans forward again, resting his chin on his hands.

"But there is something more specific I had in mind as well. You see, there aren't many problems that I can't find some solution for, but magically sealed vaults aren't my area of expertise. You are a mage, are you not?"
I am...

Well, as you ask. Jaime leans forward, resting his chin on top of his hands as he looks at you knowingly.\n\n"I couldn't help but notice that you are wearing rather mage-like robes," he says. "There aren't many problems I can't find some solution for, but magically sealed vaults aren't my area of expertise."
Okay...

I won't go into details here. One job at a time. I'll do this, and no one will ever know these troublemakers have made their way out of the city.

Just, maybe in the future, I'll come and find you. We’ll talk then.”

With a cheeky wink, he slides off the seat and back into the crowd, quickly disappearing through it.
#Ways and Means.0ba6308d-f16c-49a2-b5e0-4cf4228c0975;... Should I be worried?
#Defend them.14d7cd90-9030-4822-b062-04ecc3f34705;The elf stammers and stares at you, then rips the coin purse off the ground and gives you an angry, disappointed look.

Fine," she says. "Sorry to have disturbed you then."

With that, she is off, quickly disappearing back into the shrine with one more nervous look around.
Let's get on already!
Receive 3 [uncommon]Random Loot[/] per week.
Slave Pits
War Banner
Trappers
Archery Range
I can teach you some tricks to keep yourselves hidden.
Elves are gathering in a village not far away.

The elf is not a good student and you exert a lot of patience to teach her what she needs to know to keep her people safe. You find yourself writing instructions down on parchment too, just in case.\n\n"I am sorry I don't have more to thank you with," she says as you do so. "But I do appreciate this. We all will. With this knowledge, we can leave as soon as possible. With any luck, we can start our new lives tomorrow."

Word for word, you tell the elf what the magistrate's messenger told you, watching her eyes fill up with hope all the while. She is openly weeping by the time you finish, grinning from ear to ear.

"Thank you for this news!" she tells you. "I wish I had some other way to thank you for the hope you have given me. All of us! We will set out before dawn. With any luck, we will be able to begin our lives anew tomorrow."

With that she scurries away, glancing around with nervous excitement as she ducks back into the shrine.
I hope the magistrate's bounty is worth this.
Magic is a tricky art. Make sure you know this.

Thank you, mage. The elf bows to you as she collects herself. "You have once again shown you are a true friend of all those who will not live under abuse and oppression. I wish you all the best on your path forward."\n\nWith that she goes to leave, heading back towards the shrine.
Good luck. Don't get caught.
This feels extreme. I want no part of it.
... But at what cost?

You receive a message bearing the seal of Sevenkeep's magistrate, Reinhardt. With it comes a large coin purse holding much gold.

"Magistrate Reinhardt thanks you for your service," the message says. "The ship did not sail to Finon Mir, and the filth has been cleaned from Sevenkeeps's streets. We stand in your debt."

That is it then. You standing with Sevenkeeps has certainly increased...

You receive an unmarked letter one morning.

It reads: "I wanted to reach out and thank you again for helping us escape Sevenkeeps. So far as I can tell, the magistrate has no idea that we have gone. We escaped north into the Stoneblades and await passage first west to the Westguard, then south across the ocean to Finon Mir.

My life-long gratitude,
Cynthia (the elf from the shrine)
What's this?
I'm glad they made it.
P.S. the letter continues. "Your friend, Jaime, is very charming. If you see him again, please let him know I say hello and that I will think of him from time to time."
I... don't know what to do with that...

We can be your distraction.
Prisoners of War

The camp the orc guerrilla fighters take you to is clearly only a temporary measure: a collection of tents with a hastily erected palisade around it. From where you stand, you see a couple of guards posted at the doors to the camp, but little else.
Little has changed since your last visit. The soldiers inside must be waiting for new orders or perhaps tending to their own wounded before moving on, as the camp has not yet been dismantled.
Get closer, carefully. Let's get an idea of their strength.
Alright. Move up!

As you get into position, you just about catch sight of the orc guerrilla fighters moving around the camp, and only because you know what to look for. They have adapted well to this style of warfare.\n\nInside the camp, it seems, is a reasonably sized battalion of soldiers from the Westguard. A direct assault would lead to bloodshed on all sides.
Perhaps I can avoid ruining my reputation here.
Fall back for now. We must re-approach this.
A fog will provide the orcs with cover.

Telling your troops to fall back, you raise a fog from the ground that grips the camp in a hazy uncertainty.\n\nA few minutes after it lies thick in the air, you hear the first cries and shouts as the alarm goes up. The orcs must have made their move.
Strike at the camp now!
Let them do their work.

You make towards the camp as if simply passing by, wishing to receive an update on how the Westguard's campaign fairs. The commander is friendly and amenable, but worried that things are escalating with the orcs, who are now striking at camps beyond the Misty Coast.\n\nMany of the company join him as you chat, leaving the camp almost empty for the orcs to slip in and free their captured warriors.
This is almost too easy.

As you leave the camp behind you, the orcs slowly and carefully appear out of the underbrush, bringing the rest of their group behind them. The former prisoners are in rough shape, many sporting serious injuries and sores on their arms and legs from the restraints.\n\n"Thank you for your help, mage," their leader says. He passes you a hastily made bundle. "I know it is not much, but we were able to take this from the camp too - it is yours now, as thanks."

The orcs focus first on freeing the prisoners, before those who are able come up behind the fight to cut off any Westguard soldiers that might escape. When all is done, the leader approaches you.\n\n"Many thanks, mage." He gives you a deep bow and salute. "As promised - whatever you can find here is yours. We will return to Orgash for now, to rest and prepare for the next strike."
All the best with your cause.

The Westguard soldiers drive your troops back until they can fight no more. The orcs, to their credit, do what they can to support you once their prisoners are freed, but no amount of ferocity can make up for the greater numbers of their enemy.\n\nIn the end, the orcs are slain alongside your company, leaving a bloody mark on this day in history.
The Westguard will no doubt remember this.
Appreciated but unnecessary.

The body of a dwarf lay face down in the snow. He is pushed deep into the frosty ground and looks almost deflated. As if something huge stepped on him. \n\nLeading from the mine, you see many tracks. Whatever awoke inside must be responsible for this death and possibly many more.
Careful, we wouldn't want to be next.
If we hit it now, we can weaken it!
Everyone to me! I can shield us!
You throw the liquid fire at the icy moster and the flames lick against its body. A loud, rumbling cry erupts from what seems to be it's mouth.

You weave a spell around your company, shielding them from the monsters hurled boulders and icicles. It soon understands that it has no chance to harm you and with an angry cry jumps off the cliff to land before your feet.\n\nYour company however, their trust only strengthened by your shield, are not afraid and take on a defensive stance. You can sense a unity in it almost as if the gods would smile upon them.
A tall, wiry woman waits at the foot of your tower, a grim look on her young face. She wears a fine but worn leather jerkin and carries two long, curved swords. When she sees you, she steps forward.
Can I help you?
Who are you?
A woman of regal bearing, clad in full plate armor, approaches your tower. Her dark hair is pulled back into a tight bun and her face is flushed from exertion.
A cautious knock on your door calls you away from the window. You open it to see a dirty, slender boy looking at you. He can't be older than sixteen summers.
I don't give out alms.
What are you doing here?
More demons have invaded these lands, threatening to kill everything with a pulse.

You have pushed the limits of magic far beyond your wildest dreams. You have surpassed age and sickness - you surpassed the knowledge of your master many, many years ago.

But you did not heed the signs of calamaty and the effects are showing now. A war breaks loose, far beyond any conflict anyone ever imagined. The end of the world.

The Convocation is upon you.
I got so far... In the end it didn’t even matter...
Frostbite
Attack the looters.
Having angered the undead further, they swarm out to destroy whatever blocks their path. It seems there is no reasoning with them now.
This got dangerous.
Thank you. I trust you will no longer haunt the village?
I could use a few of your undead.
Teach me to summon undead of my own.
The woman’s face once again becomes a mask of fury.\n\n“You dare lie to my face?!” she screams. “You will regret stepping foot on these grounds.”
Do you know anything about the disturbed graves?
Tower Page
Purity Militia

Of course, that elf escaped thanks to me.
This has gained you nothing. In fact, it might have lost you the respect of all parties involved.
Damn it.

That was supposed to be courage for the task ahead...
Good riddance.

Oh, I know a thing or two about the undead.
Alright. We will go to the tomb and investigate.

Demons

The opponent has sent Demons against you. These ferocious close-combat fighters have high [mElemental] resistance and [mArmor], so they take less damage from your units' [mElemental] attacks.\n\nTry [tutorial]weakening[/] their resistance with your [tutorial]Pyromancers[/], or engaging them with your [tutorial]Phantom Warriors[/] which deal [mWhite] damage.
Ice Golem

An Ice Golem is an [mElemental] being, very good in defense and at taking the brunt of most enemies’ attacks.\n\nInstead of attacking, you should [tutorial]Guard[/] with it so that it takes even less damage during the opponent’s turn. Its [tutorial]Coldsnap[/] ability can be used to damage and debuff enemies in an area around it, but isn't very effective against demons.
Phantom Warriors

These Phantom Warriors are ethereal creatures with high [mPhysical] and [mElemental] resistances - perfect for this opponent, as demons deal these types of damage.\n\nTheir [mWhite] damage attacks bypass the opponents’ [mElemental] resistance and [mArmor] – instead, the attacks are mitigated by their lower [mWillpower].
Pyromancer

Dwarven Pyromancers are masters of [mElemental] damage that cast fireballs from afar. They are weak in close combat but have several useful spells at their disposal.\n\n[tutorial]Elemental Weakness[/] makes enemies more susceptible to [mElemental] damage, while [tutorial]Flame Armor[/] improves the defenses of one of your own units.

The stone moves towards the spellpage, guided by your magic, but as it gets closer the light seems to repulse it and it bounces off to the side.
You hear a shrill sound as the stone knocks the page away and the vortex vanishes. Before you, the page floats harmlessly to the ground.
The dwarves hesitate, as if expecting a trap behind the generous offer. Finally they take the coin and you can see a shimmer of hope in their faces.
I will levitate a stone to knock the page free...
My master went to great lengths to protect this.

A messenger of the Circle quickly arrives to inform you that your work is done. She tells you that the collective wisdom of the magi is that you are worthy of joining their illustrious group, inviting you to appear before them.\n\nTo ease your journey, the Circle promises to open a portal bringing you directly to the city of Mulandir, where they have their seat.
Finally, they recognize my talent!

You see the shimmering portal appear not far from your tower as you are donning your best robes for your initiation.\n\nThoughts of glory and great influence are filling your mind when the portal glows with activity. You glance up to see a titanic creature stepping through it, accompanied by a host of other, smaller beings.
What is this?!

The large creature leading the host is like nothing you have ever seen or studied. You can feel the utter evil radiating from it, stronger than any dark magic you have felt before.\n\nSomeone from the Circle – someone you antagonized – has either created or sent this thing here to destroy you at the last. As it steps closer, you feel the touch of the Allfire on it, as though it is imbued with the very power of the world.
But then how did it escape?!

Stories, legends really, about the War of the Six Races tell of the destruction wrought by truly evil creatures – the leaders of the Black Legion, locked away only by the power of the Guardians themselves.

The enormous amounts of the Allfire you and the Circle have siphoned away must have weakened the binding enchantments that held it – your adversary in the Circle must have felt this and directed it at you as it wormed its way back into the world.

One of the Fial Darg, mightiest of the servants created by Zarach, is now howling with anger and rage as it hurtles towards you, bent on destroying anything and everything in its path.
We must face it.

A burst of light announces Yria’s presence, her calm features distorted by anger and hate.\n\n"You have squandered your talents spreading mayhem across Fiara, upsetting the precious balance the Circle has created by attacking my peers," she warns. "You are no better than those brutes, Hokan and Uram. We need no more of that. I will not have it."

Burning with anger, Ianna's visage appears before you.\n\n"You think you are so great, don't you?" she sneers. "Everybody loves you - all the people of the realm applaud your deeds. They have all but forgotten about me and cast me aside! All because of you! Well, I won't let you get away with it. Once I destroy you, they shall see you for the pitiful creature you really are!"

The red-clad Rohen appears, his gaze darkened and furious.\n\n"Gathering villagers and simple folk around you like a shield," he muses. "It is shameful. In doing so you made it impossible for me to hire useful hands! I can't have it. You have become far too popular for your own good - and mine. I will ensure you will never join the circle."

Whatever the case may be, you have now an invitation to membership in the Circle that you can use to forever secure your place in history. All that stands between you and that security is this towering monstrosity and the horde of one spiteful individual.\n\nShould they fall, the way to Mulandir stands open before you.

Silence comes over the battlefield as the last of your enemies finally falls. As you should perhaps have expected, there is no sign of the Circle mage who sent the force after you. And the portal is still open. It would have been closed if they weren’t really expecting you.

No doubt, your life is about to be turned on its head. You could never have imagined it when you first picked up your master’s letter. Thinking of him, you glance down at the flute still dangling from your belt. What would he think of you now? What will the world think of you - how will you be remembered?

It will probably make for an exciting tale - but not one you are interested in now. Now, you will finally finish your journey.
Today I become a Circle mage.
With no small amount of embarrassment on your part, the enemy beats you back.\n\nWill this really be the end of you? Have you anything else to throw at this adversary?
I shall persevere!
Ray of the Guardians
Forgemaster's Blessing
For each ally in its stack:
Revive Animal
Revives [bonus]ally[/] unit in {range}.

Hokan Ashir’s domino mask rises over all other helms as the mage makes himself seen before his army.\n\n"Do not say that I have not warned you, whelp!" he hisses. "You cannot and will not defeat me as you have defeated the others. Accept your place! You are but a pawn in a game you do not even remotely understand."

Uram the Red steps out from among the ranks of enemies, shouting: "You truly astound me!

I cannot begin to fathom how the others have allowed you to come so far. Is it some machination of Hokan’s? Are you another one of his puppets? No matter. You will not step foot into Mulandir. Not without crossing me first."

A wave of battle cries roll through the opposing soldiers. As one, they march forward, directing the larger creature even closer to your tower.

The growling of a beast draws your attention to a large, misshapen bear that quickly and brutally changes into the hulking form of Gor.

"I do not understand how the others cannot see the threat you pose, mageling!" He shouts up. "Is it Ianna’s sorcery you have used to bewitch their minds? It matters not! I will be the one to drive you away once and for all, with or without their help!"

War cries erupt from the horde, which now closes in on all sides.

Yria steps out of the masses, already shaking her head in disappointment at you.\n\n"I asked you to keep Fiara safe," she reminds you. "I offered my blessings and guidance – and yet you have raised up this… ‘hero’. This war machine that will kill on your command should you ask it. They and you must be destroyed and if the others cannot see that, then I shall do it myself."

Ianna saunters through the crowd of soldiers, her eyes glinting in the light.

"You must feel oh, so high and mighty with these so called ‘heroes’ following you," she calls out. "Pah! They are nothing but glorified peasants! The people love me more than they will ever love your loyal dogs!

Don’t believe me? Then believe it when we stamp you into the dust. You will never join the Circle. Not on my watch!"

As if floating, the Circle mage Undergast approaches, a tome in hand. As he flips the pages, you recognize it to be your master’s grimoire. Your heart sinks as he snaps the book shut with a smirk, only for it to vanish and reappear on your desk.\n\n"I see you inherited your master’s dangerous habit of hording knowledge instead of sharing it," he says coyly. "The others may not see it, but you are dangerous. I will make sure your advances stop here."

Raith’s slender frame moves into your field of view, his hands weaving spells even as he affixes you with a truly terrifying gaze.\n\n"You do not appreciate the true power of the knowledge you have collected," he says in a near whisper. "I doubt you even understand it! In the hands of someone with clarity of purpose… but no. Instead, it has fallen to you. I cannot allow it. Not after everything! I will not see it wasted on you!"

The distant sound of hammers bearing down on metal announces Isgrimm’s presence. The soldiers make way for the dwarf until he can see you. He crosses his arms in disappointment.\n\n"Your greed is disgusting!" he shouts. "Monopolizing all this knowledge? Going against the very ideal the Circle is founded on, that knowledge is for all? I do not trust you. And if you plan to overthrow us, I will make sure you do not succeed."

Rohen Tahir’s imposing figure steps out in front of the army. It seems his might has grown again since last you spoke with him.\n\n"Did I not warn you to take care of that head of yours before you lose it?" he asks. "You have hoarded places of power to yourself, taking what rightfully belongs to the Circle. What rightfully belongs to me. I have indulged you long enough! It is time for someone capable to take matters into their hands - the Circle is obviously failing."

Out of the newly formed threat, Undergast appears - his face a grim mask of determination.

"You might have been able to fool the others with you charm and wits but you cannot fool me! I know what you would do to us! And I know it is not about how many apprentices or followers you can gather around you. It is whether you know how to put them to good use! Here. Let me show you!"

The mage raises his arms and the army behind him howls in rage, ready to attack.

You have no idea what you have done! Raith’s voice echoes over the heads of the warriors before your tower. "I needed those places of power! I need the magic they hold! You will stand in my way no more! I will not let you thwart me – no matter what the others might think!"

The stout dwarf and Circle mage Isgrimm appears before you, fuming.\n\n"Enough of this nonsense!" he shouts. "You have gathered more followers around you than an ant ever would! Are you not aware of the danger you are putting us all in?! Why do you think I have worked alone for so long! You are a danger to all of Eo! My colleagues might not see it, but I will certainly not sit idly by while you drag us all down with you."

From where you stand, you can’t make out their banners, but the army is coming straight for your tower with obviously hostile intention.\n\nWhether it was some kind of trap to catch you off-guard or simply one member of the Circle refusing to believe you are their equal, it is clearly a last-ditch attempt to thwart your plans.
No! No, I will not be stopped now!
<nobr>[range][idirectlos:c] Range[/]</nobr>
<nobr>[range]{range}[/] [mDirectLos]</nobr>

You perplex me, mage. Gor’s deep and rumbling voice rises over the noise of the host. "Each member of the Circle is a master of their craft – shapeshifting, manipulation, death magic, artifacts. Whatever it is, we know what we do well.\n\nYou are now studied in many arts but have only scraped the surface of all of them. You are not yet wise enough to join our ranks and I do not know what you have done to the others to make them think otherwise. You must still prove yourself to me."

In a billowing of smoke, fire and sulfur, Uram the Red appears on the battlefield, shouting up at you: "You are ignorant and a fool, mage!\n\nYou are not ready to join the Circle! You put all your faith in this… ‘hero’ you hold up by your command. What would happen if they were to die or be taken captive? What happens when they fail you? Then you have nothing! A horde that lives or die by your command is the only way to properly fight. This…" He indicates the army at his back. "This is true power! And now you will see power in its entirety."

The light reflects off his infamous domino mask and you recognize the dreadful visage of Hokan Ashir as he makes his way towards your tower flanked by undead guards.\n\n"You," he growls, his voice right next to your ear. "You have convinced the weak and foolish leaders of the world to call you friend and ally. Even the Circle itself. But I see through you. You would turn them all against me - the only one who can bring them salvation! I will not stand for it. You... you will die."

A dazzling light is enough to tell you that it is Yria who has come before you with this host.\n\n"Though you have done everything that was asked of you, mage, I cannot let you tarnish the Circle with your greed," she says quite calmly. "These places of power you have taken for yourself are not for one person to use to their own whim. If we cannot find a way to use them together, then they should not be used at all. That is how they will come to evil and that I cannot allow. You have left me with no choice but to stop you myself."

[ipause:c] Ends the unit's turn.

Be an Alchemist, a master of the bottled elements.
Brew potions and concoctions to support your troops in combat.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
You will need large quantities of ingredients to keep your cauldron bubbling.
You're able to deal with every situation having the right potion at hand.

Be a Necromancer, an artist of life in death.
Harvest souls from the bodies of the fallen to create your army of the dead and flood the lands with your creations.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
You will have bigger armies than anybody else but rotten flesh does not heal easily.

Be an Artificer, a creator of magical items.
Craft glyphs and artifacts to provide your troops with a multitude of different improvements, turning them into powerful entities.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Ore is your most important objective as every magical item is made from it.
Choose Your Crafting

Learn the best ways to weaken your enemies and charge them with undead forces unmatched by living troops. Your curses will be the last thing they hear before submitting to you in their death.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Create and maintain Undead units or corrupt and enslave the living.

Under your skillful hands the earth reveals its innermost secrets. Strengthen your troops and exploit the riches Eo holds.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Improve your crafting and shape the earth to enhance your troops or share more of its resources with you.

The world is your playground and you bend the rules ever so slightly in your favor, adding fantastical creatures to your ranks.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Summon and improve fantastical monsters, enable your troops to reach remote places with ease and research new spells faster.

The lives of your followers are your first priority, so you will do everything in your power to keep them alive and healthy.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Protect and strengthen your troops, bring Light to the world and defend against the dark arts.

With only a touch of magic you have your enemies grovelling at your feet, ready to kiss the earth you walk upon.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Play with the minds of your own or the enemy's troops. Manipulate the local population into loving you.

The wildlife around you will rise to help you overcome any challenges in your path. Even the plants bow to your will.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Bend flora and fauna to your will, bolster your ranks and improve your troops. Search for Primordial places to unleash nature's wrath.

Spell Upkeep
Spell Upkeep

Many spells you cast require constant [mMana] upkeep.\n\nYou can access a list of those by selecting the [tutorial]'active spells' tab[/] in the top-right corner. There you can also [tutorial]abort spells[/] if they aren't useful anymore or you want to save their costs.

Born into the Grarg Orc clan on Urgath he has studied beasts of all kinds in order to enable him to take their form.\nHe controls a wide array of creatures to do his bidding, though what his goals are remains mystery.
One of the most powerful necromancers to have ever lived, feared even by some of his fellow Circle Mages.\nHe is aggressively seeking new ways to grow his undead hordes.
Her charming personality hides a darker side as her mastery of Mentalism lets her see others as mere toys to play with.\nStaying on her good side is going to take a guilded tongue.

The greatest dwarven stoneshaper perfected the creation of glyphs by seeking out Shaper ruins and adapting his craft to incorporate their magic.\nAs the builder of Mulandir, the seat of the Circle, his pride in his creations knows no bounds.
A powerful Norcaine Dark Mage who once uncovered the secrets of the City of Souls.\nHe excels in Death Magic and desires Hirin’s Hourglass, seeking to conquer death and time itself.

Obsessed with the domination of the Allfire above all else, Rohen is always seeking new ways to master its powers.\nHe has remained neutral in most of the Circle's squabbles, no doubt hatching a grander scheme.

The most accomplished scholar of the Circle, his thirst for knowledge and books is second to none.\nHe may be a worthwhile ally if you are willing to give up your knowledge, but will stop at nothing to obtain it if you are not.

A highly accomplished demonologist thirsty for power, Uram is obsessed with gaining influence over the demon realm and summoning ever greater servants.\nHe dislikes Hokan, whom he views as his only true rival.

A pure-blooded elf from Finon Mir, she has dedicated her considerable powers of healing and protection to bringing peace across Eo.\nDo not mistake that for weakness – Yria has ways to pacify you with or without your cooperation.

Other Adventures
Galtrak
Grimoire Page: Galtrak
Drink Sacrificial Blood
Sacrificial Blood
Sacrifice Population
The sacrifice grants you
[error]You must be on an [skill]urban[/] tile to use this skill.[/]
{statuseffect_0_canwill}{statuseffect_0_amount}{statuseffect_0_name} to both user and target.
A merchant has arrived at your tower. \n\n“I come bearing dire news, master mage.” the merchant says, “A bloodthirsty monster is roaming our lands.”
I think more than one roams the realms, really.

“True, yet none are as terrifying as the Gutter. A truly gruesome creature. \nSome describe it as a shadow, large as a bear with claws larger than a man’s leg. Once it's shadow has been spotted, the screams of terror are sure to follow. It tears villages asunder, leaving nothing but rivers of blood.”
That is alarming. I shall ready my troops.
Relief washes over the merchant’s face. \n\n“I am glad to hear it, master mage. I already feel safer, knowing you are willing to provide protection.”
That is not what I promi… Nevermind...
I am glad to be of service.

The tangy smell of blood hangs heavy in the air, as you enter the village. The guards have not exaggerated – everything is drenched in crimson. It's as though a hurricane of blades swept through, slicing and slashing each inhabitant. \n\nBut the macabre scene only distracts you for a second. A palpable, vibrating energy thrums from the runes etched into the blood and dirt. Magic.
This feels astoundingly powerful.
Beautiful, isn’t it?

You step closer, examining the unknown script. The gathered blood pooling in the sigils gives off a slight glow, beckoning you to touch it.\n\nA weak motion to your left distracts your gaze. Somebody has managed to survive.
There shall be no survivors.
Don’t be alarmed! I am here to help!
Bring them to me. We need more blood.

The man gurgles as a blade slices through his vocal cords, and he collapses on the runes. You witness the blood seeping into the grooves, mingling there and taking on the strange glow. The magic stretches its tendrils and grows ever so slightly stronger.
This is magnificent.
Imagine what even more blood would feel like.

Leaving the village behind, your thoughts wander back to those glowing sigils. Galtrak has uncovered quite a peculiar way of harnessing magic, and judging by the potency you felt, it is bound to grow far stronger than you expected.
I am curious to see where this’ll go.
Inspecting the man, you find him in shock. The recent events have left him speechless and dazed, yet he seems unharmed. The blood on him must be from the other victims.
Remember me?
Here, build yourself a new life.
Let’s leave, there is nothing to be gained here.
The man looks down at the coins in his hand confusedly, then picks a seemingly random direction and wanders off in a haze. His steps are cautious, unsure. Soon he starts running.
I hope he will be well
A sudden burst of heat flares up and you witness a fireball crashing into the man, burning him to a crisp within seconds. Your eyes find Galtraks. \n\n“What?” He smiles coldly.

For a moment longer, the man’s eyes are unseeing, but slowly recognition begins to settle in and fear sparks to life. With a shriek, he falls backwards and begins to crawl away, an endless cry on his lips. \n\nGaltrak steps forward and unceremoniously decapitates the man with a swift slash.

Guards from the local militia enter your study, dragging a bloodied and shackled orc behind them. A thick, metal band is clamped around his neck, and they push him forward by two rods affixed to the collar. With a twist, the orc is forced to his knees, emitting a pained grunt.
What is the meaning of this?

The orc looks up to you, blood dripping from his lips. He smiles and you can feel something dark stir within him. Something ancient.\n\n“What should be do with him, master mage? This magic he wields, it is disturbing.”
Indeed it is. What is your name, orc?

The orc’s smile does not falter. As the guards roughly push him to his knees, his eyes lock with yours.

“You'll regret this day."

A raspy chuckle is the last thing you hear from the orc, as he is dragged away.
I hope I have done the right thing.
Galtrak.\n"...or the Gutter," he adds bearing his sharp teeth in mockery. "So my magic has captured your attention? I must confess, I didn't expect your curiosity."
Tell me all about your ... gifts.
You don't look like a mage to me.

A brow raised at your question, his smile grows wider, spreading his lips just a tad too thin.\n\n"Blood is the very essence of life. It holds the most potent magic I know of. Taking a life is..." he closes his eyes in what looks to be delight before continuing. "Nourishing. It renders the magic within it accessible for a fleeting moment."

Another harsh laugh emanates from Galtrak as you snap your fingers, releasing him from the shackles and metal band. The guards step back with a look of fear and suspicion. You dismiss them with a wave of your hand and they hurry towards the door.\n\n"You won't regret this, mage. Blood magic is far superior. And oh so exquisite."
I can’t wait to find out more.
A group of local farmers, hunters, and peasants come to your tower. \n\n"We've had enough. The Gutter, he has evolved in his cruelty and wanton violence. He must be stopped!"
And why do you come to me with that?

The locals look at you in shock. 

“He is killing our families and you are idly standing by? Maybe even condoning his actions?” 
Anger begins to emanate from them in waves. 

“If you make yourself common with this creature you shall suffer its fate, eventually!”
I do not fear a couple of peasants.
I deeply regret your loss. My condolences.
The ragtag group accepts your gift with a somber nod. \n\n“Thank you, master mage. With this coin, we can find hired hands and better prepare for the upcoming fight. We knew we could count on you."
Always.
The villagers appear slightly disappointed but nod. \n\n"Thank you nonetheless. Your coins could have helped us in our struggle, but we will not give up the fight against the Gutter.”
Best of luck to you all.
“And you think this sorry excuse will ease our pains? We have lost so many loved ones, their blood spilled unnecessarily! And still, you stand by this monster?”
Maybe this will help you forget your pains?
He is too valuable to me to let go.
A tense silence hangs in the air. After a moment's consideration, they accept the coins disdainfully. \n"This doesn't change anything, mage. You've lost our support." \nThey storm out of your tower.
Such an inconvenience.
Taken aback by your words, the commoners exit your tower. \n"This isn't the end of it! We won't sit idly and wait for death to claim us. We'll go down fighting!"

The loud thundering of hooves draws your attention away from your current studies. An entire army has arrived at your tower. \n\n"We won't bear this any longer! The slaughter must cease! We know you're sheltering the Gutter! Hand him over or face retribution!"
You think your puny army will be a match for my powers?
Then you leave me no choice.
You have received reports that Galtrak has killed a group of merchants, practicing his blood magic on their corpses. Now the orc stands before you, showing not a shred of regret.
You must stop this killing without my permission.

“And how am I supposed to refine my magic then? By hoping and praying? No, I need blood, and you know it. Have known it from the moment we met.” His large hands land on your desk as he leans forward. 

“If you want control of whom I kill, assign me a target. I need blood, and lots of it. I know I’m close, I can feel it. Each drop makes me stronger.” He leans in further.

“Give me a village. That’s what I need.”
Fine, I will find you a village.
I am not liking this one bit …
His lips tip up. “You knew what you signed up for, don’t play coy now. A village or two. That is all I’m asking.”

As Galtrak looks over the vessels of blood, his eyes gloss over with something akin to desire. He inhales deeply, savoring the scent, and lets out a satisfied sigh. \n\n"Finally. It's time. Come with me to one of Zarach's sacrificial sites. There, I can complete my spell."
Lead the way.

You watch as Galtrak smears the altar with the blood, tracing runes in a trance that transcends mere concentration. Soon enough, the symbols start to glow from within, and a thrumming fills the air. The invisible threads of magic weave through Galtrak and yourself, and you can sense a surge of power.
This is magnificent!

He moves closer, almost shaking with anticipation.\n"I can feel that there is so much more power to pull from the blood. If we can collect more, I can increase our power, our magic. No turning back now, my friend.”

As if the magic was reaching a crescendo, the thrumming in your ears peaks before vanishing altogether. Galtrak turns towards you. A shadow the color of dark blood has shrouded his eyes and now recedes slowly. 

"Yes. Yeeees!" he triumphs. "It's worked! I can feel it." He raises his bloodied hands toward the sky and laughs maniacally. 
"Oh, just imagine what more we could accomplish! More! We need more!"
You mean even more blood?
I can't wait to see what else this magic beholds.
Blood Sacrifice

Galtrak approaches you, a glint of mischief in his eyes. "I have a few new theories to test. With the blood we've collected, at least one of them is bound to work. Come with me, friend, and let's discover the true potency of my latest spell." \n\nHe produces a brown-flecked leather map, and you notice he's marked another shrine on it.

As Galtrak sets up at the shrine, clouds slowly start to crawl over the sky. With deft fingers, the orc begins to paint sigils, muttering under his breath in a singsong voice. 

The more blood he spreads, the darker the sky grows. This time, the symbols don't stop at the edge of the stone slab that serves as a table. The lines extend on to his own body, tracing softly glowing sigils all over his bare skin. 

A deep, rolling thunder echoes through the lands as Galtrak places the last lines across his face. 

The vibrant red seeps into his body, his eyes glowing in the same hue. Galtrak begins to hover above the ground, humming with power.
How utterly fascinating.

A pulse of strong magic emanates from Galtrak, making your skin prickle. With a throaty chuckle, he inspects his body. \n\n“So much power. I can feel it seeping through my bones. Yet I know there’s more to unlock. Let us refine it further, drive it to perfection. One more ritual, then I will have Zarach’s final gift.”
I can't wait to see it.

Galtrak is practically vibrating with energy when he approaches you. "I think I've found the last sigils. This could be it - the power we've been working towards so diligently." He looks at you expectantly.
Well let’s find out, shall we?

A bone-chilling grin spreads across his face. \n“I was hoping you would say that. I have collected enough, so we can meet at the shrine whenever you are ready. Bring some of your troops, to revel in the blessing with us.”
I will see you there.

Once more, you watch as the massive orc paints the glowing sigils, the ritual place around him drenched in blood. He begins to chant something you cannot understand, tracing more delicate symbols along his arms and chest. \n\nThe wind picks up, carrying the gut wrenching smell of all the blood over to you and your troops. You hear someone dry heaving from the odor. It is pungent. A sudden frenzy erupts among your troops. Some collapse to the ground shaking with fits, while others draw blades across their own skin, beckoning forth the shining, red liquid.
What the-!

A powerful surge of magic floods your senses and the metallic taste of blood coats the inside of your mouth. You feel it, the power. Wild and untamed, it rushes through all of you, envelops you, pushes all your physical limitations away. You feel… truly, wildly, maddeningly alive.
What power!

Galtrak nods at you in recognition. "That's how magic is meant to feel, don't you agree?" Relishing the sensation, he closes his eyes and extends his arms as if to embrace the entire world.\n\n"I must confess, I didn't think you were strong enough to endure. I have underestimated you, my brother in blood. I'll stand by your side. You've more than earned my trust and sword."
I am glad to hear it.
A village in red
You need Galtrak with you to conduct the sacrifice.

I have taken on a new protégé. Galtrak seems driven by nothing but bloodlust and a complete disregard for other's lives.\n\nI have yet to determine whether his claims of being a blood mage are true or not.
Galtrak will approach you once he settled in.
Finish the adventure Blood Sacrifice to continue.
Galtrak has completed his journey and became:
Blood For Zarach
Use [tutorial]Galtrak's world ability[/] to gather sacrificial blood. About two villages worth should suffice.
Altar of Blood
A pool of deep red blood surrounds the altar, feeding it power.
Sacrifice a [tutorial]non-fantastic[/] unit and gain [shaper]Sacrificial Blood[/]. Part of the [mXp] is added to every unit in the stack. The [unit]tier[/] of the sacrifice multiplies the effect.

Sacrificing {who} yields

Sullied Village
Serrated Blades
Makes all units' attacks in a stack cause bleeding in their next battle.
Wall of Thorns
Sacrifice the population of an [tutorial]urban[/] tile collecting [bonus]Sacrificial Blood[/] in the process.

Galtrak’s power is rising with each drop of blood he spills. He possesses a magic I cannot seem to drive from my mind. \n<s> I do regret the sacrifices it demands. </s> \nI hope in the end it will lead to a greater understanding.
The potency of blood magic is truly astonishing. I cannot help but admire it.
More Blood For Zarach
Galtrak needs more blood in his ever growing hunger. The potency of blood magic is truly astonishing. I cannot help but admire it.
Paint The World Red
Even more blood is demanded and I fear the people of the realm will despise me if I continue on this path. Will it ever be enough?
So you brought him to me.

One of the guards opens his mouth, yet not a word comes out. The other gives him a nudge, and he coughs.\n\n“We caught the so called Gutter. He was in a frenzy, killing a whole village and drawing strange symbols onto the ground with their blood. Magic, no doubt. We thought that, well, you are a mage. This is more your expertise than ours, so...”
Shuffling from one foot to the other, the men and women before you look a little lost. \n\n"We need to take action against it. Please, we need your help. A few coins to hire soldiers would suffice."
The Bloodreaper is under my protection.
Of course I will help you.
I do not have coin to spare.

A barking laugh comes from the orc and the guards tense.

"I have only discovered this power recently. I am a hunter, first and foremost." Galtrak leans forward, dragging the guards each a step forward involuntarily.

" I have discovered several ways to harness this magic. I could share more about my craft. Assuming you choose to spare my life, that is."
You shall join my troops. Welcome, Galtrak.
This magic is forbidden, and for good reason. Better kill him.
Blood Cult
Onwards.
A huge commotion breaks lose in your tower. Your door is burst open and guards swarm in. \n\n“Are you all right, master mage?”
I am, what is wrong?
He attacked one of our own. His bloodlust must've gotten the better of him. He carves symbols into the body and... They're still alive, but badly hurt.
Galtrak! Explain yourself!
“Master Mage!” Your morning rituals are disrupted by the concerned face of one of your troops, floating as an image before you.\n\n“It’s Galtrak, he…"
Out with it, what's wrong?
The face vanishes and Galtrak appears, cheeks splattered with blood droplets, sweat on his forehead. \n\n“I did what I had to do. If the blood does not flow, neither can the magic.”
What do you mean?
The orc wipes his blood smeared face on his sleeves. \n\n"If I stop drawing blood, I cannot draw magic. I ensured my power remains. And besides, your servant still lives."
Still, harming my troops is out of the question.
Galtrak huffs and his face takes on a dangerous expression. \n\n“You do not know what you are asking, mage. You can tell a wolf to stop hunting, but it’s in its blood and spirit. It’s instincts.”
Still. I said no.

“Fine, I won’t do it again.”

He steps closer, his eagerness drawing in your full attention. 

“Once you had a taste of the power, you will understand. Trust me. I will lead you to might you can only imagine.”
So long as you don't harm my followers...

A grin creeps onto the orcs face, dangerous and greedy.

“Deal.” 

He vanishes, leaving you to contemplate the conversation.
I hope he keeps his promise.
“The Gutter, he escaped. He was in the dungeon but a few hours, when we heard alarms from the nearby village. It’s another bloodbath.”
We'll catch that bloody bastard!
The guards salute and dash off. You notice that the guards in front of your door have doubled in the meantime, no doubt to protect you in case the orc returns.
What a mess.
Yet another day, where you are disrupted in your studies by your troops calling on you. A panic-stricken face greets you in the shimmering illusion. \n\n“M-master, Galtrak has, he, uhm, well...”
Out with it!

The soldier glances sideways at something beyond your facial field. You adjust the frame and Galtrak comes into view, covered in seeping wounds. His breath is ragged and his whole body shakes lightly.
What happened, were you attacked?
A gurgling chuckle comes forth from the orc as he shakes his head. \n\n“I did what needed doing. I told you before, blood must flow for my magic to exist.”
You... cut yourself like that?
“I haven’t had to do so in a long time. I almost forgot how... exquisite the pain is.”
You need a healer.
He dismisses your comment with a wave. \n\n"I have suffered worse during the Iron Trials."
The Iron Trials?

Every orc of the Sharok tribe has to survive them. Once you are of age, you and someone close enter a cave blessed by Zarach. Only one is to exit again. It was the first time I felt the magic.

Absentmindedly, he drags a blade over his lower arm and watches the blood fall.
I assume you killed your fellow clan member?

A lopsided grin appears on his harsh face. \n\n"And who are you to judge my tribe's customs? I have gained more power than any of your puny subjects could ever dream of. I do not regret it. Enough talk. I want to kill something."
Fine, you do you.

His eyes stay focused on the blood droplets staining the ground beneath him, as he continues his story.

"I was cut so many times I fainted from blood loss. My brother thought me dead, so he turned away. And that was his mistake. I heard a whisper then. The calling of my own life force leaving my body."

His fist clenches a few times and he turns to look at you again.

"I don't know if it was Zarach himself or not, but something showed me then how to use it. How to cut. How to draw the power of blood. I took my time, killing my brother, savouring every slash."
That sounds barbaric.
I begin to regret taking you in.
A fiery temper. I like it.

Troll
Morgak
Do you want to feel my wrath, demon?

The creatures size you up. A deep growl reverberates in their throats, signaling their impending attack. \n\nFocusing your magic on them, you quickly cast a controlling spell on the first few, forcing them to attack their brethren. Your troops watch in awe, as the creatures fall upon one another, scratching and biting.
This should soon be over.
Do as I say, lest I unleash my demons!
The snarling growls of your demonic servants draws the dwarf's' attention. You can see them swallow hard at the frightening visage of the demon in your command. "H-how can we be of service?"
Leave now and don't look back.
The granite dwarves hurry off, shoving each other out of the way and making sure to put as much distance between your demon and them as possible.
Now let's have a look at this cart.
Demons, no doubt.
There is a demonic symbol next to 'fire'.
There is absolutely no doubt in your mind that, should you touch that book, you will summon a demon that will attack any intruders.
Take a closer look at 'nature'.
Take a closer look at 'guards'.
Touch the book.
You press at the cover and with a soft click, a hidden door hisses open. Just as you assumed, you find yourself face to face with a horde of angry demons.
I can sense a demonic presence. Move carefully.

You warn your troops as the ground begins to buckle underneath you finally breaking open and releasing a group of the demonic creatures. You have prevented your troops from falling prey to an ambush, so they now fight on more equal terms.
Hah, this will be easy.
You better run or I'll get real angry.

Your eyes turn a demonic black and the thieves look mortified. They have obviously underestimated their prey. \n\nWithout so much as a supressed scream, they turn and run the other direction, leaving you standing before the now abandoned camp.
Let's have a look at their things.
Rifling through their belongings brings a letter to the light of day. It has no seal and seems to be the only thing of potential value.
What does it say?
Give them a little demon as a pet.

You produce a little imp to entertain the guests. It promptly jumps on the bridemother's back and begins pulling her hair, then bites the maid of honor's nose with a cackling glee. At the sight of the creatures, the guests panic - some trying to catch it, others fleeing.\n\nWithin moments, the whole affair descends into utter chaos and the devastated bride screams "This is all your fault, " between sobs. "You and your creature are not welcome here! Leave!"
They obviously don't appreciate a little joke.
I think Uram has some interesting ideas...
Then I will have a word with those demons.
You prowl forward, not even trying to hide your approach. Immediately, you find yourself surrounded by guards and demons, all eager to end your life.
Have you truly sunken so low as to serve these weaklings?

The humanoid guards exchange frightened looks while the demons regard you with growing interest before turning toward them. A shiver runs through the guards before the first drops his weapon and runs. Spurred on by this, a fight breaks loose, demons against humans. It is a bloodbath from which the infernal creatures emerge as the winners. Satiated with the fight, they leave.\n\nIt seems they were not quite convinced by whatever Uram has promised them in return for their service.
Hokan will be pleased.
Raiding the {what} grants you
I see we share the same ideals. Who are you?
Fascinating theory.
That reeks of demonic possession.

The longer you observe the strange behavior, the more obvious it becomes: those soldiers are possessed by something. You let your magic pierce the mind of one of them and find the gnawing hunger of an insect within.
They are literal pests! Attack!
I will cast you out, vermin.

You press harder against the presence of the wriggling creature with your magic. The soldier breaks down and begins to shake violently as the animal burrows deeper into the head of the screaming man.\n\nThen your magic finally finds purchase. With a firm tug, you rip the worm-like entity out. With a splattering of blood, it lands on the ground, writhing and seeking a new host.
You are coming home with me.
We better follow them.

While you are occupied, the others have fled, moving jerkily in a puppet-like fashion.\n\nThe creature before you is not a demon - though it may have been spawned by the union of an insect and some demonic creature. Certainly an interesting find - who would have thought demons could mate with other creatures?
I recognize a power in you...
I can't wait to see your real face.
About time indeed. Who are you, demon?

You ended your turn but there are still things that might require attention. This window will always pop up if that's the case.

You can bypass it by selecting [tutorial]Force End Turn[/].

Tip: If you have stacks that should stay put and don't want that to alert you constantly, select them and use the [tutorial]Wait or Sleep[/] commands!
Unit Leveling

Whenever a unit receives enough [mXp] to level up, you can choose one out of several random upgrades.
Depending on the unit's type and race the possible upgrades vary.

Every few levels a major upgrade can be chosen.
Weeks

Whenever a new week dawns, it brings change to the world.
A new [tutorial]random effect[/] will impact all beings, while the previous one disappears.

Additionally, all cities and shops will have new inventory.

A good ballpark indicator to compare stacks to each other is to look at their [tutorial][istackpower:c] Stack Power[/].
The bigger the difference, the more likely a victory without losses.

Note that individual unit's special strengths and weaknesses are not covered by this!
Stack Power

Use your stacks to explore your surroundings. Many locations offer [tutorial]Loot[/] when entering them for the first time.\n\nIf you have stacks that should stay put, select them and use [tutorial]Wait or Sleep[/]!
What to do with stacks
Always remember to negate any [point_life]<sprite name="elementalpoint">Life[/] essence using [item]Items[/] containing [point_death]<sprite name="elementalpoint">Death[/] essence.

Select one or more units by left clicking [mMouseLeft] on the <nobr>[iwalk:c]Movement Point-Button</nobr> below their portrait.\n\nWhen all units are selected, right click [mMouseRight] on another position to split the stack.

Press [mGamepadDpadDown] to access the stack bar at the bottom.

Select units by using [mGamepadDpadLeft] and [mGamepadDpadRight] or [mGamepadLeftStick] and press [mGamepadButtonBottom01].

When all units are selected press [mGamepadButtonBottom03] to change into the split stack mode.

Now press [mGamepadButtonBottom03] again while over another position to split the stack.
Upkeep

Units get paid upkeep on a daily basis. Most of them get paid [mGold], while magical ones require [mMana] instead.

Your income is currently not covering your expenses, with most locations [tutorial]depleting[/] within the next few turns.

[gold]In this tutorial you'll be taught how to avoid this situation.[/]

As you approach the large gate, the guards salute to you respectfully.

"Royal magician. It is a great honor to receive your help. Please, come right through."

I expected nothing less from you than a decisive victory. The king bows his head slightly, a gesture of respect and gratitude. He then extends a hand and you turn over the royal decree.

"You have done a great service not only to Sevenkeeps, but to all Fiara. May access to the Seat of Kings help you in your future endeavors."

The hall fills with cheers and applause.

The gates open and one of the guards comes to stand beside you, pointing towards a swirling mass of dark clouds in the distance.\n\n"This is the castle. The place is crawling with undead. May the light of the Allfather guide you safely."

As you turn to leave, it is as time suddenly stands still. Movement around you seems to slow to a halt and all sound is erased from existence. A hooded figure approaches you, uttering a single sentence:

"We'll be in touch."

The illusion is gone as quickly as it came, and the world returns to normal.
How ominous...
Welcome 2
bla
Beware of [tutorial]Nature's Wrath[/]! As this creature will get stronger and more enraged the more wildlife dies.\n\nMake sure to target it in time as it may grow too powerful if left unchecked!

This massive boulder is completely immune to [mPhysical] damage. Its powerful [tutorial]Shockwave[/] ability can seriously damage your army if you let it wander into your ranks.\n\nIntercept it with a physical damage resistant unit to keep the rest of your troops safe, or attack it relentlessly in [mMeleeAttackType] to drain its [mActions] and deny it its turn.
This unit can access [malus][itower:c][/] locked adventures without your tower being present.
Golem Stack

In this stack you will find two [tutorial]Constructs[/]. They are immune or resistant to both [mPhysical] and [mElemental] damage but deal these damage types when attacking.

You should engage them with units that deal [mDeath] or [mWhite] damage which will bypass their [mArmor] and Resistances, and instead works against their [mWillpower].

Bring front line units with a lot of [mHealth] and [mArmor] to absorb most of their attacking damage.
Beast Stack

This stack consists of Beasts led by a Nature Elemental. Beasts are more vulnerable to [mElemental] but make up for it with their ferociousness and speed.\n\nPay special attention to the [tutorial]Griffon[/] and the [tutorial]Nature Elemental[/]!
Undead Stack

The Undead assemble in larger quantities than other races and their complete immunity against afflictions of the mind makes them hard to stop. Their innate weaknesses against [mWhite] or [mElemental] damage should be exploited!\n\nCertain Undead have the annoying habit of reviving after a few turns. Inspect the [tutorial]Vampires[/] and the [tutorial]Lich[/].
Demon Stack

This stack consists of Demons, creatures that both resist and specialize in [mElemental] damage.\n\nYour stack consist of units that deal [mElemental] and [mWhite] damage, which is not ideal. But you'll learn how to turn this into a victory.

This dwarven invention is surrounded by a [tutorial]Flaming Shield[/] causing the [tutorial]Burning[/] Status Effect to everything it touches.\n\nOccupy them with units that have [mElemental] resistances, are immune to Burning, or remove this status effect with water.
This noble creature has sharp claws, ripping through [mArmor] with ease. Its pure aura is making it completely immune to [mWhite] but somewhat weak to [mDeath] damage.

The perfect choice for fighting beasts, the [tutorial]Corrupted Elder[/] has the ability to turn animals temporarily to your side.\nKeep him protected as the enchantment will break if the caster dies!

These Undead masters does not only bring [tutorial]Darkness[/] wherever they go but are also able to [tutorial]revive[/] fallen soldiers as Walking Dead to their side.\n\nMake sure it doesn't come to that by targeting them first or preventing them from using their [mFocus].

Vampires have the ability to [tutorial]revive after a few turns[/] of lying dead.

To counter this, make sure to kill them last or finish other enemies in time.
You can also get rid of their corpses, for example by consuming them or raising them as Undead yourself.

Well, Reinald looks at you curiously, "I have heard that a group of orcs has infiltrated the Westguard. There is also this village that keeps attracting calamity.\n\nIf you could deal with these disturbances, I would be impressed indeed."
I know, the refugees are draining my funds.

Origins
Astromancer

Be an Astromancer, a siphoner of celestial power.
Gaze upon the night sky and chart the constellations with your gemstones to harness their energy and unlock the universe's hidden potential.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
You prefer slowly building up your power and figuring out constellation puzzles, without fear of losing progress.
Astromancy

Astromancy is the study of celestial bodies and their influence on the spheres below.\n\nAstromancers gaze at the stars, harnessing their power by creating enchanted jewels and arranging them into matching constellations. In doing so, they invoke celestial boons that turn the tides of fate in their favor.

I am Miyabi the Mystic, scholar of the stars and apprentice to our late master.\n\nRustling through various pockets, he produces measuring devices, star charts, trinkets, and countless notes on the celestial movements above Eo. Among them, you recognize a few penned in your master's familiar handwriting.

Read the stars for them.

You dramatically lay out various instruments - some entirely unrelated to your craft. Gazing at the stars, you hum thoughtfully, letting out a few exaggerated oh’s and ah’s before making your decision.
I'll give them a positive reading.
I'll give them a negative reading.

With poetic flair, you present the newlyweds their star charts, weaving a tale of cosmic harmony. You paint their union as destined, using flowery words to ignite their love even further.\n\nIn return, you receive marvelous dishes and drinks, each one seemingly surpassing the previous in delicacy and extravagance.

With a grave tone, you point to misaligned constellations and ominous planetary shifts. You weave a tale of hardships, warning of cosmic forces pulling them apart. Luckily for them, you arrived with just the right tools. \n\nYou pull a few worthless crystals from your pocket, speaking of their inherent power to bring good fortune and shift the tide for the newlyweds. The people, elated, eagerly chip in, spending plenty of money, on the couple's future.
Well I had fun at least.

I, too, am a child of Nor.

As you approach the old watchtower, the scent of blood lingers in the air. The banners of the militia still flutter above, but the bodies of slain guards at the entrance tell a different story.

"State your purpose, outsider!"

You spin around just to look down the shafts of dark elven spears.
When the last dark elf falls, silence returns to the watchtower. With no more threats in sight, you and your troops scour the building, claiming whatever valuables remain.

The elves hesitate as they sense the power coursing through you. Murmurs spread among them - doubt turns to reverence.

"You walk in His shadow..." one whispers.

Kneeling, a small detachment pledges their blades to you, willing to follow wherever your path may lead.

The dark elves burst into laughter at your offer, their amusement short-lived. Your troops barely have time to react before being overwhelmed, left bruised and humiliated.\n\n"We’ll take your gold," one says. "But know this - you earn our loyalty with blood, not coin."

Ruin is brought by\n<color=#FFEFDC>Zahaar the Snake</color>
