A vicious hiss announces Zahaar’s presence, his voice dripping with vitriol.\n\n"You have thwarted my  plans long enough. You will rue standing in my way, mage!" the dark elf says, staring at you with unflinching malice. "You will suffer for this as I end you ever so slowly, to afford you ample time to repent your foolishness."
Text
Origins

With your tower established and the basics mastered, delve deeper into the mysteries of the Allfire. Expand your domain, gather knowledge and grow stronger.\n\nWill you find friends in the ranks of the Circle? Or just enemies?
Straight Into Action: Start with everything unlocked and the world at your fingertips.
Choose an origin story that determines your starting location and troops.
Origins (Random)
1. Basics
Follow a guided scenario to learn the basic game mechanics, such as movement, harvesting, and crafting.
Choose Your Origin
2. Combat & Stacks
Follow a guided scenario to learn more about stack splitting and managing and using spells or equipment in preparation for a fight.
3. Economy & Domain
Follow a guided scenario to learn advanced mechanics, such as expanding your domain, moving your tower, and managing resources.
The King's Mage
<align="left"><smallcaps>Grab your Grimoire</smallcaps><size=90%>\n* <indent=5%>Select your stack.</indent>\n* <indent=5%>Move your stack onto your Grimoire.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>Reach the Tower</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Cast "Freeze Water" from your Grimoire onto the river to be able to cross it.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Move your stack onto the tower.</indent>
* <indent=5%>End your turn to replenish your stack's movement points and advance your casting.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>Build the Alchemy Lab</smallcaps><size=90%>\n* <indent=5%>Access your tower and build the Alchemy Lab in one of the empty rooms.</indent>\n* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance room completion.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>Hire a Dwarven Worker</smallcaps><size=90%>\n* <indent=5%>Access your tower's hiring screen and start training a worker.</indent>\n* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance completion.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>Harvest a Pumpkin</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Move a worker onto a pumpkin.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Select the Harvest Plant skill from the stack's bottom skillbar.</indent>
* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance progress.</indent>

Good afternoon, students, and welcome to Wizardry 101. 

First, familiarize yourself with your surroundings by clicking on anything you see. 

Make sure you read all the hints I have to offer, and once you are ready, grab your Grimoire.
Your Grimoire

The Grimoire is a mage's bread and butter. It holds your research and spells, as well as any interesting information you acquired. \n\nIt's profoundly empty now, but the more you travel the world, the more you'll be able to fill it.

Now let's head to your tower. Alas, the bridge over the river seems to have been destroyed. You'll want to use magic to cross. 

The 'Freeze Water' spell in your Grimoire will come in handy.

Och, quite dusty. You should really clean here from time to time.

This is your seat of power. From here, you command your minions. Tell them what to do and where to go. 

Can you see the power it radiates? That is your domain. Everything within is under your spell, so to say. Every mage's tower emits such a field.

Your tower also provides you with a basic income each turn. You can channel your energy towards gaining more [mMana], or invest more towards your [mResearch]. \n\nIn fact, there is a new spell in your Grimoire you should research right now.

<align="left"><smallcaps>Research the "Corrode" spell</smallcaps><size=90%>\n* <indent=5%>Open your Grimoire and start the research process.</indent>\n* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance progress.</indent>
Tower, Sweet Tower

Well done! With your research underway, we can focus on more pressing matters.
You are supposed to be a capable alchemist, but without a workshop, you are little more than a scholar with a few empty vials.

So let's build you a new laboratory in your tower.

Ah, the foul smell of sulfur in the morning!
You can now brew potions and mix concoctions of all kinds. 
Other mages will dabble in similar activities, crafting glyphs or raising armies of undead.

But you are special, of course! 

So take a look at your ingredients and show me what you can do.
Rest in Pieces

Well knock me over with a feather! 
What have we got here? Undead in these parts?

They've made themselves quite at home in your domain. Their presence means that you won't receive the benefits of any location they inhabit. Until you have driven them out them, that is.

You don't have to fight them right away.

You can take the time to prepare the 'Corrode' spell from your Grimoire first, or hire more units. 
Some axewielders might come in handy. Or maybe you can craft a helpful potion? 

What are you waiting for? Go teach them a lesson!

<align="left"><smallcaps>Brew a Potion</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Go to your Alchemy lab.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Assemble a valid recipe.</indent>
* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance the crafting progress.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>Defeat the Undead occupying the graveyard</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Hire combat units to match the Undead stack's power <size=70%>[istackpower:c]</size>.</indent>
* <indent=5%>(Optional) Craft potions to aid in combat.</indent>
* <indent=5%>(Optional) Cast Corrode from your Grimoire on the enemy.</indent>

Ah, look at you, making....lunch?!
Well, I suppose we all have to start somewhere.

Now it's time to ensure a steady flow of resources for your elixirs. Relying on looted locations won't cut it forever.

You’ll need Workers to gather resources for you. Where you can get those, you ask?
Simple! You can hire them in the nearest city, or even train your own. Let me show you how!
This outpost is within your domain and therefore allows you to train certain units.\n\nTake a look and hire a couple Dwarven Workers, while you're at it.
Doesn't it feel empowering to have lackeys bow to your every whim?\n\nBut they are a bit slow by themselves. Here, have more workers! That will speed up the task.
Splendid! Now that you have mastered the harvesting of the land's bounty, I wonder what your next experiment will be? A foul brew or a refreshing potion? I-!\n\nWhat's that noise?
To Main Menu
Continue with Part 2 - "Combat & Stacks"
This concludes our lessons today.\n\nNow, venture forth and choose your path.
Proving Grounds

Congratulations, your workers are ready! 
These diligent dwarves can harvest plants and ores. Keep an eye out for resources - the rarer the material, the more advanced the potion.

For now, let them harvest those pumpkins over there.
King's Order
For the King!

By order of the Crown, you must bring down Castle Meldec and return light to this forsaken land - by wit, by force, or any means necessary.

<align=right>His highness,
the King of the Highmark

Very good, you are quite skilled. 

Don't fret over souls lost in battle – you can always hire new minions to do your bidding. 
They are quite expendable.

But you, you are destined for greatness. I can sense it!

Welcome to SpellForce - Conquest of Eo, great mage!

This tutorial will teach you the basics of the game.
Messages like this will pop up once you click on things in the world, explaining what they do.

If you ever don't know what to do next, have a look at the [tutorial]Tasks[/] in the top right corner.
This is a tutorial scenario.

Good afternoon, students, and welcome to 
Economics 101.

Here, you'll learn how to expand your domain, collect and manage resources, and distribute your income.

A fantastic question! The most important ones are:

[mGold] - Enables you to make purchases in shops, pay upkeep for your units or build rooms.

[mMana] - This you will need to both cast and upkeep spells, as well as magically summoned creatures. Sometimes it is even used for rooms.

[mResearch] - The more you research, the faster you discover new spells in your Grimoire. However, research cannot be stored and will be spent immediately.

[mMastery] - This determines how much mana you can cast each day and how much your domain can grow.

[mMight] - This is the pure magical energy that every great mage covets. You can convert it into other resources at will.
What are resources?

It seems you are currently in a bit of a pickle. Your troops demand [mGold], but the locations within your domain are almost depleted.\n\nSome tower rooms can generate [mGold], but it seems you don't have any as of now.

I suggest you go forth and loot locations and sell some items from your inventory. 

This will keep you afloat until you have built the Workshop, a room that generates [mGold] for you.

As a last resort you could also fire some of your units to save on their upkeep costs, but I don't think that's necessary. Not yet, at least.
Good work! Now you have a small but reliable income. But this won't keep your troops fed for long.\n\nLet's look into getting some more.

This mine is on the edge of your domain. If you expand your domain, you can capture it in the process. Then it will start producing [mGold] for your coffers.\n\nTo increase your tower's domain you need to increase your tower level.

Any [mMight] you receive can be converted into other magical resources manipulating the Allfire Flow.

You can convert it into [mMana], [mResearch] and [mProficiency].

Investing in the latter works towards increasing your [mMastery] and thus your tower's level and domain size.

As we do not need [mMana] or [mResearch] right now, you can pull the slider all the way to the bottom left corner.
How do I do that?

<align="left"><smallcaps>Increase your Tower level</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Access the Allfire Flow and direct it towards [mProficiency].</indent>
* <indent=5%>Reach [mMastery] of 10 to level up.</indent>
* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance progress.</indent>

Congratulations, you have secured a stable income! But good things don't last forever.

Over time, locations within your domain will deplete, and growing your following becomes increasingly more expensive, so be mindful of when a location runs out.

That's where apprentices are handy.

These loyal subjects are free of any upkeep cost and go into a special stack slot - so they will lead your troops free of charge!

They each can build one so-called lodge in the world, that spread your domain, just like your tower but more flexible.

And should an apprentice fall in combat, they also revive at their lodges.

When building lodges, make sure they don't overlap with your existing domain to maximize their profits. That way you can cover multiple locations and earn more income.

I suggest you take a look at your apprentice's skills and then set off to find a good place to build a lodge.
Every apprentice can only have one lodge, so choose wisely.

I've taken the liberty of marking some good spots for you with attractive blue flags.

<align="left"><smallcaps>Build a lodge with your apprentice</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Select the "Build Lodge" skill from your apprentice's skillbar and aim it at a desired position.</indent>
* <indent=5%>The preview shows you what area your Domain will cover.</indent>
* <indent=5%>(Optional) Blue flags mark positions where a lodge would cover several income locations.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>Build a Workshop</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Sell items until you have at least 45 [mGold].</indent>
* <indent=5%>Access your tower and build the Workshop in one of the empty rooms.</indent>
* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance progress.</indent>

That's how you build a healthy economy!

What's that? You want more of that sweet sweet Allfire?
Well, look over here then!

Wisps are great scouts as they can traverse any terrain, but they perform poorly in combat. 
Alas, their ability to meld with Allfire nodes makes them invaluable.

Try summoning one! You'll need to adjust the Allfire flow once more, as they need [mMana] as upkeep, but you should be an expert in this by now.

So, summon your wisp and command it to meld with the Allfire.

<align="left"><smallcaps>Summon a Wisp</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Research the "Summon Enchanted Wisp" spell from your Grimoire.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Cast the "Summon Enchanted Wisp" spell.</indent>
* <indent=5%>You may have to adapt your Allfire Flow to speed up the individual steps!</indent>
Simple, just look it up in your Grimoire. \n\nTo create a Wisp, you'll need to [mResearch] the spell first. Make sure to adjust the Allfire flow accordingly, to speed up the process.

<align="left"><smallcaps>Meld the Wisp with the Allfire</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Summon the Wisp within your Domain.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Move the Wisp onto the Allfire Node.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Start the "Meld" skill from the stack's skillbar.</indent>
* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance progress.</indent>

Raw magic in its purest form. You can tap into this power simply by having an Allfire node within your domain.\n\nYou can even create a Wisp, a magical unit that can meld with them. It allows you to take ownership that way, and the Allfire node itself subsequently will emit your domain.
How do I get a Wisp?
Feel that energy!\n\nNow you have enough power for the last but most vital part - moving your tower.

Now try to move your tower over the water. To access the ruins, you'll need to land near them, so that your domain encompasses the location.\n\nNote that your [mMastery] level influences how fast spells will be ready to cast.
Shaper Ruin

You can rip it from the ground and move it elsewhere, even transporting units across water and mountains!
This allows you to change your position when locations run out and move to more profitable area.

Certain locations will even require your tower to be present in order to be accessible.

Like this one!
Whaaaaaaaaat?
The surrounding villages and cities respect you, the people revere you, and even the Circle has extended an invitation to join them. \n\nIf you can successfully prove your worth, that is.

For months you have worked to build your reputation. Your tower now stands as a beacon of arcane power and wisdom.\n\nYou have amassed a small following of loyal subjects willing to fight to the death for you.

You have spent years in the service of the Crown, forming a deep bond with the people of Sevenkeeps and proving your worth more than once.

Now a royal messenger has come to your tower with a scroll bearing the king's personal seal.

"Great mage, the king entrusts you with a task of the utmost importance. Have you ever been to Darkvale?"
They roll up the large parchment again and hold it out to you with a reverent look.\n\n"Take these royal orders as proof of your charge, and know that a great reward awaits, should you succeed."
I might have been. Why?

Darkvale lies cloaked in shadow, its heart, Castle Meldec, has always been a bastion of despair.

The messenger raises the scroll in their hand and begins to read aloud:

"By order of the Crown, you must bring down Castle Meldec and return light to this forsaken land - by wit, by force, or any means necessary."
Your footman returns promptly, a tiny piece of paper with the royal seal in hand. \n"You are expected at the Seat of Kings in Sevenkeeps, Royal Mage. The king wants to thank you personally."

With your task accomplished, you send out a runner to inform the king of your recent victory. \n\nIt has been a mere few hours since your success, yet the dark clouds are already only barely visible over Darkvale.
You have spent years in the service of the Crown, helping [gold]Sevenkeeps[/] wherever you can. But something evil awaits you in Darkvale, testing your skill and resilience.

<align="left"><smallcaps>Land your Tower at the Shaper Ruin</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Cast "Levitate Tower" (check Allfire Flow!)</indent>
* <indent=5%>Stacks can still enter and exit your tower and move with the tower.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Land next to the Shaper Ruin, by pressing the "Land" button in the bottom left.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Enter the Shaper Ruin with a stack.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>When running out of Gold:</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Explore and loot your surroundings.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Sell items from your inventory.</indent>
Great work! Now you can summon the creature.\n\nThis is another point your domain is useful, as you can only summon creatures within its boundaries.
Defender of the Mountain

As a loyal friend of the dwarves, you have defended them from any threat.\nNow the Thane of [gold]Windholme[/] begs for your help once again in defeating their corrupted brethren - the Granite Dwarves.

You have spent years with the dwarves of the Coldmark. When orcs and undead tried to invade the north, you defended the stout residents with all your might and gained their unwavering trust. \n\nThe Thane, grateful for your invaluable help, named you 'Defender of the Mountain' and rewarded you with your very own airship, a rare gift and a great honour.

Now he asks for your help once more. 

The Granite Dwarves have overtaken the grand statue to Niethalf. Reclaim the symbol of our faith, and make haste! 

Your airship will certainly be useful in the crossing of these harsh lands.
Exiled and Hunted

You have chosen a life of seclusion on [gold]Westguard Peak[/]. But when your fellow mages and friends are hunted by the New Purity of Light, you must rise to their defense. Will your numbers be enough to destroy them, or will you be the first to fall?

Years of research into the Shapers have led you deep into the troll-infested region of [gold]Norgate[/].\nNow you stand on the brink of uncovering one of their best-kept secrets, but can you survive the dangers of spelunking in these ruins?
Archaeologist
Beast Tamer
Loot locations, build a workshop, got it.
What do you mean?
I didn't say anything.

The Shapers, a long forgotten race, have once populated these lands. They left some astounding artifacts behind, but their ruins are magically sealed. \n\nIn fact, any location with a [itower:c] symbol, will require your tower's presence to even allow entrance.
Your love of nature has won you many friends in [gold]Southwatch[/] - animals and humanoids alike. But now something has awakened and is threatening the well-kept peace of this region.
The Invader
After years of traveling amongst the orcs of the Iron Storm clan, the chieftain decides to invade [gold]Gillyshire[/]. But then something happens that forces you to rethink your loyalty...
Clear the grand statue of Niethalf of the scum that is the Granite Dwarves.
Mountain King's Order
Wrest control of the Niethalf Statue from the occupiers
Free Castle Meldec
Return to the Seat of Kings
Bonded Animal
Defeat the New Purity in Stormwatch Faste

Recently, you found a link between at least three of the ruins - a line of text that took you hours to translate from the ancient script and seemed terribly out of place:

'One key to claim them all.'

You decide to explore these ruins further, determined to uncover their secrets.

Even days after your triumph at Stormwatch Faste, the people of Westguard, especially the mages, are still celebrating your victory.\n\nWhile you have returned to your tower, many of your friends can finally return to their homes or build new ones.

'Yet there is a great potential despite your shortcomings. Thus, we extend to you this challenge: Prove your worth through action. Undertake the trials set before you, and show us why you deem to deserve a place among us.

Should you falter, we shall take it as a confirmation of our doubts. Should you succeed, we will have no choice but to acknowledge your merit. For now, you remain an outsider.

May the Guardians keep you.'

Now the New Purity have begun a brutal purge, killing and torturing mages for 'perverting the will of Aonir' with their magic. Or so they proclaim.

Many are turning to you for shelter and help, but the steady stream of people in need is draining your resources. You must do something.

The best option would be to rid the Westguard of this foul influence once and for all. But you'll need a strong army to march against Stormwatch Faste.
You and a few chosen ones decided to leave the clan and forge a path for yourselves. One goal remains foremost in your mind - to slay Yarbag and claim his title.

What was once a bustling city of traders and merchants is now a desolate wasteland. Houses have been burned to the ground, the earth torn up by claws, and the occasional splash of blood decorates the last remnants.

You return to the thane with the good news and are greeted with fanfares and cheers. \n\n"From the bottom of my heart, thank you. The ones you destroyed were no longer brethren. They were mere puppets, possessed by evil. Please accept our humble thanks. We will carry word of your greatness to the Circle. Niethalf protect you, esteemed wizard."
Driven from their homes, a new group of wizard refugees will come to you every week.

I have given you fair warning. Your presence shall no longer stain this mountain. Once the scum is removed from the surface, we shall prevail.\n\nThe dwarf mage smiles mirthlessly. "Say your prayers, mutt."

For years you have tended your gardens and cared for the surrounding forests. You are as  important to the local flora and fauna as you are to the populace. People and animals alike come to you for help and guidance.

Plumes of smoke rise and the smell of burning wood lies heavy in the winds. From the same direction, you can see movement in the forest.\n\nA large creature has awoken along with the flames, old as the forest itself and powerful - a treant.
Forest Fire
The fire rages through the forest, unstoppable and with the ferocity of a rabid wolf.\n\nSurely you can extinguish the flames, all you need is water!
Barking orders, you manage to divide and conquer. The flames soon die down to nothing more than embers. A sigh of relief escapes your lips, and it seems to be mirrored by the forest.

You survey the area and realize you are not alone. Dark shapes approach, moving swiftly through the trees. When they emerge, you finally understand where the fires came from.\n\nDemons have risen in Southwatch! Their appearance must have angered the treant. But now that you took care of the fires, maybe it can be calmed?
From what you can tell, if you extinguish all the flames, including the ones that are consuming it, you may be able to appease the treant.

When the enormous body finally falls, it is as if a part of the forest dies with it. You can feel a deep pain at the sound of splintering wood and rustling leaves, yet you also know, that you have saved hundreds.\n\nYou lay the maddened creature to rest, and return home.
The hulking figure eyes you with distrust, but it makes no attempt to strike you. Slowly, you pour the water over the smoldering bark and snuff out the last of the greedy flames.
The wooden giant charges through Southwatch, not caring who or what gets in its way. It too has been burned by the flames, some of them still smoldering, eating away at it like a festering wound.
The Burning Tree
You pour the second liquid over the treant, and it's formerly red eyes watch you intently. When you are finished and get up to leave, the creature follows you, steadfast by your side.\n\n

The incessant muttering of the granite dwarves sends shivers down your spine. They have gathered around the great statue, praying to Niethalf in their grating, rolling mother tongue.

"Ah, the famed mage has arrived."

The deep voice sounds as old as the mountain itself, as hard as the rock beneath your feet.

A cloaked figure steps forward, stout in build and with a cane in hand, no doubt a magical conduit.

"I have heard many tales describing your aptitude for the arcane. I can see that it's not mere talk, Niethalf's gift glows strong in you. I can respect that."

The figure pulls back the hood. Two eyes, as white as the snow around you, pierce yours. The dwarf seems to be ancient.

Ah, curious young one. I am far beyond years and names.
A throaty chuckle tumbles from the dwarf's lips. 

"I respect, that you have been bestowed the gift of magic. But you are not one of us. Your mere presence is an offense. So I will offer you only this - walk away now, and we will not harm you or yours. But if you do not turn away now, we will return your bodies to the ground that you sprung from."
I will only leave with your head.

The ruthless Granite Dwarves did everything to kill you, but they underestimated your power. \nBy crushing their bodies and souls, you hope to rid the Windwall Mountains of any further incursions by these fanatics.

Enjoying your recent success, you notice a plain scroll on your desk that was definitely not there before. The seal, the signet of the Circle, is unbroken. \n\nExpecting some kind of magic to erupt from it, you lift it hesitantly. But the scroll remains ordinary and unremarkable.
I wonder what that's all about...

‘To the aspiring mage,

We have followed your recent rise in fame with interest, observing the ripples you leave in your wake. You have achieved much, but with every triumph comes scrutiny.

Many among us view your achievements as lacking refinement, your methods reckless, and your intentions ill-suited to the values we uphold.'
What?! Are they mocking me?

You copy the Circle’s list of trials into your Grimoire, pondering each of them in turn.\n\nNone of it is unachievable, but you are certain that the Circle will put obstacles in your path. At least now you know, that you have made an impression on this arrogant lot.
I will show them what greatness means!
At least one of them seems civil.

A look of disgust creeps across his face. "How dare you defile the name of the great Niethalf with your filthy tongue, traitor? You would do well to respect us being the one true people of the god."\n\nThe dwarf raises his arms in a slow, menacing gesture. "I will beat out each and every one of you filthy impurities from the face of Niethalf's blessed earth."
In Niethalf's name, stop this madness!
Demon Stack

<align="left"><smallcaps>Defeat the Demon Stack</smallcaps><size=90%>\n* <indent=5%>Split your Tiara's Priestesses from your stack, as they cannot traverse mountains.</indent>\n* <indent=5%>Move the other stack over the mountains and attack the demon stack.</indent>
That's it! \n\nNow, if you were to fight this stack from an adventure, there is no backing out. So be sure to be ready, before you commit.

You can speed up their healing by placing them in certain locations, such as caves, inns or even your tower.

Some plants on the map can heal your stacks instantly and replenish once a week. 

Like this one! Why don't you try moving onto it?
It's currently hiding behind the mountains and not everyone can traverse those. \n\nSplit your stack into those who can and those who cannot move over such terrain. Flying also works, of course.
Shaper Keystone

<align="left"><smallcaps>Defeat the Construct Stack</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Inspect the enemy units to learn about them.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Split and combine your stacks to counter the enemy's strengths.</indent>
* <indent=5%>(optional) Equip your units with Glyphs to improve their abilities.</indent>

With a hiss, a hidden compartment in the floor opens, revealing a glowing outcrop. 
A rune? No. 

The keystone! A rare artifact indeed! This will certainly speed up any future research.
Delving into the ruin, you sniff the stale air with pleasure. You can practically smell the ancient knowledge, hidden within these halls.
So much power... I am close.

Three braziers stand in the middle of the otherwise empty room. On the other side is a door, firmly shut.
You have the distinct feeling that you need to light one of the braziers, but which one? The Shapers liked to hide traps everywhere. 

Upon closer inspection, you can see faded runes on the leftmost brazier, the middle one holds ashes cold as death, while the right one reeks of brimstone.
Those runes read 'flame'. We try this one.
I will try the one with runes.
Ashes hint at previous fires.

Turning left and right, you return to the room that first gave you pause. You study the script upon the walls once more, but the writing seems to melt off the stone and pool at your feet. All except for the single sentence you already translated.

'One key to claim them all.'

It still doesn't make more sense than last time you saw it...
I should return after looking at the other ruins.

Delving into the ruin, you deeply inhale the stale air. You can practically smell the ancient knowledge, hidden within these halls.\n\nThe long, narrow corridor before you suddenly opens up into a large room. A room that you did not come upon the last time you visited.
Did I take a wrong turn?
Brimstone will easily ignite a flame.
Carefully, you light a fire in the brazier on the left. Your troops shuffle nervously behind you as a faint click indicates the opening of the door.

You light a fire in the middle brazier, but the flame flickers blue and a coldness springs forth, freezing your troops and biting their skin.\n\nFortunately, the room seems content with the blood it has drawn, as the door on the other side clicks open.

The pungent smell from the right brazier becomes unbearable with the freshly lit flame. The room slowly fills with clouds of smoke, choking your troops.\n\nHowever, the room seems to have been satiated by this tribute, and the door on the other side opens with a click.

Pressing on, you reach the domed room where you last saw the strange phrase somewhere on those walls covered in script. \n\nA dizziness almost brings you to your knees, as you try to concentrate on the letters.
No! I will not give up now!

You channel your energy towards the script and slowly, you begin to understand a passage.

'... was forged not with reckless ambition, but to grant passage to those who seek knowledge.'

Without blinking, you take the words to paper. At last, a step in the right direction.
Let's have a look at the remaining ruins.
A loud thud echoes through the halls as you leave the ruins. A mechanical whirring and static crackling follows.
We woke a guardian! Run!
Entering the familiar ruins, you confidently open doors and follow corridors until you reach a section you do not recognize.
Are those ruins changing shape?

You turn to leave, but there is no door. Sturdy, thick walls surround you. Before your eyes, letters seem to grow out of one of the walls. 

'I'm there in birth, I'm there in death, yet I cannot be touched or held.'

Words appear below the line of text. One of them must lead you further, but the others will undoubtedly trigger a trap.
Easy. The first and final breath.
A soul?
Time?
Someone's shadow?
Someone's breath?

Leaning forward, you gently blow across the writing on the wall. The letters shift, some disappear, others rearrange themselves to form the word 'enter'.\n\nThe wall then moves back, giving free a doorway to the left.
You utter the words you deem correct, and with a crunching and churning, the walls close in. Spikes shoot from the ground, piercing the legs of your followers and eliciting screams of pain and fear.
Just when you fear your whole group will be squashed like bugs, one of the walls passes through them like mist, allowing free passage.
Guardians, that was close.

Pushing on, you suddenly find yourself in a laboratory. On a table you see a flask, filled halfway, and on the ground before the doorway skeletal remains of what once must have been a human. They have carved a single word into the stone floor with a dagger:\n\n'Poison'.
Hmm. Let's go on.

You step over the skeleton and are about to enter the next room when you hear a hissing sound and see green-yellow mist rising from holes in the floor. 

Backing away, the mixture on the table catches your eye once more. It is an unfinished brew of poison protection.

The flask seems to hold aria, sap and lenya, but what is it missing? Other ingredients are spread out on the table.
A bit of charcoal dissolved.
Let's try some ash.
We must add dust of charcoal.
A heatstone will do the trick.

You finish the concoction and give it to your troops. Each takes a gulp of the vile potion, then you lead them on. The room fills with the poisonous gas again and at first, everything seems fine. Then the first of your followers retches and coughs, and the others soon follow. \n\nYou rush them through the room, but the poison has taken hold of them. Only those without flesh seem unaffected by the smoke.
When you hand the finished antidote to your troops, they all take a sip. Then you lead them through the smoky room and, as predicted, not one succumbs to the noxious fumes.

You reach the innermost rooms, where a large obelisk stands in the middle. The writing flitting over the surface of the stone gives you a headache, but you push through the pain and read as much as you can.
Eventually, the words seem to slow down and you can make out a single sentence:

'...a gift to the diligent, a test for the unworthy, and a legacy...'
That's it. Let's return to the first ruin.

Dashing form left to right, you add more text, copying your findings onto the walls in charcoal and filling blank spaces. 

'It represents a gift to the diligent, a test for the unworthy, and a legacy that keeps our wisdom safe from chaos. May its finder use it wisely.'

You have spent years studying the Shapers and their great inventions. Visiting their sites and researching their ways has led you deep into the Windwall Mountains, where you now find yourself among the lumbering trolls.
My research outweighs the dangers.
Strange Shaper Ruin
Matching Shaper Ruin

You compare your notes with the scripture on the walls here. Suddenly everything clicks into place. You begin to scribble over the existing lines like in a fever dream, crossing out and adding words.

'The Keystone was forged not with reckless ambition, but to grant passage to those who seek knowledge.
Let this stone be our key and sentinel, keeping our sacred sanctuaries safe.'
Yes, yes, it is all coming together.
That's... it.
... was forged not with reckless ambition, but to grant passage to those who seek knowledge.
...a gift to the diligent, a test for the unworthy, and a legacy...
The Shapers have created a Keystone for those worthy of their knowledge.
Notes from the Matching Shaper Ruins
I think it is time to ramp up the challenge. Here is another stack and some new enemies.\n\nI even included some useful spells this time around. Have a look.

You are improving!

Here's another stack and even more enemies.

I also found these glyphs in my pocket, they can improve your units performance. Give them a try, why don't you?

<align="left"><smallcaps>Defeat the Beast Stack</smallcaps><size=90%>\n* <indent=5%>Inspect the enemy units to learn about them.</indent>\n* <indent=5%>Split and combine your stacks to counter the enemy's strengths.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>Defeat the Undead Stack</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Inspect the enemy units to learn about them.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Split and combine your stacks to counter the enemy's strengths.</indent>
* <indent=5%>(optional) Cast spells to turn the odds in your favor.</indent>

<align="left"><smallcaps>Fully heal your Stack</smallcaps><size=90%>
* <indent=5%>Boost healing by visiting certain plant locations.</indent>
* <indent=5%>Garrison your stack in a location with healing benefits (e.g. Inn).</indent>
* <indent=5%>End your turn to advance progress.</indent>
Much better. Later on, you'll also have spells to help heal your troops.\n\nFor now, let me do it for you.

You're welcome!

Oh no, is that... more enemies? Worry not, I'll provide you with new units! 

Now you should have everything you need to claim victory. 
Inspect enemy units to better match their strengths with your own.
Continue with Part 3 - "Economy & Domain"
Double Base Income from [research]Ruins[/] and [research]Shaper Ruins[/] within your [mDomain].
Balance is crucial.
You are making your rounds through the forest when you come across a large patch of scorched earth. It disturbs you, as no creature in this ecosystem should be capable of such destruction.\n\n
By the Allfather!
Spread out and quench the fire!
I'll return with water!
Allfather, that looks torturous.
You examine the scorched earth before you. There is no visible origin, as if the fire sprung from nothing. This more than a mere accident...
How strange.
I don't like this...

Again you sift through the remains of the fire and find... tracks. The earth has been burnt into the shape of paws.
A deep growl reverberates from somewhere within the woods, and an unsettling feeling washes over you. 

Whatever enraged the treant and made these fires, it didn't come alone.
No time to waste, take it down!
Now that you have successfully extinguished most of the forest fires, the treant seems to slow down gradually. Cautiously you approach the large being.
Greetings old one. I come to help.
Here, have this. It will clean your wounds.
Good. Now go back to sleep. You need it.
It seems we have made a friend.

Hours later, you receive a letter from the mayor of Connach, thanking you humbly for your help.\n\n'Without your bravery, all of Southwatch might have been destroyed, consumed by the flames. We shall remember your deeds and proclaim them to the world.'
Just as you prepare to heal the ground, a tremor sweeps through the forest, shaking trees and startling smaller animals into flight. \n\nThen a loud roar rips through the air, pained and ancient.
And indeed, with groans and cracks, the giant retreats back into the forest and soon becomes one with the surrounding nature.
Resolve the situation with the Burning Tree
Solve the Shaper Puzzle
Locate and Defeat Chieftain Yarbag

Your hard work as a resourceful mage won you many friends in the arcane community of the Westguard. \n\nBut when a radical faction, the New Purity of Light, spread across the region, you were forced to retreat to the freezing cold of Westguard Peak to avoid persecution.
I'll prepare as best I can.
Victory is ours!
You followed Reinald's instructions to a small village, but all you see now are the remainders of a broken community.\n\nBlood has soaked into the ground, and you find a few mangled bodies.

The New Purity, that's what. You turn to find a woman standing in the door frame. Her face is puffy from crying and there is blood on her skirts. 

"They killed my boy. My sweet little boy! They killed him, along with everyone else who dared disobey their orders." New tears well up in her eyes.

The New Purity are about to overrun another village when you catch up with them. To the side is a prisoner's wagon with a small group of people caged inside. \n\nAll of them are wearing the horrifying masks the Purity uses to suppress their magic. If worn too long, they will permanently sever one's link to the Allfire.

Anyone with magic must come forward! Anyone who points out a foul sorcerer can come and collect a reward! Magic is heresy against the Allfather and must be punished!\n\nThe crier repeats these words over and over in a cold, steely voice.
Open that wagon and free those mages.

The sneaky little goblin is able to slip through the enemy lines while you distract them with your mere presence. He easily picks the lock and begins to remove the masks.\n\nStill disoriented from their recent loss and regaining of their magic, most of the prisoners are glad to still be alive. But a selected few combine their powers and aim them at your common enemy.

When victory is yours and the last of the mages is finally free of the mask, the people surround you and cheer. 
"You are truly a beacon of hope in these trying times. Thank you, friend."

One of the mages steps forward and hands you a bundle. "I have no doubt you will put this to good use."
A village in need
Where are they now?
They moved on. Looking for their next victims. She steps closer, a plea in her eyes: "If you see them, avenge my boy."
Good afternoon students and welcome to Offense and Defense 101.\n\nToday's lesson is all about building a strong and diverse stack. Let's begin by defeating this demon over there.
That makes sense.

Good work! 

Did you notice that some of your units took damage? 
After a fight, they normally heal a small amount each turn. 

Unless they are Undead, of course. In which case...they don't.
The cold never bothered me anyway.
You don't have to investigate further to know what, or rather who, happened upon this place. This was none other than the orc chieftain's pet wyvern, Ashfang.
This creature is truly dangerous.

You approach the familiar faces and two step forward.

"Don't do this to yourself. Turn away now, as long as you still can."
"Before we grind you into dust!"

Their empty threats mean little to you now.
Those that you once considered brothers and sisters in arms now form a line of defense between you and Yarbag. \nYou'll need to fight them before you can even reach the chieftain and his wyvern.

You feel neither remorse nor pity over slaying your former tribe. They chose their side when they followed Yarbag. 

Now you push deeper into the camp and soon find yourself before the chieftain himself. 

"So you really decided to stand against me, hm?" His left arm is casually draped over his wyvern, Ashfang, stroking it's scales menacingly. This beast will mean a lot of trouble, if you can't eliminate it quickly.
Ashfang, look. Your favorite snack.

Yarbag's face becomes a grimace of hatred as the wyvern trots over and begins to lick the honey from your hands.\n\n"You disloyal, ungrateful little worm! Betraying me to that insufferable mage? I'll show you both what it means to anger me!"

When the din of battle subsides, you walk over to Yarbag. He has dragged his body to Ashfang, leaving a trail of blood. \n\nYou watch as he makes a pitiful attempt to mount the wyvern, but Ashfang shakes him off and looks towards you, begging for more honey.
It seems your reign is over, Yarbag.

Your ambition is matched by your wits and the orcs can see you as more than a fearless chieftain.\n\nYou'll lead them into battle for a fraction of the cost in lives. Your strive for power is balanced by your protective instinct for your clan. This, along with your loyalty, is reason enough for them to follow you.

When his armies marched on Gillyshire and the Highmark, you and your tower stood at the forefront of the invasion.

You felt proud to follow such a capable and mighty leader. Until recently, that is. 
Only hours ago, Yarbag did something bone chilling.
The massacre of Audale.

He has razed the city to the ground, devastating the surrounding lands and destroying anyone who stand in his way - including his own people.\n\nFor the first time, you see fear in your tribe's eyes as he leads them like sheep before the slaughter. Yarbag's hunger for power has spiraled out of control.
I must stop him for the sake of the clan!
Audale in Ashes
Yarbag's camp

Many years ago, you visited the Howling Steppes, a barren, untamed wilderness. It was there, that your talent for magic first caught the attention of Yarbag Ironstorm, an ambitious orc chieftain. \n\nTogether you forged a bond of might and arcane power, your spells cementing his alliances and uniting the warring tribes.

Just as you are about to leave, you notice a sticky substance smeared onto a crumbled wall. What is blood honey doing here?\n\nBut then you remember - the chieftain has used blood honey to tame and reward Ashfang since it was small.

Yarbag laughs in your face.
 "Don't try that again, or you'll regret it."

He whistles a sharp tone and a group of warg riders rush forward. 
"Kill the mageling."
Such a waste...
Maybe I can use this to my advantage...
I wanted to learn his ways.

It was through your efforts, that Yarbag was able to secure a precious prize - a wyvern egg. 

He nurtured the hatchling with care, feeding it blood honey and lizards until it grew strong enough to hunt by his side.

Now he commands 'Ashfang' as easily as others command their wargs, this beast of fury and flame becoming the symbol of his unyielding rule.
I remember it fondly.

You'll never... never take my... place. Yarbag's hateful eyes slowly lose focus and he topples over.\n\nThere is a moment of silence before a rhythmic thumping makes you turn. The remaining survivors have gathered to pay their respects to you as the new chieftain of the Iron Storm clan by banging their shields or pauldrons in unison.
I'll show you what a true leader can do.
Let me guide you to a peaceful life.
Bang the drums to the rhythm of war.

The orcs enraged cries mirror your lust for blood. While Yarbag had the right idea, you will prove to be much more cunning and dangerous than he ever was.\n\nWith this capable army at your side, the world will be at your fingertips. You promise glory to all - even if it costs a few measly orc lives.

The clan's power is strained by constant warfare, but your promise of stability and peace encourages them to move forward. \n\nLeading them with a more balanced approach will make them stronger than ever. And while not all of them agree with your quest for unity, they are grateful that no more of them will die in vain.
Ashfang
Now is the time to seize that power for myself!
Yarbag Ironstorm
Tamed
Text

Cultist Training
Build the [bonus]Ritual Chamber[/] room in your tower
Ritual Chamber

Command the forces that lurk beyond the veil, shaping the world to your whims.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Sacrifice units for strong boons, corrupt locations into demonic powerhouses, and lead an army of demons into this world.

Be a Demonologist, a whisperer to demonic spirits.
Make offerings and lure demonic presences from the realms beyond into this world to possess and feed upon mortals.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Your demons possess mortal units and grow stronger over time.
Once their host dies, the demons return to you - stronger and ready for the next host.
Cultists
[point_arcane]Unlocks Demonology[/]

Demonology is a secretive and forbidden art concerned with the study and appeasement of demons.\n\nSurrounding themselves with Cultists, Demonologists perform rituals with the aim to attract and bind demons through offerings.
Amalgamation Chamber
Infused Memory
Drain Location
Summon Chaotic Spirit
The black stone of the spire radiates heat and darkness. Sulfur and acid burn in the throats and eyes of your troops. A deep growl, like thunder, permeates the area around it.
Then run along, little one. And hurry up, for my patience is wearing thin. The demon's tone is more than a threat. It is a deadly promise.

It has come to my attention that you have run foul of Uram. So I want to offer you a deal. 
A throne of bones appears behind the demon, and he takes his seat, his eyes never leaving yours.

"Make a pact with me to destroy Uram. I will make sure he is weakened and you can deal the final blow. That will serve you well in impressing the Circle and I will be able to leave this stinking place."

You can call me Azra'Zil, mage. I merely wanted to see the one responsible for destroying Uram. A toothy grin contorts his face terrifyingly. "And might I say, you are much smaller than I anticipated."

A red cloud of smoke begins to gather before you. You almost fear that the demon will rise again, when instead Uram the Red steps from the fog.

"I congratulate you on besting this nuisance." His left arm stretches out, palm up. 
"The demon held something that I want. A weapon. I presume you collected it?"

A cackle reaches your ears. It comes closer until a shape takes form in front of you. Claws, shimmering skin and dangerous, glistening eyes - soon you stand before a large and terrifying demon.\n\n"Step closer, mage. Let me get a better look at you. Yes. Yes, you will do just fine."

You, little one, will help me destroy Uram.
A throne of bones appears behind the demon, and he sits on it, his eyes never leaving your face.

"Make a pact with me to destroy Uram. I will make sure he is weakened and you can deal the final blow. That will serve you well in impressing the Circle and I will be able to leave this stinking place."

You suddenly feel a burning sensation in your palm. You look down and find it bleeding. When your eyes come up again, you see your blood on Azra'Zil's claws. He burrows the bloodied claw deep within his own palm.\n\n"Now we are bound by blood. Never forget that, mage. I am unable to harm you and you me. And we must uphold our bargain. No matter the cost."

The demon's voice holds a tinge of amusement. "Of course. Do think about it. But don't let me wait too long, mage. Remember, you are not the only one I could strike a pact with. And I am very generous with my rewards."

You hear the demon, before you see him. "Back again, mage? I do not believe you are done yet."
He moves with the fluidity of a predator, as he steps out from the darkness that seems to be ever present around his spire. 

"Remember, we had a deal in blood. Betray me, and the magic of it will wreck your body before you expire."
I am not done.

The familiar sight of the dark spire sends a slight shiver down your spine. You can almost see blood dripping from its outer walls and hear screams of terror echoing from within. \n\nSuddenly, the sky darkens, and a familiar voice drones: "You dare to come back? After your tragic last attempt to kill me?"

You sense a kind of static energy in the air. A buzzing and humming that grows with each step closer to the spire.\n\n"So it is done. I can feel it in the magic that binds us." The demon appears before you, satisfaction visible in his face.
I destroyed Uram, as we agreed.
With a cloud of dust and sulfur, the demon appears before you. "Welcome back, mage. Did you think about my offer? Have you come back to finally accept it?"

The demon rips through your ranks within moments, leaving nothing but blood and bones. "You thought you could defeat me? Ha! You better run along now, little one, before I drink your own blood out of your skull."

The demon's eyes widen in disbelieve as you strike it down. For a moment, you see a sinister smile that makes you shiver, but the moment is gone as quickly as it came. \n\nThe large body hits the ground hard and smell of sulfur and rot spreads rapidly all around. A weapon, heavy and gruesome-looking, clatters over the floor with the fall of Azra'Zil.

Uram seems to hold his breath in anticipation, as his fingers take hold of the demonic weapon. "Ah, finally. I thank you, mage. I can see a worthy future asset to our Circle in you." With that, Uram vanishes again.
A shame. Uram's eyes pierce you, cold and calculating. He vanishes from sight again, leaving you alone with the stench of death.
What are your dealings with Uram?
What in the Guardians' names is this place?
What are you talking about?

Azra'Zil barks a laugh. "The fool has tried to tether me to this plane. Me, a demonic lord! Ha!" He looks down on you. "But you, little one, have helped me a great deal by getting rid of him."\n\nAll of a sudden, the demons face sombers up. "But now you have to leave. I have other matters on my hands, that require my attention. Fare well, little mageling."

The static lifts and you can feel a heavy weight falling off your shoulders. You had not realized how much the deal with this demon has weighed you down until now.

"A deal fulfilled, a promise kept. I will leave this place. Enjoy your time, mage."

And just like that the demon and his spire vanishes before you.
What was the deal again?

Anger wafts towards you. The demon is slowly losing patience. "I weaken Uram, you destroy him and I, in return, will leave this place." \n\nHe leans forward ever so slighty. "Are we understood, mage?"
Right, I remember now.
Don't let me wait too long. My patience only stretches to far.
I accept.
I need to think about this some more.
I will make sure to keep that in mind.
A nightmare?
You struggle against the pull for a moment, but to no avail. Slowly, a red mist begins to form under your feet, drawing your attention downwards to where you are plummeting.
What is happening here?
Shake the offered hand.

As you move closer, dark spires jut from the ground. The number seems to vary each time you try to focus on them. A path of black gravel appears before you. You carefully follow it, until you reach a fork in the road.\n\nThe left way leads towards a spire shrouded in darkness, while the right ends at a pool of bright, red liquid.
Lift your head and look at it.
I'll go towards the pool.
The spire seems to grow in height with every step. As you come closer, you also begin to hear a voice, almost inaudible at the beginning, but gaining volume with your approach.
I'll make a sprint towards the spire.

A smell penetrates your nose, the closer you come to the pool. Something metallic and tangy. Blood. As you look towards the red liquid, it begins to ripple, as if something were to break the surface soon.
Hello? Show yourself at once!
I see no reason for you to continue breathing. Die!
The ground shifts and shudders underneath your feet. A large eruption seems to take place quite some distance away.
What was that?

You promised me might, his voice hisses dripping with venom. "Instead you lose my most powerful weapon and destroy my work! Do you truly believe you can do so and not suffer the consequences? You will rue treachery for a very long and painful time." \n\nThe demon's angry voice reverberates through your body and you awake drenched in cold sweat.
This will be a problem...

The sun reflects on tiny puddles inside the lush, golden fields of wheat surrounding the city. Swaying grass and serene meadows as far as the eye can see. It is such a peaceful day, you could almost forget what you are about to do to this place.

The golden fields are soon drenched in the blood and innards of the innocent. Their screams of terror echo over the land and you watch as the once bustling city is utterly annihilated. \n\nSomewhere you can make out the flapping of wings, announcing Mrask Dur's arrival.

The demon's abode seems to claw at the sky itself, with long, sharp spires of obsidian. Veins of a crimson run through the dark walls, pulsating with an ominous rhythm, as if alive. The air around the spire feels unnaturally dense and the surrounding countryside looks like it had every ounce of power and live drained from it.

So I can see, the demon snarls. He waits patiently beside you, until the last scream falters. Then he continues: "Yes, I am satisfied. You did uphold your end of the pact, so I shall uphold mine. You have proven a reliable partner, mage."\n\nA great sense of relief washes over you as you see the large creature turn and leave. But today's slaughter will haunt your thoughts.

You turn your back on the city and as you set a foot outside, sharp pain rips through your body, like a hot knife slicing through your every nerve. "How dare you break our contract! You are bound to it wIth your own blood!" The demon's furious voice inside your head adds a whole new level of pain.\n\n"You leave me no choice but to punish your disobedience, mage. You will regret this day until the last breath you draw." The voice vanishes again, but the pain remains.
I must destroy this demon before he destroys me.

The sound of heavy wings above your troops alarms you. Expecting to see a wyvern or griffon, you scan the sky and spot a large demonic creature with leathery wings. \n\nDespite its large frame, the creature is quite fast and soon vanishes behind a dark spire in the distance.
How curious.

The flapping of heavy wings draws your eyes upwards and you watch as a giant pale-skinned demon descends from the sky. 

"If it isn't the mage, I've heard so much about." You can feel the demon's mocking voice in your belly.
"Come, let me have a look at you."
Who are you?

One of his long-fingered claws opens and you can see something in it, pulsating and twitching. "This, my curious mage, is a powerful demon in the making. I want you to take this demon spirit and use it in your battles until it has absorbed all it can." \n\nHe leans closer, the smell of sulfur lingering on his skin and offers his other hand to you.
Fine, I can be patient. The demons grin turns wicked. "But not for long, mage."
Understood. We will return soon.

A sharp pain as the demon's claw slowly cuts into you forearm.
"Now leave. Bring this mighty weapon to its fullest potential, show me its might and will I help you with the Circles quests."

Mrask Dur rakes his claw, red from your blood, along his own arm, mixing your blood with his. "The deal is sealed."
The heavy flapping of wings announces the demon's arrival. "You have returned. Did you consider my offer?"
The heavy flapping of wings is omnipresent around the spire. Then you hear the voice and a nauseating feeling spreads in your stomach. "You dare challenge me again, mage? A futile endeavor."
You have returned already? I doubt you are already done. The demon lord regards curiously.

Mrask Dur rolls his eyes let's out a sigh. "I knew working with your kind would be exhausting... Now listen well, mageling: I've entrusted you with my demon spirit weapon. Have it grow to its fullest then return and prove its might to me," he says condescendingly. "Do you think you will manage to remember this?"

I am Mrask Dur, the new lord over this part of Fiara. My minions have told me of your potential and while I can see what they mean, you seem to have cast your lot with the Circle already. I have no use for someone who cowers to these upstarts.\n\nDisinterested, the demon turns. "Go, mage. I don't need you interfering with my plans."
This feels uncomfortable.
You reach the spire once more, but the demon only gives you a passing glance before waving you off.\n"Be gone. I have no interest in dealings with you."
You return to the spire, but you have already fulfilled your part in the demon's pact. There is nothing more to gain here.

I am one of the demonic lords. Your tongue can probably not pronounce my true name, but you can call me Azra'Zil. The demon straightens and his chin lifts slightly.\n\n"I am here because the imbecile Uram has tried to tether me to this plane." Azra'Zils face turns dark and and a sinister grin spreads his thin lips. "And so I want to teach this daring fool a lesson."
What do I have to do with this?

Impatience begins to show in the demon's features. "You take my weapon, fight with it until it has reached its full potential and prove to me its power. In return, I will help you fulfill the Circle mage's menial task. We seal it with blood, no one can hurt the other, yada yada. Deal?"

The deal is for you to prove the power of my weapon by destroying a city. Now hurry along, I have other things to attend to. The demon lord has started pacing inpatiently and you can hear him whisper something under his breath. It sounds very much like a threat to your life, if you do not hurry.
Indoctrination Hall
Sacrificial Ritual
Wall of Fire
Demonic Weapons
Mutation
This unit is possessed by and counts as a [unitpromotion]Demon[/].
[error]You must be next to a [skill]major city[/] without an established cult to use this skill.[/]
Established Cult in {where}
Establish New Cult
Sacrifices the unit to establish a new cult in an adjacent major city.\nCults are required for [point_arcane]Demonology[/] and provide unique powers.
Infiltrated by Cult
You are not ready, mageling.  you hear the disembodied voice of Mrask Dur. "Come back when you are more accomplished."
Ah, perfect. Then we can finally move to the second part of our agreement.
Second part?
The sly grin on the demon's face sends shivers down your spine. "Yes. I asked you to prove its might to me, remember? Now, level a city for me."
Wait what? I did not agree to this!

Oh but you did. And sealed our pact with blood. I think Goldenfields is ripe for the picking. Be gone, mage. Go and wreak havok in my name.\n\nWithout awaiting your reply, the demon lord takes to the skies again, laughing as he flies away.
I present your weapon at the cusp of its power.

I am Mrask Dur, the new lord over this part of Fiara. My minions have told me of your rise in power and they were right. You do hold potential. But you are not yet worthy of my time.\n\nThe large demon folds his arms in front of his chest. "Do come back once you have evolved a little. I might have an offer you would be a fool to refuse."
Mrask Dur
You have broken our pact, foolish mage. Yet you dare show your face here again?How foolish of you.

As you return to the spire, you see many lesser demons and otherwordly creatures bustling around. Azra'Zil, the large demonic lord is in the middle of giving one of them a new set of scars, when he spots you.\n\n"Ah, my friend. How nice of you to join the festivities."
Festivities? Is this a party?

You come to the spire once more. Lesser demons run around giving orders to slaves and otherwordly creatures. Blood and guts cover the grounds. Rows and rows of supplies from the surrounding areas are being transported to the demon lords abode.
Azra'Zil
This feels familiar.
Wait, have I not dreamed this before?

You begin to scry for the origin of the quake. Your magic manifests like it has before, showing you what has happened in a display of spectral figures and shapes.\n\nYou see Uram the Red, one of the mages of the Circle, who is in the process of performing a complex ritual. But due to whatever reason, the ritual goes awry. A portal bursts open and for a split second you feel the eyes of a mighty creature on you.
This presence, it is immensly powerful.
Whatever Uram has brought upon Fiara, it is most likely dangerous. If not for you, then at least for the magically inept populace.
I should investigate this.

A tall and twisted spire, built on a foundation of corpses, rises before you. You see lesser demons whipping rows of humanoids into submission, all carrying enormous amounts of food and drink into the spire from steaming kitchens around it.\n\nIt must be the stronghold of a powerful demon lord, for you also spot hundreds of armed creatures of all kinds parading around. A deep red sun barely breaks through the dark clouds surrounding the place.

A clammy hand, slick with blood, rises before you and you look down to see a very battered goblin. One of the wretched creature's ears is missing and half his face is almost completely burnt from standing too close to one of the large cooking fires.\n\n"You want to meet master Krahz Al'Guh, you pay tribute."

The smell of burnt meat and the sizzling of multiple cooking fires is the first thing you notice when you finally reach the spire. Slaves, humanoid and otherwise, work large contraptions to grill massive amounts of meats. Many of them sport burns and scars on their skin.\n\nAs you arrive, more workers appear as well, coming closer from various directions, transporting additional resources and provisions.
This almost looks like a war camp.
Why should I pay anything?
The goblins face turns vicous. "No one get deal without tribute! You want deal, you pay!"

The monstrous demon topples over, blood oozing from multiple wounds. "You... dare... ?" 

He collapses without another word and the putrid smell of feces and sweat hangs heavily in the air.

His weapon, half burried underneath his formless body, glints in the last light of day.
I'll take this. I have earned the right.
The massive demon moves more fluidly than you would have thought possible. He rips your troops to shreds, gobbling them up greedily. "You are nothing but fodder to me."

The goblin takes the offered tribute and eyes it suspiciously, then scutters away. Soon, the large double doors of the spire open and he waves you to follow.

Inside, you finally behold the master of this spire - a massive demon with curving horns and flaps of fat bulging out across his form. He is currently too engrossed in devouring a whole cow to pay you much attention.

The goblin bows to him and anxiously gestures for you to do the same.
Stand and wait.
Fat drips down the demons chin and speckles of meat fly all around as he takes another grunting bite. \n\n"Have you come here to strike a deal with me?" he smacks, his voice thick and oily.
That depends on the deal.

For the first time, the demon looks up from its meal. "Ah, the Circles latest toy. Unfortunately, I have no deal to offer you, mage. You have nothing of interest to me."\n\nHe continues his feast and you notice the goblin besides you inching away.
How disappointing. We shall leave you to it then.

A chuckle makes his enormous belly jump up and down. The goblin, still standing besides you, eyes his master nervously then cackles along, trying not to draw attention to himself.\n\n"You have spunk, mage. I like that." He carelessly flicks away the carcass, nearly obliterating the ducking goblin with, then leans forward. His putid breath reeks of sweat and rot. "I think I may have a deal for you. One that benefits us both equally."
And what would that be, pray tell?
That does sound agreeable. I accept.

Another bellied laugh sends the goblin skittering away and shakes the walls around you. "I knew you could be tempted. I will send some of my followers with you. They know how to ensnare a creature and bind it. Now, stretch out your hand."\n\nYou do as you are told and the demon rams his fat-encrusted fingernail into your palm. You wince in pain and revulsion. Krahz Al'Guh bites down on his tongue and spits blood on your hand. "It is done. Now we are bound by blood. Remember to uphold your end of the deal. You don't want to suffer the consequences of breaking the pact."
We are agreed. I will return with the slaves you asked for.

Krahz Al'Guhs face scrunches up in disappointment. "You make me wait at your peril. Be gone!"\n\nOrcs carrying a large platter of steaming meat approach the demon and he eagerly skewers a few pieces with his claw, including one of the empty eyed orcs and greedily swallows them. It seems he has all but forgotten about you already.
You back! Come see master? The disfigured goblin with the missing ear greets you eagerly.
As soon as you step towards the spire, the booming voice of Krahz Al'Guh shakes the ground. "You dare step foot into my domain again? I will make sure you feel my wrath this time!"
Yes. I am ready to accept the deal.
The little green skinned figure scolds you: "You must remember Master's words! Master wants slaves, fifteen or many." With that he glares at you and shakes his head, bemoaning your stupidity.
You have already fulfilled your end of the bargain. And you spot some of your former slaves amongst the demon's servants. \n\nThere is no more deals to be made here.

You are greeted by the familiar face of the burnt goblin. "Master needs slaves, two times five or many. You no bring, you no enter." He takes up a defensive stance, as if he alone could hold off you and your troops.
Right, we'll be on our way then.

The demon waves his hand dismissively "I will provide you with the means, if you agree to a pact. We would both be bound by blood to fulfil it."\n\nHe opens his arms, as if to embrace the world. "Bring me what I require and I will erect a statue, nay, a landmark to carry your fame beyond the bounds of the Highmark!"

You have collected all the slaves the demon demanded and have sent them off to his spire. As they walk towards the tower, you cannot help but think that you have sealed a terrible fate for them. 

But your musings are interrupted by the voice of Krahz Al'Guh, who suddenly towers before you.
"You fulfilled your end of the bargain, mage. Now to uphold mine."
Remember, you promised me a monument!

The demon's laughter makes your skin crawl.
"And you shall have the greatest that ever existed! Feast your eyes upon this, mage!"

The earth rumbles and splits as a giant statue emerges from the depths. Your likeness, cast in glimmering gold towers above you.
"Are you satisfied, oh humble mage," the demons asks mockingly.
It is certainly...impressive.

The spire's ominous presence casts an inescapable shadow, shrouding the landscape in an unsettling darkness. Wherever you look, figures seem to flit around just outside your vision, disappearing as you try to focus on them.
What a dreadful place.

That is because you are not welcome here. The voice, dark and laced with an unveiled threat, is coming from behind you. \n\nTurning, you find yourself face to face with a large, horned demon. Its faceless head and powerful built could send a lesser person into a fearful fit.
So you finally show yourself to me.

The voice continues: "I, Sâ'Hrul, lord of the unnamed army in this realm, have laid claim to this creature of yours. I find their talent and power promising. It is amusing to see how your creature struggles. No matter, within a few days it will succumb to me."\n\nSuddenly, your apprentice sinks down, crying out in pain. You see a dark mark appearing on the apprentice's forehead as if burned into the skin.
You shall not get away with this!

Is that a promise? Another laughter tumbles through your head, growing more painful with each passing moment.\n\n"Then come, mage. Come and find me. If you can." The voice disappears, leaving you alone with your thoughts and horrified troops.
We better get to locating this demon.

The outcry of your apprentice rips you from your reveries. "There! That's it! The tower where we will find the demon! I can feel Sâ'Hrul!"\n\nLooking ahead, you see a spire built out of shining dark stone. The land around it is obscured in a grey fog and weirdly angular shapes stir up the mist occasionally.
Let us go face this demon!

When the twitching and spasms finally subside, you hear a whisper. You lean in close to understand the words.\n\n"Th-the demon. I can feel it. I know where my lor... Where the creature's hiding. It is calling me to its side!" Your apprentice is barely able to withstand the strain and the demon's grip is growing tighter by the minute it seems.
I shall face this creature and make it pay for its insolence!

The mark grows until it covers your apprentice's whole body. Slowly, the body's form begins to shift and grow as guttural cries erupt from the abomination's throat.\nWhen the transformation is done, a demon emerges and its eyes find yours.\n"Ah, finally a new host. I will enjoy this one."
Sâ'Hrul?

Azra'Zil's grins cunningly. "How very clever of you to ask. It will ensure that we are both bound to uphold it by our blood. A blood pact, if you will."
He leans back in his throne, his elbows on the arm rests and his long fingers touching at the tips.

"So you will get what you desire, a chance to join the Circle, and I get to see Uram destroyed."
You trickster!
Azra'Zil laughs and his form begins to turn translucent until he is gone from sight, leaving nothing but a bit of blood and some bones.
What exactly does this contract do?
And why would I give that to you?

You can feel his irritation creep into his voice. "If you were to give me the weapon, I would of course remember your... obedience."\n\nHe turns to look down at the demon's body. "If not, well then I would have to find another. I am merely offering you a chance to get into my good graces."
Yes. You can have it.
I will not surrender that weapon to you.
I think I will keep it, thank you very much.
We will leave you to it then.

Indeed it is. We are celebrating Urams demise. In which you played a big role, isn't that right? He looks at you with a dangerous glint in his eyes.\n\n"I can finally stretch out and enjoy this plane. But now you have to leave. I have other matters on my hands, that require my attention. Fare well, little one."
Wait, what about the deal?

Azra'Zil halts in his tracks and looks back at you, sneering. "The deal? You already did what I wanted you to do. Why would I sign a deal now? Hop along, before I lose my temper." He starts walking once more, not even gracing you with another glance.
Curses! We better leave.
I wonder who this spire belongs to.
Of course. Will this suffice?
I will come back then.

The goblin shrinks back with a whimper but the sound is almost instantly drowned out by a deep rumbling. Is that... a burp?

"You dare come here only to pick on my slaves?"
A monstrous figure steps out of the spire. You see curving horns and broad shoulders on a massive body.
"Then I will pick the meat off your bones."
Fine, here is the tribute.
I will serve you to your master, grilled on a stick!
We better bow.
Krahz Al'Guh

I am in need of more... quality followers. Bring me, say at least fifteen proper slaves and I will help you with one of these trivial tasks the Circle has burdened you with.\n\nKrahz Al'Guh shuffles closer to the edge of his seat, which, you only now notice, is built out of mangled corpses and bones. "What say you, mage?"
I don't even know how to enslave people 'properly'.
I do not deal with the likes of you. I will end you foul beast!

The goblin hurries towards the spire and impatiently waves you to follow.

Entering you find the large demon seated in his throne of death and decay.

"I assume you have returned ready to accept my offer?" he says, smacking his foul lips in anticipation?

A worthy symbol of status for a mage of your high regard. Enjoy the rewards of our pact. I, for one, will certainly do so. \nWith another rumbling laugh, the demon vanishes, leaving you to admire the enormous if slightly gaudy statue.
I love it!
And all of this for the small cost of a few unlucky souls.
As your troops trudge along, you notice that the ground beneath their feet has been ripped up by what must have been enormous claws.
That was no mere beast.

Soon you can also hear birds of prey croaking and the smell of decay lingers in the air. 

Only a few steps further you come upon the mangled corpses of a few... humanoids? Animals? The state they are in makes it impossible to tell.

However, there is also a slight smell of something else in the air. Something pungent.
This were my brethren. I wonder what they are doing here?
What or who killed here, I wonder...

Cries and grunts suddenly erupt not too far ahead. The noises are unsettling, as if a large beast is tearing into something small that is fighting for it's life. It might be best to stay clear of whatever this is.
It must be my kin up ahead.
What in the Guardian's name could make such noise?

You have heard about demons becoming more active all over the Highmark and the people are growing increasingly concerned.\n\nPeople from the surrounding villages have come to your tower to plead for help.
Tell me, what did you come here for?

Master mage. We humbly ask your help. The demons are burning our crops and steal all the food we have. We know not where else to turn, but without help, we will certainly starve to death this winter.

They tread from one foot to the other, sharing worried glances and hushed whispers before another continues, 
"If you could, spare us some grain? Or coins, if you have them. We are desperate."
Of course I will help. Buy your people some food.
I do have grain. You can have some.
I can give you some meats.
I have nothing to share.
The townsfolk praise your generosity.\n"Thank you, master mage, thank you. May you be blessed by the Guardians!"
It is nothing. Be on your way now.
I have enough rations to feed you.

The shoulders of the men and women before you slump and some begin to cry.
"We understand. We will leave you be then. Apologies for the disturbance."

The people leave and you get the feeling, that they will not remember you fondly.
Whatever. I need to get on with my day.
Cultist
[malus]Demonic Influence[/]
Your apprentice is being groomed by the demon lord [possessed]Sâ'Hrul[/] and will join the demon's ranks. During this time, horrible visions corrupt their mind and ancient knowledge can be gained!

A sudden pain rips you from the dream and throws you violently back into reality. You startle awake, covered in slick sweat and with a bitter taste in your mouth. Slowly, the headache retreats again, but you still feel slighty disoriented by what had just happened.
Rip the cloak away.
What a strange dream...

The moment your head hits the pillow, you fall into a deep slumber. You relive the dream you had a few nights prior. Spires jutting into the sky and a voice asking you: "Do we have a deal?"\n\nYou turn slowly and find yourself face to chest with an enormous, hooded figure, it's hand outstretched for you to shake it.

You clasp the hand and are suddenly pulled forward. You involuntarily step through the figure and into the darkness beyond. A shudder takes hold of you, as power and might flood your body. You can feel yourself growing stronger.
This feels... amazing.
You take another step forward and exit the darkness as swiftly as it has pulled you in. You now stand atop your tower, overlooking all of Fiara. The landscape sprawls before you as if it were a map.
It is beautiful.

You see the proud towers of the Circle of Mages but between them, dark spires begin to grow out of the earth. Fiery portals crack open and dark shadows flood the world, spreading like ants over spilled honey.\n\nYou become aware of another entity next to you. Something so large and all encompassing, it even drowns out the light of day.
Brace yourself.
You jerk awake, panting and sweating.
I wonder if it will return once more.
The moment your head hits the pillow, you fall into a deep slumber. You find yourself standing in the open \nsky, walking among planets and watching stars flitting past.
How serene and beautiful.

Without warning, dark spires jut from the invisible ground you are walking, growing larger with each moment. A heartbeat passes and suddenly one of them sprouts underneath your feet, the roofing tiles clattering beneath your bare soles, propelling you higher and higher.
What is happening here?

Suddenly the roof gives, and you plummet down the full height of the tower before landing in a dimly light entrance hall.\n\nA deep, rumbling voice reverberates from the walls around you. It is a sound you have never heard before and the language is also unfamiliar.
Turn towards the voice.

You turn slowly and find yourself face to chest with an enormous, hooded figure. A hand stretches out from underneath the heavy cloak, sharp claws attached to the long fingers. The hand is held in a manner that invites you to shake it.\n\nAnd finally, you can understand something. "Do we have a deal?"

The moment your head hits the pillow, you fall into a deep slumber. You relive the dream you had a few nights prior. You, standing atop your own tower, overlooking the Circle mages towers and dark spires in between them.\n\nA shadow, growing to an enormous size next to you, drowing out the light of the sun.
Glowing orbs of lava and amber look down on you. It is the same hooded figure you struck a deal with, but this time it is larger than even your tower and growing even more.
By the gods.

The figure suddenly grips your tower, as if it were a game piece, and moves it over Fiara. All of the beautiful landscape flies past in a flurry and you see the Circle mages towers beginning to crumble and fall while you grow in power still. \n\nAs the giant hand sets you down again, the impact shakes the earth and clouds of dust rise, obscuring your sight.
What is happening now?

Once the dust settles, you stand in the endless space between planets and stars again. But this time, you are not alone. The robed figure is opposite you, their glowing eyes staring straight into your soul.\n\n"If you liked the power you saw, come find us."
Where? Who are you?
