You tell them about Gor and how he managed to unite many tribes of the orcs and trolls under him, leading them closer to Mugwa.\n\nWhen you are done, there is a moment of silence before the trolls begin to talk all at once. Some seem confused, others in uproar.

The trolls are hanging on your every word as you describe how the trolls would grow closer to their god by following the famed mage Rohen. You tell them about his mighty troops and their many victories leading them to riches that could be sacrificed to Mugwa.\n\nWhen you are done, there is a moment of silence before the trolls begin to talk all at once. Some seem confused, others in uproar.
It seems they like him.
We could extract another demon.

Your troops grab another poor villager and tie him to the ground as you begin your ritual.

The man dies cursing your cruelty, but you have gained what you desired from him.

The helpless villagers stare darkly at you as you hear riders approaching. Perhaps now is the time to abandon this place.

As you prepare to finish the ritual, a dark wave seems to wash over the corpses of the cultists and you see their lifeless forms stir into action. their bodies twisted by the foul magic.\n\nOne of them turns your way and smiles wickedly. "Careful, mage. You might anger me," an otherworldy voice speaks through the cultist, sending shivers down your spine.
I will beat you again, undead or not.

The last of the reanimated cultists falls and your troops sigh in relief.\n\n"Careful, mage. You might anger me," an otherwordly voice speaks through mutilated corpse of a dead cultist, sending shivers down your spine.
Finish the ritual.
What is happening?

Your soldiers stare at a group of their own in the midst of the camp, frothing at the mouth, heads lolling. Suddenly they stop their shrieking and with one inhumane voice intone: "These are mine now!"
Let's leave before more of you fall prey to their powers.
A demon! Let my troops go!
But no matter your command, the spirit of your troops is broken. With empty eyes, they turn to join a force far beyond your understanding.
You can feel the new presence inside their minds, twisting deeper and settling in. Whoever bestowed those upon your troops, you cannot help but feel pleased about it.
I want nothing to do with this creature!
Finally you have done something useful.
The demonic creature bows before your apprentice. It seems to be willing to serve.
Splendid!
The creature stays bound in place as you move your troops away.\n\nAfter some time, you can see a small group of hooded cultists approach it and take it with them.
Good riddance!
This is disgusting.
I shall not forget again.
Exhausted from the day, you lie down in the very chamber your master slept in so many years ago.\n\nWhen sleep finally claims you, a mournful tune accompanies your dreams, a sound you recognize.
My master's flute?

Just as when you first entered the tower to begin this journey you once more witness two groups facing each other: one led by your master, the other by the hooded figure.

Again you see them fighting, hurling powerful magic and summoning creatures to their side.

Again, you see you master finally fall, overwhelmed by dark hordes. This time, though, the scene does not stop as the hooded creature leading those hordes steps closer to your fallen master.
Will I finally see the face of his murderer?

From the depth of the hood, a grating voice addresses your master. "You did not uphold your end of the deal, mage. I thought I had made myself clear. You fail me, you die."\n\nThe figure waves its hands and the corpses of your master's allies turn to ashes.
Who are you? Reveal yourself!

All of a sudden, the figure turns on you, raises their hand, and lifts their hood. Slitted irises, large fangs, and curved horns present themselves ... it is a demon! \n\nA vile grin stretches tautly across its alien face, as a knock on the door echoes in the empty hall. The demon winks at you and vanishes into thin air as the doors are pushed open by the Circle's troops.
Get him! Catch the killer!
It was a demon! He vanished!
What in the Allfather's name...

You watch helplessly as the Circle's robed servants find your dead master and reveal the sign of a demonic bond burnt onto his pale chest. The Circle mages recoil at the sight and order their troops to destroy all of your master's occult research. You witness them beginning to ransack and destroy the library and any work your master left behind. \n\nYou wake up the next morning, cold to the bone and with a pain in your chest. Was this a vision of the past or did someone send it on purpose to weaken your dedication to your master's cause?
Will I ever know the truth?
On their way across the land, your troops stumble upon an unsettling looking mound of mud and pebbles. Two larger stones make the eyes and a gaping hole sits where a mouth would be.
I wonder what this is supposed to be.
A statue of Mugwa! We should pray.

Of course the trolls under your command immediately recognize Mugwa, their god. They bow deep to the mound and begin to mumble to themselves. When it is time to move on, there is a slight spring in their steps.

You have received many letters describing the troll's devastating effect on the land. Since they left Regan Gor, driven out by the demons that roam there, they seem to have spread steadily, looting where they can and eating anything that gets in their way.
How do they spread so quickly?
You come upon a large pile of bones that stinks to the high heavens. Blood still stains the ground, and you find the occasional tooth.
What happened here?

You quickly scan the area for potential danger, but soon you find the telltale signs of trolls. They must have caught some of the wildlife here and devoured it, skin and all, leaving only the bones behind.\n\nLuckily for you, they seem to have moved on already, searching for more creatures to feast upon.
These trolls are getting out of hand...

You pass some farmers and hear their frustrated banter.

"...but it doesn't matter. These monsters will crush anything! My precious pumpkins? All destroyed!"
"Sorry, Ames, I know how it is. They tore through my wheat crop last week. Not a single strand remained."
May I ask what happened?

Trolls happened! Those ever hungry monsters keep coming out of nowhere, eating their share and then trampling the rest! One of the farmers cracks his knuckles. \n"But with you around, I bet they won't dare. Please, if you see them, make short work of 'em, will ya?"
The farmers give you only a quick glance before their faces turn pale at the sight of your troll units. \n"N-no! Not again!" Before you can say anything else, they run off, obviously scared to death.
It seems they are not fond of trolls...
I'll see what I can do.
War Bringer
Troll Peons
Mud Slingers
Bone Hexer
Corpse Troll
Cannibal
Skull Crusher
Feral Savage
Spike Flinger
Wall Breaker
Gravoc the Hexwielder

Feasted

Appetizers
Saten Skyhou
Flesh Sacrifice

Erect Totem of the Eagle
A dedicated hall to lecture your apprentices will allow you to indoctrinate even more of the gifted into your ranks, providing them with all they need to learn and grow.
By infusing them with magic, even the corrupted and damned can gain powers exceeding their original capabilities.
This infernal incantation is able to siphon resources in the most effective way, nearly at an instant.
Pandemonium
Summoning Circle
[point_arcane]Unlocks Amalgamation[/]
Spiked Skin
Grown Wings
Scorpion Tail
Fiery Blood
I am not interested in your wretched slaves!
I will not allow him to deceive me! Catch this scoundrel!
I will not let this betrayal go unpunished. Catch the slaver!
The slaver cannot have gone far. He will rue the day he tried to deceive you.
Get him!
Catch the Slaver
Your troops have caught up with the slaver's band, who seem to celebrate their recent deal with you.
Time to teach them a lesson.
Give me back my money, charlatan!

The orcish slaver panics slightly, as he sees your troops surrounding his camp.\n"Apologies, great mage, I...we...certainly meant no harm. How can I make this up to you? I am sure we can find an agreeable solution!"
Your death will be quite agreeable to me.
Return my gold and I will be lenient.

The orc grins nervously. "I...we...already spent some of it, my warriors were quite...hungry." he says, as he eyes the barrel of forgebrew in the midst of the circle of tents.

"But let me sweeten the deal for you - here, take this orc warrior as a gesture of my deepest apology. He is worth ten times, what we owe you, I assure you! "

The orc he points at looks confused.
I would still rather have your head.
Fine. And then I never want to see you around here again!
The slaver bows as he hands over a sack of coins and the troll warrior is brought before you.\n\nHe just looks at you with defiance and resentment, but allows your troops to lead him away.
Out of my sight, slaver!
The slavers felled, you ransack what little is left of their treasure. The troll, still demure, did not raise a hand to try and help the slavers. But neither did he defend himself.
Bring him back to the tower.
The slavers have repulsed your attack.
Gar Mugwa
A crude settlement, built around a statue of the troll deity Mugwa, defies the biting cold of [gold]Norgate[/].
The troll settlement in honor of Mugwa is nested around a giant statue of their deity.
Mugwa Shrine
A shrine the trolls built in honor of their god. In reality nothing more than a pile of trash...
A cult operates in this city and is available in [point_arcane]Demonology[/] crafting.
Followers of Mugwa
Cult of Belial
Children of Urdash
Worshippers of the Eye
Cult of the Tides
Cult of the Frostweaver
Cult of the Dark Roamer
Prophets of the New Age
Cult of Ulather
Cult of Shadows
Cult of Whispers
Harbingers of the Steward
Cult of Mor Duine
Totem of the Leopard
Totem of the Eagle
Erect a {unit} on a position in {range}.
The {unit} will increase allied flanking damage in its vicinity.
The {unit} will protect adjacent allies against missiles and increase their [mMissileAttackType] range.
Totem of the Leopard
Totem of the Eagle
Mugwa big! Mugwa wise! Mugwa fills all bellies. We serve Mugwa! Great Mugwa!
A demon prince entrusted with the keys to the great realms beyond forever in his keep.  - The Vision of the Steward
Let's make haste and catch Gravoc.
The armored troll looks at your ransacking the corpses in disdain. "This is not the time to rummage around some rotting corpses for scraps," he growls.
Right you are, let's hurry!
Waste not, want not!
The troll is clearly angry as your troops take what little useful items they can from Gravoc's victims. \n\nThey do not exactly look happy either.
I think we can leave now.
I assure you all, Morgak won fairly. So he is your new chieftain.
I am glad to have you, Morgak.
I am glad to have you, Morgak.
I am sorry, I have none of these items.
If it is mana you require, I can provide.

The orc's eyes narrow suspiciously."A man of your means? I find that hard to believe. So be it, though I am not sure how well the locals will take to a man not honoring his debts."\n\nHe turns and leaves without another word.
Perhaps I should have paid...

After retrieving your master's reports from the Circle, you devote time to decyphering them, as parts are written in his secret script.\n\nSo far, you have translated about half of it, but you cannot wait any longer. You must read them.
I wonder what this is about?

Page after page, you read about the Circle and how they amassed power in Mulandir. \nApparently, the city was built on a demonic portal that allowed them to summon servants from the depths far beyond the River of Souls.

The River of Souls - sometimes called Mor Duine - is where souls are led by Hirin after their departure. It is also where they are chosen by the Soul Smith Niethalf to enter a new life once they have been reforged.\n\nHowever, those souls too wicked to ever pass the scrutiny of the Soul Smith are cast into the deepest fires, unable to return to the River of Souls. There, they burn until their corruption takes its own form: demons.
Mulandir was built on a portal?
River of Souls?
Demons as servants?
So this is what the Circle wanted to hide.
Niethalf? I recognize that name.

Yes, the Circle has used demons for quite some time now. You remember encountering them within their army before. Since they were controlled tightly, no one questioned the Circle's decision to employ them. Until your old master, that is.

Of course you know about Mulandir. Constructed by the Circle mage Isgrimm, it has become the foremost place of magical knowledge in all of Eo. And it is the very stronghold from which the Circle has operated since.\n\nBut the fact that a portal leading into the demonic realm should be under it is news to you. How your master learned of this is not elaborated on in his report.
What was that about the River of Souls?
Didn't he also write about Mulandir?
And the Circle has demons as servants?

You skim the pages once more, just to make sure you did not miss any vital information. So did the Circle kill your master because he uncovered the portal's existence? Or was there more to it?\n\nYou take a glance at the page still in need of translation and you can feel the suspense. Whatever the Circle is trying to hide, you will make sure to uncover every last of their secrets.
I will need more time to translate the rest.
I don't want any of them to have a troll army.

You can easily recall the most crucial information from the first part of the reports. Your master wrote, that the Circle has amassed power in Mulandir and has been conjuring demons to be their servants.
Now I can uncover further secrets.
What did the first report say again?
Finally, you have translated the rest of your master's report recovered from the Circle. You eagerly shift the papers on your desk, ready to continue reading.

Reading on, you feel the suspense shift to horror. It seems the Circle did not only call forth lesser demons. They accidentally set free a demon lord trying to control more powerful beings. Your mind immediately wanders to Uram the Red, as you know he holds a special interest in demons.
Morgak's Magic Armor
Demoralized
Regained Bloodlust
Wearer becomes immune to all [dmg_death]Curses[/].
What happened with that demon lord?

Reading on, your master describes how the Circle pretended to have caught the demon lord, before worse could befall Eo. Yet your master is absolutely certain that it was not reined in as the Circle claims. He writes:\n\n'I have made it my mission to find that demon, for if their power is great enough to be coveted by the Circle in their quest for power, I can only imagine what that could do for me. A claim to a seat in the Circle perhaps?'
Did my master succeed?

In the final pages, you discover that he, indeed, found a demon lord. He goes on describing his growth in power, but the report suddenly ends.\n\nYou let the information sink in. There was much learned from these documents.

The Circle not only risked the populace of Fiara by calling forth a demon lord they swept their mistakes under the carpet to deflect any blame. They do not see the demons as a threat, merely a tool. And no one would believe you, even with your master's reports exposed their terrible oversight. \n\nYou are certain, more than ever, that they killed your master for trying to uncover their schemes.

The way your master made the demon sound enticing tells you, that it was a worthy endeavor to pursue an alliance with them. He grew in power and might, just by accepting a demon's help. Maybe he would have even had a chance to join the Circle, would they not have killed him.\n\nYou are certain, more than ever, that they killed your master for trying to uncover more about their schemes.
So the Circle is responsible for demons running amok.
My master had dealings with a demon lord.
I bet they would appreciate my help in banishing the unruly demons.
Maybe I should also make a deal with a demon lord...

Heist

You awaken with an uneasy feeling in your stomach. Something is not right. Your eyes search the room, but nothing seems amiss.\n\nA cling-ka-ling rings from outside your door. Moving carefully into the dim corridor, you notice signs of an intruder: a window ajar, a muddy footprint on the carpet, and a faint glow from your study. Your senses sharpen as you prepare to confront whoever dares breach your sanctuary.
Who's in there? Show yourself!
Use magic to set a trap for the intruder.
For the time being, I'll observe.

With a confident stride, you approach the study, pushing the door open with a flick of your wrist. There, amidst your scattered tomes and relics, stands a goblin. He stops his rummaging and looks up at you, eyes widening in shock before he quickly masks his surprise with a smirk.\n\n"Ah, the mighty wizard themselves. I was just, uh, admiring youse collection."
What do you think you're doing in my tower?

You quietly approach the study and peek inside. \n\nA goblin is rifling through your books and artifacts. You watch as he examines a particularly valuable tome, muttering to himself. He seems desperate but has yet to notice you.
One wrong breath and my magic will strangle you.
Looking for something specific?

With a wave of your hand, you set a magical trap at the entrance to your study. Moments later, you hear a surprised yelp and see a light flashing. Opening the door, you find a goblin suspended in mid-air.\n\n"Alright, alright! Youse got me!"

Magic shoots forward, wrapping around the Goblin in shimmering tendrils and holding him securely to the ground. He struggles briefly before going still, glaring at you with a mixture of defiance and resignation.\n\n"And here was me thinking this could go smoothly."
Explain yourself!

Name's Burgle. I's just looking for a cure. I swear, me weren't gonna take anything else.\nThe intensity in his grating voice and the glare of his beady eyes give you the impression that he is being honest.
[possessed]Night Terrors[/]
Terrible nightmares haunt Burgle ever since he stole a wizard's possessions.

The Goblin flinches and a small dagger immediately appears in his hand. He eyes you warily before reaching the conclusion that bringing a knife to a magic fight might not be the best idea. His hands rise slightly in a show of defeat.\n\n"Name's Burgle. I's only come for a cure. As soon as I has it, I'm out of youse hair."
How do I know you're telling the truth?
A cure? For what?
What kind of curse?

I's been cursed. Paid a visit to an old mage's tower, thought I's get away with the shiny amulet. Turns out, it has a nasty hex on it.\n\nNow that you had a longer look at the goblins face, you notice a frantic twitching to his tired eyes, as if he has not slept in days.

Me's haunted by nightmares. I's can't sleep, not even a nap. They's appearing every time if I closes my eyes for more than a second. Horses made of bones and shadow, gnawing at my brain.
Burgle lets out a defeated sigh.

"Please, I's just looking for peace."
You deserve your fate. Get out.
A fireball could give you eternal peace.
How can I help?
Someone will have to clean that up.

You kick the screaming goblin out of your tower. He was nothing more than a nuisance anyway.\n\nIt is only later that you realize, that the cunning rogue must have stuffed his pockets with some of your more valuable possessions.
A magical explosion later there is nothing but ash left of the poor creature. \n\nA strong warning to anyone with similar intentions.

Agreed! Youse won't regret this, wizard!
The haunted look on the haggard face of the goblin twists into one of relief.
As Burgle and you shake hands, you feel a magical aura emanating from the goblin.

But before you can even think about consulting your tomes on the matter, he will have to take care of the mess he made of your study. The whole library has been turned upside down.
[error]You must be next to a [skill]major city[/] or [skill]Circle Mage tower[/] that has not been heisted to use this skill.[/]
The {where} Heist
Prepares and executes a heist, stealing a valuable artifact from an adjacent major city or Circle Mage tower.
You could get a nocturnal visit by a goblin master thief with unique talents.\n\nHe has a magical problem inflicted on him for trying to outsmart the wrong wizard.

The time has come to hear the full story of Burgle's curse. The haggard goblin has taken a seat across from you, fidgeting nervously with a writing feather and avoiding your gaze.\n\nTime and again, he swats at something that is not there, murmuring a few words under his breath.

The restless eyes of the goblin dart around the room. " 't was a job. Big one. A dream weaver's vault, full of rare and powerful artifacts. The amulet's just one of many treasures. I's didn’t know it's cursed."
So, what about this curse of yours.
Cursed Amulet
Burgle's Quest

I caught a thief breaking into my tower, a goblin named Burgle with haunted eyes. He claims to be cursed by an amulet he stole. 

Despite his initial deception, he offered his skills in exchange for help, hinting at his ability to 'find' rare materials. He has potential as an ally, but I'll be cautious. 

For now, our goals align.
I'll sit down and have a chat with Burgle once he cleaned up the mess he made.
Clean up this mess. Then we'll talk.
Grimoire Page: Burgle
Cursed Amulet
• bring a SPELLCASTER to ward off curses
• guarded by Living Armors and Phantom Warriors\n\n• physical damage will be next to useless
• BURGLE can handle the locks to the target\n\n• a DWARF could break open additional vaults
Find the Cursed Amulet
Burgle fenced the damn thing off and can't remember to whom. I should let him plan heists to retrieve it.\nIt's either in:\nLyraine, Connach, or Sevenkeeps

The amulet that Burgle stole was bewitched with a Dreamweaver's Curse, a hideous spell that causes relentless, terrifying nightmares and saps the victim's life force. To break it, we must find the wizard's grimoire. \n\nThis means a raid on the Dreamweaver's treasury. Burgle remains nervous but determined. His skills will be crucial for what lies ahead.
The Heist Plan
• the vault is enchanted with FOCUS LEAK

Eternal Slumber

While others slumber, you walk their dreams and explore their best-kept secrets.
Your strength lies between the worlds of the dreaming and the waking.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
Forge alliances or topple enemies. Unveil distant lands and shroud your army, all without ever leaving the safety of your tower.
Puts all other factions to sleep. Their stacks cannot move nor improve, and no new stacks emerge.

Curse Lifted
The curse has been lifted from Burgle.
Astral Image
Summon an astral image of yourself to wander the lands and lead stacks into combat, all from the safety of your home.
In the dreamscape, distance is an illusion. With this spell, traverse the space between thoughts in the blink of an eye.
Through the veil of dreams, project your astral self to lead and fight alongside your troops, all while your physical form rests in serene comfort.
Draped in the ethereal shadows of dreams, your army moves unseen and unchallenged, leaving no trace of their presence in the waking world.
As you slumber, let the whispers of dreams unveil secrets hidden in the mists of the night.
In the realm of dreams, gather with fellow mages to weave the threads of diplomacy, subtly enhancing alliances as you rest.
From the chill depths of dreamscapes, enchant your weapons to strike with icy fury, inflicting frostbite on all they touch.
Within the sanctuary of lucid dreams, harness the power to study and gather knowledge, turning sleep into a realm of productivity.
Awaken the inner eye of your chosen vassal, allowing them to perceive hidden truths and strike with unerring accuracy.
Sweep away the memories of battle from a mind but not its body, leaving it ready to relearn the ways of war anew.
Ensnare the minds of those that seek you harm in a short trance, causing them to drift away, leaving their place free for you to claim.
Sanctum of slumber, where the Dreamweaver's power thrives. Dreams take form upon the loom's threads, spun with the magic of restful repose.
Unleash relentless night terrors upon your foes, depriving them of rest and leaving them in a state of constant dread.
From the depths of darkness, conjure the spectral steed, its ghastly form striking terror as it soars across the skies, bearing the weight of armies upon its baleful back.
A whispered incantation, veiling the world in tranquil dreams, while you dance amidst the slumbering shadows, the sole traveller of the waking realms.
Threads of the ethereal spun into a warrior's essence, forging purpose from the fabric of dreams, guiding them towards their destined path.
Embrace the spectral veil, as flesh turns ethereal and strides glide weightlessly, a whisper in the realm of steel.

Dream of Riches
Why shouldn't I just kill you?

I's need something powerful to lift the curse or...someone? Youse could help me! Please, I's can get you many things in return! He lifts the side of his leather vest, revealing various thieving tools strapped to his belt and jerkin.\n\n"I's can get you all the shinies you want, see? Tomes, relics, whatever your wizard heart desires."

No! Please! Burgle is useful! I's have skills, wizard. Need rare materials? I's get them. Ancient tomes? I's know where they are. Let's help each other out here, huh?\n\nOnly now do you notice the goblin's gadgets and equipment. Small flasks, pouches and climbing gear strapped to his belt, and a whole collection of lockpicks peaking out of his leather jerkin.
This is not my problem. Get out!
Fine, I'll help in return for your service.
Mine will be the last house you tried to rob. Die!
Get out, pest.
A dreamweaver you say?
It is rare you hear of others with your special abilities. You begin to wonder what you could learn if you could get your hands on their grimoires...

You remember that one of the Circle Mages, Ianna the Singer, has the power of dream weaving. It is a strong and dangerous magic that allows the wielder to infiltrate not only another person's dreams, but also their mind.
And then?

The nightmares started almost immediately. Horrible, horrible visions. I's tried everything to get rid of it, pay for a shaman and smoked nightroot. I's even sold off the amulet, but the torture continued.

He scratches his nose, his legs bouncing up and down.
"Thinking of it, I's don't even remember who I's sold it to..."
Can you at least narrow it down?
Burgle shakes his head, then stops.\n"It must have been... yes, I's remember something. 't was in Connach. Or Sevenkeeps? No no, I's got it now: Definitely Lyraine! ...Or was it?"
I guess we'll have to check all three...
Burgle has brought you the amulet. He seems excited, full of hope and nervous energy.\n"And? Can youse break the curse?"
Let me have a look.

Your hands weave magic back and forth, prodding and picking at the amulet, but to no avail. The spell, whatever it was, is no longer attached to it - you can only feel traces of the magic.\n\nHowever, every good mage has a grimoire containing their spells. If you can get hold of theirs, you can definitely find a means to break Burgle's curse. And who knows, you might even learn something new in those pages?
We'll have to pay that dreamweaver a visit.

Burgle looks momentarily defeated but quickly gathers himself. "I's can get us in, but we'll needs a good crew. The locks should be easy, but they might have more guards."\n\nHe scratches behind his left ear. "With the right people, we snatch an artifact or two. I's remember seeing dwarven script last time...?" He looks at you expectantly.
Whatever you need.

A crooked grin spreads over the goblins face. "They take my dreams, I's take their magic. Seems fair to me." He turns to leave, his blood shot eyes twitching. "Looking forward to it, mage." The door closes loudly behind him.
Me too, Burgle.
I hope this ends well.

You are out and about when a blackboard draws your attention.
Notes of all kinds are pinned there - lost items, help wanted and advertisements for the local tavern.

But amidst all of the fluttering paper, you spot a familiar face.
A coal drawing of Burgle looks at you, a devilish grin showing off his sharp teeth.
 The paper reads 'Wanted -Dead or Alive! Get your reward here!'
Looks like you didn't make friends here.
We better hurry up, before someone spots you.
Burgle inspects the picture with unabashed pride. "They finally got my handsome face right." He cackles as you turn to leave.
You come upon another wanted poster with Burgle's face on it, only this time, his face has been decorated with lipstick stains and hearts.
Looks like you got yourself an admirer.
Ew, that's disgusting.

The goblin looks at the piece of paper in disbelief. "How dare they defile I's pretty face! Did you see that?!" He searches your face for sympathy and finding nothing but an amused smirk continues his rant quietly.
Come on, time to go.

You are about to pass a few travellers, when a shrill cry stops you in your tracks.
"There he is! My love! My one and only!"

Both you and Burgle turn around in confusion.
Excuse me?

A female goblin pushes forward, her eyes glued to Burgle. "Oh, youse so much more handsome in person! It be fate we meets here!"

She jumps forward, her arms outstretched, and wraps herself around Burgle. The thief squeals and only barely keeps his footing. "Off of me, woman!"
The whole scene begins to draw the attention of a few bystanders.
You heard the man, let go.
Aww, Burgle, who's your friend?
He glares at you. "Youse quit laughing and start helping!"\nHe desperately tries to pry the female goblin off him, struggling against her stranglehold, but to no avail.
Leave him be. Now.
Youse won't come between I and I's true love! I's warded, see? Her hand strokes over an amulet around her neck. "No magic nor threat will affect I's." Burgle begins to look panicked.
But a sword will.
You cast a spell, yet you feel your magic bouncing off the small frame of the other goblin. She smiles mischievously.
What the...

Your troops begin to draw their weapons. Burgle manages to squirm and wiggle himself free and quickly dashes behind you. His 'girlfriend' however, looks furious. 

"No! If I's cannot have him, then no one will! Guards! Quick, I's found the thief! Come and get the reward!"
Immediately, the other travellers move in, clearly more interested in the reward than her.
Wait, I can pay you!

The mob quickly disposes of your units while the goblin lady knocks Burgle unconsious. You barely manage to cast a ward around him, to prevent her killing him in her rage. Time and again she wails "Mine! Youse supposed to be mine!" before finally letting go and trotting off sobbing.
This fool is a trouble magnet.

Burgle dashes through the ranks of the villagers, taking them out with precise cuts to their tendons and ligaments. He only gives the female goblin a wide berth.\n\nAfter your troops took care of her and not a single opponent is left standing, he gives you a sheepish look. "Never thought I's would fear my kin." He grunts. "So, erm, thanks."

You raise a heavy pouch of gold, showing them proof of your claim. The mob immediately stops, looking at you expectantly.

The female goblin is not happy. "What are youse doing? Get him!" she cries.
 A bearded man replies gruffly: "Shut up. If the mage pays us, I don't care if he roasts the thief or keeps him as a pet," he announces. You toss him the gold and the group disperses.

Burgle's admirer has caught up with you, a riled up rag tag troop at her back. "This youse last chance, Burgle-Bug! Come with me! I's love you!"\n\nThe thief looks at you with pleading eyes. "Don't lets her have me." You have never seen him this scared before.
Burgle's Admirer
The dreamweaver's home would be too great of a challenge without Burgle's insight. You should return with him.

You notice that Burgle's twitching has worsened in the last hour. It seems that the closer he gets to the Dreamweaver's home, the more he feels the magical effects of the curse.\n\nAs you arrive in the dead of night he sighs heavily. "I's can't wait to be done with this. Stay close and don't youse touch anything." Murmuring he adds, "Let's get this over with."
Everyone, stay vigilant.

Entering the large vault through a hidden crack, Burgle leads you into a long hallway. "Careful, don't step on-!" Whatever he was about to warn you from was cut short by a magical missile flying past his left ear.\n\n"Bugger! They changed the spell." Examining your troops he asks: " 's any one of youse handy with magic?"
Of course.
Curses, I forgot about that.

Burgle rubs his chin. "Then we'll have to improvise. Take cover." He throws a handful of ball bearings on the ground, activating multiple traps. Once the whizzing of passing spells stops, he makes his way forward. \n\nJust on the very last step, he triggers something and icy water drenches you all. "Blasted! We better hurry."

You focus your mind and carefully pull apart the magic that is spread across the floor like a cobweb. Burgle nods approvingly before leading your troop in deeper. \n\nYou pause for a moment, admiring the intricate web of magic woven here. Someone definitely knew what they were doing. Their tactics fascinate you. Burgle looks back. "We going?"

Just as you are about to enter another room, Burgle stops and points towards a well hidden door. It is decorated with carvings, showing a mine and dwarves working with pickaxes. On the top dwarven script curves artfully along the frame. He raises an eyebrow at you.
'Pride in your work is rewarding.'
No time for that. Let's go.

In a flash, Burgle presses on the appropriate carvings - a dwarf, a pickaxe, a crystal-and with a gentle rolling sound, the door slides aside. Behind it lies a treasure trove of shimmering gold, sparkling jewels, and more. The little thief grins and quickly stuffs his pockets. " Already worth it," he chortles.

Were as before Burgle has walked these halls carefree, he now moves slowly, cautiously. He leans around corners and peers behind doorways. \n\nAt the last threshold, he waves to everyone to stop and be quiet. With the help of a mirror, he looks around the corner. "Guards," he growls in a low voice.
Let's hope this won't have consequences.
Although Burgle gives his all in the fight, he and the rest of your crew are subdued and defeated within moments.

A sharp inhale from Burgle and then the sound of shattering magic confirms your victory. He falls at your feet, a sobbing mess. "Thank you, mage, thank you!" \nFlipping through the pages again, you decide to keep a few for yourself. Somehow you became fond of the unknown mage.
We better get out of here.

With your opponents slain, Burgle bursts through the final door. He returns with a triumphant shout, Grimoire in hand.\n\n"Do it, please! Youse put an end to my misery!" His watery eyes look pleadingly into yours as he offers you the book.
Let's see what I can do.

Accepting defeat, you run from the tower. Your troops must drag the kicking and screaming Burgle behind them. "No! I's so close to freedom! No! Let me die if youse won't help me!"\n\nIt takes a while to comfort him, but you assure him you have every intention of making this right.

You venture deeper below and cannot help but wonder who this other mage is. You realize that apart from the Circle, you've only ever known your master as a powerful enough wizard to weave such spells.\nChoosing an abandoned vault, however, proved them to be quite cunning...
Maybe one day we will meet.

As if the book knew what you were looking for, the pages fly open right where you need them. Admiring the handwriting for a second you concentrate on the script.\nIt is well-formed and easy to understand, simple, yet elegant. You whisper the words and let your hands form the spell.
Come on, come on.

Daydream of Freedom
A mystical hum fills the air, growing stronger by the minute. The sound swells into a deafening storm, accompanied by a multitude of flickering lights.

It's the powerful buzzing and flashing of hundreds of magical wisps, driven mad by the constant leak of Allfire from the rift. Yet, they seem different from any wisps you’ve encountered before - these are brimming with chaotic magic.
Seeing their strong magical connection you quickly realize that in order to close the rift, you must destroy every last one of them. Not a single crazed wisp can be allowed to survive.

The torrential surge of power gradually diminishes, the once-unrelenting force of the Allfire finally bowing to your will. \n\nThe quiet that finally settles over the realm is a testament to your unparalleled mastery and triumph!

Your breath catches as you scry for the source: an Allfire node has burst open, unleashing a chaotic torrent of magic into the world! \n\nWithout anything to stop it from growing, this surge will surely consume other sources of magic, including your tower.
You are confident that with the help of your tower's crystal, you can close the rift and restore peace. If you can make it that far, that is.
A sudden sensation washes over you, an electric feeling that tugs on your very core. The chaotic magic of the rift seems to have intensified!
You must tread carefully now - there’s no telling what unpredictable forces may be unleashed or how this will influence the realm around you.
At last, you reach the Allfire node, magic lashing out of it like a wild beast, widening the rift by the second.

You channel all your energy into sealing the rift, but the gaping tear refuses to close. There must still be wisps nearby, feeding the chaotic magic and thwarting your efforts. They must be eradicated, or the rift will never be sealed.
With deft fingers, you snatch up the surge of might and are nearly overwhelmed by its power.\nBut you are not deterred.
At last, it is done.
I will not be defeated!

The crystal of the tower keeps you strong, and you swiftly weave the unleashed magic into a coherent strand before sealing the rift with a spell of your own creation. The torrential flow of power slows to a gentle trickle, and finally you emerge victorious!\n\nOnly a truly powerful mage like you can wield pure Allfire and live to tell the tale.
Heroes can only be found at hero taverns!
Choose which race and region you want to start with.

Time Sensitive: Once time runs out, the army will march against you.

Go there with your tower, channel the power of its enormous crystal, and close this rift once and for all.

[adventure_main]PLAYSTYLE[/]
You improve everything rather than specific things, but you will need to adjust your strategy depending on the constellations you uncover.

A cunning and ruthless dark elf, a master of espionage and deception known as The Snake, operates from the shadows. Skilled in deadly poisons, he follows his goals with deadly patience.\n\nDon't mistake his soft-spoken words for kindness - Zahaar strikes when least expected, his fangs revealed only when it’s too late.

Gemcutting
The hiss of a snake makes you snap your head around. You stare at the empty space for a moment, almost second guessing your hearing. Then you turn back - only to see the shadows growing.

You have never seen him before, but you have heard enough of the master of poison to recognize the dark elf manifesting before you as Zahaar, a member of the Circle of Mages.\n\n"Greetings. Do not be alarmed, I merely wished to gaze at the newly rising star."

Not much to look at, are you? Well, I, for one, am curious to see where your journey will lead you. 
Clicking his tongue, he whispers, "Curious indeed." 

He vanishes back into the swirling shadows as swiftly as he appeared. His words - friendly in tone yet belittling and cryptic - leave you unsettled. You cannot shake the feeling of being watched.
Zahaar The Snake

A writhing serpent, large as a tree, coils endlessly around the onyx tower.

"And who do we have here? If it isn't the little mageling." Zahaar's disembodied voice reverberates from all around you.

"Do come closer, I beg you. Give me a reason to tear the flesh from your bones. No one infiltrates my domain and lives."

A near-maniacal laugh tears through the ruins.

"Oh, this has been fun. But don’t think for even a second that you have bested me, little one. My eyes and ears will remain in this world far longer than anyone can imagine. And so will I."

The image of a colossal serpent lunging at you and your troops vanishes into smoke the instant its fangs sink into your flesh. Silence falls over the region, disturbed only by the uneasy movements of your own people.
Miyabi the Mystic
Werewolf
Astromancy Assistant
Veilguard
Dark Elven Barracks
Astrarium
Celestial Archive
Summon Celestial
Aid a foreign power in establishing a foothold.
Build the [bonus]Astrarium[/] room in your tower
Infiltrated {where}
[error]You must be next to a [skill]major city[/] not already infiltrated to use this skill.[/]

Zahaar materializes before you, idly stroking a serpent coiled around his forearm. The air thickens with an acrid sting.

"You had my curiosity with your hunger for power. But now, you have my attention - and that is far more dangerous than you realize. So be warned - tread carefully. My poison does not kill swiftly."

With that, he vanishes, leaving you gasping as you stagger toward the window, coughing.

A phantom serpent coils around your neck, tightening its grip. You claw at it, but your fingers grasp only air.

"You have overstepped, young one," it hisses in your ear. "Now, I will see you drowned in pain."

Fangs pierce your skin - searing, venomous. A cry escapes your lips as the poison surges through your veins. Then, as suddenly as it came, the torment vanishes, leaving you gasping, disoriented, and haunted by the lingering sting.

While breaking your fast for the day, the hushed voices of your servants catch your attention. You only manage to pick up a few fragmented words.\n\n"... tragic death... purple lips... the whole family..."
What is this whispering about?

One of them steps forward, wringing their hands. 

"There has been a murder, grand mage. Several nobles were found dead in their homes. Their lips and fingertips were discolored… It must have been a curse!"

"Nonsense!" another servant huffs. "Some coward poisoned them, that's what!"

The bickering continues, fading into the background as you mull over this troubling news.
I wonder who is responsible...
Whilst resting with your troops, an unshakable sense of being watched settles over you. You send out scouts, yet they return with nothing.

At first, you paid little mind to the travellers along your path. But as the days pass, you begin to notice a growing number of dark elves on the roads.\n\nThey are a reclusive people, rarely seen beyond their own domains.
Must have been the wind.
Someone is watching us.

As you prepare to move on, you glance back at the camp one last time. In the span of a heartbeat, a figure flickers into view - tall, pale, dark-haired. \n\nBut before you can make out any further details, it vanishes.

You are in the midst of recording your studies when, in the blink of an eye, your quill turns into a snake. With a start, you drop it. The serpent slithers across your desk and disappears through a crack in the stone walls.

Tensions rise with each passing day. Secrets are slipping through the cracks - trade routes, clandestine meetings of nobles, the whereabouts of family heirlooms. \n\nTrust is fading in every city, and suspicion grows among the people. Now you can only hope that it doesn't affect your ranks too.

When you return to your study after a long day, you stop in the doorway. Something feels off.

Stepping inside, your eyes scan the room. A parchment you distinctly remember locking away now rests on your desk. Your grimoire lies open - not where you left it. Even your quill sits on the wrong side of the table.

The changes are minute, almost imperceptible. But there is no doubt - someone has rifled through your belongings, careful, precise… and unseen.
Infiltrate City
Access City
Infiltrated
Infiltrate an adjacent major city over several days. Infiltrated cities can be accessed without a unit being present.

One of your scouts returns, his face grim.\n\n"I spotted dark elves nearby. They had one of their own in custody. I couldn’t catch everything they said, but from the looks of it... I'd wager the captive would be appreciative of some help."
I'd rather not mess with them
I've waited for an opportunity like this. Let's go!

Soon, you spot the group. Their prisoner is bound by multiple leashes, stumbling between them - half-dragged, half-shoved - and curses incessantly.\n\nYou weigh your options. A direct assault, a diversion to slip him away unnoticed, or a well-placed deception?
Ho there! What say you about a trade?
A dragon! Quick, duck!
The jingling gold in your hand gives the dark elves little pause. \n\n"We are no merchants, mage. Get lost, we have something to deal with."

The spell takes form - a towering dragon now looms over the elves. Panic seizes them, and quickly they drop the ropes and scatter, leaving all possessions behind.\n\nTheir prisoner collapses with a groan, then scrambles to flee. You let the illusion fade and step forward.
It's alright. You're safe now.

One of your guards steps forward and cuts the ropes. It takes a few seconds for the information to register with the dark elf, then he looks at you doubtfully. \n\n"You saved me? But... why? I am of the Norcaine!"
And yet, you deserved to be freed.
The disbelief slowly shifts to determination.\n\n"Then I will have to repay my debt. Allow me to fight under your banner!"
If you insist. Join me.
No need for that. Take care now.

The dark elves overpower your troops with unsettling ease.

"Take this as a lesson, mage. Don't meddle in our affairs."

With that, they drag their prisoner away, vanishing into the distance.
It's not worth it after all. We better go.
I can take that problem off your hands. Permanently.
One of them nudges the speaker and you can see a hunger spring to their eyes as they whisper amongst themselves.\n\n"Erm... Alright. You can have 'em. But you'll have to double your offer."
The coins change hands, and a leash is thrust at you.\n\n"Careful with that one. Right bastard." They laugh as they pocket their reward and move on.
You're mine now. Welcome to my troops.
You're free.
Never mind then. Good bye.
Your group swiftly dispatches the dark elves. Their prisoner lies collapsed on the ground, still struggling against his restraints, desperate to flee.
Calm yourself. You're free now.

During your travels you come upon a dark elf nursing a bad wound. He is his kind's usual pale, yet blood stains his clothes and skin. Upon seeing your troops, the tired eyes of the dark elf implore you.\n\n"Help me."
Worry not, this will set you right.
I can heal you.
What happened to you?
Thieves. Took my money and nearly my life. Hurry, I can feel my lifeblood drain away.
The dark elf shakily accepts and drinks a potion. Droplets of liquid drip from his chin onto his bloodied clothes.

A sigh of relief leaves his lips as the wound stitches itself together. \n\n"I know, one would not believe it from my current state, but I am a capable fighter. Considering I have no other way of repaying you, I will join your ranks."
Feeling better?
Of course, I could use an extra pair of hands.
I have enough troops. Take your leave.
You are about to retire for the night, when a disturbance in the hallway draws you towards the doors.\nYou can hear a scuffle outside and the muffled voices of your guards calling for more men.
Suddenly the door is pushed open and your guards drag in a dark elf with a bloody nose.\n\n"Grand mage, we caught this vermin creeping about. How do you wish us to proceed?"

Out of the shadows, a dark elf manifests and approaches your troops. They clear their throat. A crest depicting a snake is pinned to his chest.

For a moment, you wonder how he managed to appear within your ranks without warning, but his demeanor is anything but threatening.

"Grand mage, I apologize for the intrusion. I seek your help."
I can see you carry Zahaar's crest.

He glances down at his uniform and, with a huff, rips the crest from his chest.

"I am not here on his behalf. Quite the contrary." He steels himself before continuing.

"Zahaar is a cruel master, even by my kin's standards. I have witnessed his betrayals and scheming. His poison runs deep, and I refuse to serve such an honorless man any longer."
And where do I come into play?
The dark elf meets your gaze and drops to one knee.\n\n"I ask for nothing but shelter. Let me serve you instead. I would rather follow a mage of honor than one of deceit."
I have no reason to trust you. Guards!
I see no harm in that. Sure, join me.

The Norcaine's expression darkens.

"So be it."

Smoke pools at his feet, thick and impenetrable. By the time your guards rush in, the swirling haze is already dissipating - taking the elf with it. It is as if he was never here.
This doesn't bode well...

A black snake crosses your path. You think nothing of it, when the creature suddenly reappears on your shoulder.

"Impressive work, mage. Your spies serve you well. You would make a fine apprentice. Alas, my capacities are stretched thin. But I wish you good luck on your path."

The serpent disappears but the goosebumps from hearing Zahaar's voice this close remain for a few moments longer.
What's all this ruckus?
A spy? Kill him at once!
Who sent you then?
Bah, let him run. I have no time for this.
The dark elf spits in your direction, earning a sharp cuff from a guard. His glare burns with defiance.
Will this loosen your tongue?
Kill thim.
A string of vile insults is all the answer you are getting
Unceremoniously, they drag the Norcaine away. Minutes later, a soldier returns, confirming the death of the spy.
Your guards throw him out of the tower. The pale dark elf hesitates only a moment before vanishing into the night with a hard glint in his eye.
Your well deserved break is interrupted by the hissing of a snake that rudely makes itself at home in your lap.

Please excuse the interruption, Zahaar's voice hisses from the snake’s open mouth.

"I have a proposition that benefits us both. One of my informants has gone silent. I need you to find him - or rather, ensure no trace remains."

His tone makes it clear that "no trace" applies to both objects and people.

"You may keep whatever else you uncover. I only care that my information stays safe."
Fine, I'll help you.
I don't do dealings with a snake. Be gone.
Without another word, the snake slithers off and vanishes under the table.

If a snake can look disappointed, this one looks downright furious.

"I see. Let us hope you never require my aid, for rest assured - I will repay this refusal tenfold."

With that, the serpent slithers beneath the chair and vanishes.
Access the city and interact with it normally. Every purchase gets sent to your tower.

A massive serpent slithers into view, its obsidian scales glistening. You know its master by now. 

"So, you deem yourself cunning? Slithering through cities, meddling in affairs beyond you?"

The snake spits a viscious liquid in your direction, forcing you to dodge it.

"Consider this a warning. I see every move you make. Displease me, and you will rue your audacity."

With that, the serpent and Zahaar's voice vanish.
That sounded ominous...
Thank you?

You awaken from your slumber with a nagging feeling that something is wrong. Has been wrong for weeks. And now, in the quiet hours of the first light, you finally understand the source of your distress.\n\n The dark elves under your command were caught talking to themselves, displaying snake tattoos, or wandering the halls when they should have been on guard duty.
The signs were there all along!

And though they followed your orders, there was one they never yet had to obey: facing Zahaar in battle.\n\nYou feel a fool for not piecing it all together sooner. Your own troops are riddled with adherents of the master infiltrator himself! And while they are loyal to you in most ways, you might want to consider avoiding the Circle Mage in the future.
Zahaar, you vile snake...
You arrive at the informant’s hideout, recalling Zahaar’s final words: “Ensure no trace remains.”\n\nYou could simply set the place ablaze and be done with it, yet something urges you to look inside.
I'll keep it quick.
After some more searching, you uncover a small jar filled with crawling, living bugs. You don’t hesitate - you already know what to do.
At first, the humble hut seems unremarkable, but within minutes, you and your troops uncover various hidden compartments and notes written in code.

The evidence reveals that the spy was behind the strange behavior of insects in Goldenfields - creatures they called “mind meddlers” and “brain bugs.” \n\nThey were meant to expand the network of loyal subjects. But something went wrong. The hive's mother escaped, and the situation spiraled out of control. You are absolutely sure you heard something about that already. The spy is long dead by now.
I'll keep those for myself. Zahaar doesn't need to know.
They must be burned with the rest.

You pile everything into a pyre upon which you set the jar. After stepping outside, you utter a quick spell. Moments later smoke rises from the roof.\n\nIt turns into an all-encompassing blaze, leaving nothing but ashes.
And no trace remains. Zahaar will be pleased.
You quickly pocket the bugs before setting the remains of the hut on fire. Soon nothing but a pile of ashes and charcoal remains.
And Zahaar will never be the wiser... I hope.
[bonus]{ShackleConfig.DamageTransmitted:p}[/] of any damage dealt to the caster is dealt to the target instead.

A few days ago, you dismissed reports of obsidian towers in the sky as drunken ramblings. But now, as you gaze upon the massive, darkly glistening fortress floating above, you realize the truth - it is Shal'Adir, the Norcaine stronghold.\n\nWhile most dark elves remain in their capital, others roam as mercenaries, spies, or exiles, weaving their craft and intrigue across the land. Their skills could prove a valuable asset.
What a view!

Following an invitation of the leaders of Shal'Adir, you enter the flying city and are immediately led to the highest of the black towers.
As you ascend, you can't help but marvel. The drifting fortress is a rare sight and brings both danger and opportunity in equal measure - considering the masters of spycraft and assassins that dwell here.

Once inside, three dark elves of fair skin, dark hair and regal bearing greet you.

"Welcome, mage."
Thank you for the invitation.

With a snide smile, one of the elves waves the thanks aside. "We did not summon you without reason. Shal'Adir offers you the chance to benefit from our many talents. We can provide many troops and goods of the highest quality."\n\nAnother chimes in, "But first, you must prove yourself worthy of the Norcaine."
A challenge?

Moonbound Miners

Of sorts., the third nods. "You see, those annoying dwarves have been encroaching on our territory."

You cock your head at that. They've just dropped anchors in Norimar, and by no means does that make this piece of land 'their territory'.

"Eliminate them, and we shall grant you access to some of our lesser wares. Impress us, and you'll earn yourself a reward."
You must flee, friends!
Eradication of pests

The dwarves look up, surprised at the call. "Say what now?"

You relay the dark elves wish for the dwarves to disappear, making it clear that they want them gone now, or they might send someone else to do the job. Grumbling, they make ready to leave. They know there is no fighting this.

"Thank you for the warning, friend. This would have ended badly for us."
I'll poison their drinks, that'll make them leave.
Pulling a few concoctions from your pockets, you secretly distribute the flasks amongst the unsuspecting dwarves. Within minutes they either become violently sick or topple over outright.

Congratulations, mage. You were impressive.

You turn toward the voice and find the three leaders of Shal'Adir standing before you.

"We all admire your gusto for bloodshed. Visit again soon, if you will - I am sure we can find a more challenging task next time."

Suddenly, a dark-clad figure appears before you, handing you a letter written in fine handwriting.\n\n'You fulfilled the request - albeit in the most boorish manner. Come by again. We have more… interesting work for you, if you are up for it.'
How ominous.
It would be my honor.
You order your troops to charge, overwhelming the suprised miners. One after the other, their blood paints the ground red. Now that their bodies litter the ground, you feel almost sorry for them.
The Norcaine send their regards. Charge!

You come upon a more resolute looking group of dwarves. They seem to be in the middle of striking some kind of business with hooded figures, but one of them notices you.\n\n"What are ya looking at? Move along, nothing to see here."
We came to warn you!
I see dead dwarves talking.

Your irises narrow into slits, and the dwarves instinctively step back. "O-oi, no need for violence. We were just about to pack up lad."\n\nYou call upon the demons, and they erupt from the earth, their howls and cackles echoing through the cavern as they chase the dwarves away.
That ought to do it.
And I am about to loose my manners. For the last time, move.\n\nOne of the hooded figures looks up and you see the face of a granite dwarf beneath the robes.

Looking ahead, you see no soldiers or guards, only a couple of dwarven miners chipping away at ore. They seem neither threatening nor dangerous to anyone - except, perhaps, to the metal they strike.\n\nSo how will you get rid of them?
You... deal with the granite faction?
With a curse, the group scatters quickly. It seems this job kind of took care of itself.
With the dwarves slain, you can finally turn to more important matters.
A few patrolling dwarven guards cross your path. The words of the dark elf still echo in the back of your head. 'Eliminate them.'
I'll weaken their armor.

You call the dwarves over, offering to inspect their armor for free. As a master of the runes, your expertise earns their eager acceptance.

While you appear to tinker, you secretly etch weakening runes into the joints and corrode the core. The next time they charge into battle, their armor will surely fail.

Satisfied with your work, you bid them farewell and send them on their way.
While the well-armored guards put up some resistance, you dispatch them quickly - all but one. Taking a headcount, you realize that a guard has slipped away. That will have consequences.
Alarmed by your words, the guards come closer. "Warn us? We are the strongest outpost in the region! What could you warn us about? Dragons?"\n\nThey all begin to laugh at the joke.
The Norcaine, they want you gone. Permanently.

That stifles their laughter. "Aye, I see. The Norcaine are a bothersome folk. Pillaging honest working folk in the name of the reviled guardian Nor. But worry not, we are capable of defending ourselves."
No, you don't understand! You must leave!
Their demeanor turns to annoyance. "I told you, we are well prepared to face those darklings. Now move along, will ye?"
I'll give you one last chance to run.
Indignation and disbelief alternate across the face of the dwarf in rapid succession. "So now ye are threatening us?"
No. Killing you. Charge!
I'm sorry. I didn't want this.
Political games

Entering the city of black stone once more, you make your way toward the tower of the ruling caste.
Inside, familiar voices greet you.

"Ah, you came."
"Finally."
"We have awaited your arrival, mage. Are you prepared for a new challenge?"
Tell me more about your task.

As you know, we are strangers to this part of Eo. While we have no trouble traversing the land, avoiding entanglement in its intricate web of politics is another matter.

Another Norcaine steps forward, continuing, "So we ask for your help in gaining insight. Accompany one of our own to a city of your choosing. They will handle the rest."

"Simple as that," the third chimes in. "Can we count on you?"
Hold on, what are they to do in the city?

A wicked smile spreads across each of their faces.
"Simply gather information while remaining unseen. Nothing more. You need only support them."

"It's to help us understand the people here better."

"So, will you do it?"
I suppose so...

Your assistance is appreciated.

A fourth dark elf enters the room and silently takes position beside you.

"Take this female with you then. No true Norcaine warrior can bear to live among the light races."
Alright, let's go.

After spending hours observing the ins and outs of the dark elven city, you feel no more informed than before. You are about to push further when a tap on your shoulder stops you.

"Feeling cunning with your choice of city, mage?"

The triumvirate of ruling elves stands behind you - two wearing bemused smiles, the third sporting a sour expression.
I - uhm, I mean...
You have amused us. Now don’t think of using our own people against us again.\n\nGrateful to get away with just a slap on the wrist, you hastily retreat.
That didn't go over well.

Upon arriving in the city, you watch in quiet amazement as the dark elf retrieves a small map from her coat.

A few points of interest are already marked. She explains that these are potential locations for the operation’s headquarters.

"It must be somewhere accessible, a place where we can observe the city's movements while also welcoming important... guests. Now, where would that be?"
A house near the main plaza.
Close to the city's representatives.
Near the merchants would be ideal.

The dark elf nods approvingly. "Near the merchants, then.
They control the flow of goods and information. A well-placed whisper can change the course of an entire city."

She nods once more.
"A smart choice indeed."
The dark elf huffs approvingly. "The city’s representatives make the laws, but more importantly, they are susceptible - to rumors, bribes and secrets."

The dark elf sways her head left to right. "A central location, easy to access yet unassuming. The plaza is where news spreads first, where deals are struck, and where people talk without realizing who might be listening. Not bad, but we could have done better."\n
Onwards then.

Making your way through the bustling city, you arrive at your chosen location shortly after.

Once settled in, the dark elf poses another question. 

"I need a quick way into high society. How should we best approach this?"

Bribe the most influential people.
Invite everyone to a party.
Marry a noble.

Gold speaks louder than words. A few well-placed coins will open many doors quickly.\n\nYou set out immediately to distribute news, gossip and gold to the wealthiest nobles and merchants. At the end of the day, the female Norcaine's name is on everyone's lips.

A gathering at our new headquarters to attract the city's elite? Very well. Let it be known that tonight, there will be a feast like no other!\n\nThe invitations go out within the hour, and by the afternoon, nobles, merchants, and representatives mingle at an opulent banquet.

You want me to -? Bah, fine. But I'll have you know, this is your worst idea yet.\n\nFinding a suitable prospect is easy enough, and you even manage to pull a few strings to arrange the marriage promptly.
That went better than expected!

Now for the final step. I need informants in every corner, ears in every hall. People who trade secrets without realizing their value, who heed my words without knowing my hand behind them.\n\nPacing up and down the headquarters, she continues, "Now, how do we make them mine?"
Establish a network with the merchants and nobles.
Establish a network with the beggars and urchins.
Establish a network with the servants and street performers.

A safe but dull option. Yes, merchants control the city's flow, and nobles pull the strings behind the leaders' backs. But couldn't we do something with more grandeur? More excitement?

She glances at you briefly before waving her thought away.

"Never mind. Safe is good."

Over the next few days, you help pave the way for the most influential dark elf this city has ever seen. Slowly but steadily, her web of informants is woven.

Oh, yes, this is perfect. Beggars and urchins hear and see everything, yet they remain invisible to those in power. And it takes so little to make them mine - a few coins, a bit of bread...\n\nYou seek out sources in the backstreets, visit black markets with pouches of gold and arms full of food. That same evening, the first bits of information flow back in.

Servants move through the halls of power unnoticed, barely seen as different to furnishing. They set the tables, pour the wine, and clean the chambers where secrets are spilled. With the right persuasion, they can become powerful allies.\n\nThat same day, coins and promises change hands. Over the next few days, information begins to trickle back.

Now that you have successfully infiltrated the city, you receive a summons back to Shal'Adir. As you make your way there, leaving the informant to do her job, a sense of satisfaction settles over you. The web of informants is in place, and the city's secrets now flow toward the dark elves like a river.\n\nUpon arriving at the black towers, the familiar trio awaits you, their expressions unreadable.
I did what you asked. What now?

You've done well, mage, one says, their voice laced with barely grudging approval.

Another nods. "We expected base competence, but you have shown yourself quite capable."

The third steps forward:  "You should be rewarded. You shall have this,"

they toss you a pouch,

"and access to more of our goods. Peruse the shops in the middle districts, they are sure not to disappoint. We will call upon you again. Perhaps sooner than later."
That is great news, thank you.

You have done adequately, one states plainly.

Another tilts their head, considering you. "The information flows, as expected. However, you did not impress us with your recommendations."

The third eyes you with barely covered contempt. "It is a start. Functional. You deserve access to better wares, at least. And do return soon. More work awaits."
Under the Full Moon
The triumvirate is in the middle of a discussion, as you enter their sanctuary.\n\n"Ah, what auspicious timing. We were about to call on you."
To what do I owe the pleasure?

We are about to leave for our most sacred ritual but we lack a key ingredient.

The other two step forward in unison. One speaks.
"Blood."
Blood?

It must be from the light races. And we need quite a bit, at least five vials, the last adds with a cold smile.

"We trust you can provide that? Worry not - we’ll let you know when it’s enough."

The first hands you a map. "Meet us here when you're done."

Arriving at the ritual site, you spot multiple dark elves and eight figures clad in long black robes, each adorned with blood-red trim along the hem. Their backs bear distinct silver markings, each opposing - two with half-moons, two with slivered crescents, and two more with arched shapes. The final pair each display a full disk, one gleaming in silver, the other in red.
Are those... moons?

The triumvirate approaches, and one takes the blood vials from you with a nod, distributing them to each robed figure - except the one marked with the red disk.\n\nAs the moon reaches its zenith, the latter kneels. One by one, the others pour their vials of blood over them. The remaining dark elf raises a ritual dagger and drives it deep into his flesh. Spasming, he collapses, body stilling only seconds after.
T-the city! Shal'Adir has... moved! You blink at the guard who has burst into your study, trying to process the information you have just received.
And that is concerning because...?

Another guard storms into your study, panting.

"Shal'Adir is besieging a city! They ordered the leaders to hand the city over to them by the next full moon, else they will destroy it."

Breathing hard, they add, "And so far, it doesn't look like they'll get what they want..."
I have more important things to do.

The blood moon rises over Fiara, yet the city refuses to yield to Shal'Adir's demands.\n\nIn mere minutes, they are crushed and obliterated by a ruthless blend of dark elven magic and deadly arrows and rocks raining from above. The streets run red as buildings collapse and people are crushed, the once-proud city reduced to ruin.
What a disaster!
What an impressive feat.
Greater Wereform
Moon Glyph
Leash of Servitude
The Apprentice
A delicate flower that only reveals itself to the full moon's light.
Moonshade

Moonsilver Vein

It seems you have lost our asset. The voices of the triumvirate echo through your mind, uninvited, unwelcome.

"A shame. She was quite capable."
"Ah, it matters not. We will send you another immediately. Just... try not to kill this one again."
I'll take better care this time.

Arriving at Shal'Adir, you find your guards' report to be true - they are indeed besieging the city.\n\nBodies already litter the ground, the first casualties of the conflict. For now, the city's defenses hold strong, but it is only a matter of time before the dark elves prevail and destroy it altogether.
I will help the Norcaine!
Defend them! Destroy Shal'Adir!
We should sit this one out.

Your involvement in the fight doesn't even register with the Norcaine. Their forces are so overwhelming, you might as well not be there at all.\n\nBut the battle isn’t over yet. If you can gather a battalion quickly, you might still have a chance.

Taking position at the elves' side, you slay anyone in your path. Once the fighting is over, and the city destroyed, you see the familiar faces of the triumvirate approaching.

"What a surprise to find you here. You clearly chose the right side."

One of them steps forward to hand you a small chest. "For your troubles."

You stand with the people, defending them against the dark elves with all your might. After the battle, which you turned in the defender's favor, you see the familiar faces of the triumvirate on a balcony as Shal'Adir retreats.\n\nTheir numbers diminished, the dark elves have no choice but to retreat.
Shal'Adir, the floating dark elven city, has once more vanished and reappeared near another city. By now you know what that means...
Everyone, gather up! We're going to war again!
I didn't care then and I don't care now.

For the last few days, you have been receiving reports of wolf sightings - each day, they draw closer to people and villages.\n\n"Someone must have hexed them! Last night, I saw one strolling through our village like it was nothing! An' the guard dogs dinnae a thing against it!"
I have more important things to do.
Odd indeed. I will keep my eyes open.

The reports about hexed wolves grow by the day, and now, while out and about, you hear the eerie howls yourself.\n\nOne of those villages has even reported a disappearance. "The wolves must have taken him in the night! The door was all scratched up and the bed broken. Poor grandfather. We didn't even hear him scream!"
Something is definitely not right here.
As the full moon rises, you hear the wolves again. Only this time, they are closer than ever before.

Suddenly, they burst from the trees - a whole pack of wolves, led by the biggest beast you have ever seen.\n\nMost of the pack rushes past in a blur of fur and snapping jaws, but the leader sinks its fangs into one of your people, its eyes crazed with frenzy.

As they press on, leaving your troops confused and wounded, they cut a clear path through the forest - a perfect opportunity to finally track them to their hideout and put an end to these strange beasts.

Here, the Dracon lords train in their cruel arts - elite warriors stand at attention, raptors snarl in their pens, and shackled thralls await their fate.\nIf you seek an army, you have come to the right place.
The air hums with arcane power, robed figures whisper incantations, and souls glow in glassy prisons.\nPower is for sale here - but at what cost?
The alleys here twist unnaturally, shifting as if they were never meant to be traversed.\nIf you seek the forbidden, the Sinistra will provide.
A choking scent of damp earth and burnt offerings lingers. Twisted effigies sway from trees, their hollow eyes watching.
Crafting (Astromancy)
Astromancy
This is your Gemcutting Atelier.\n\nHere, you can cut and polish [tutorial]jewels[/] of various rarities to use in your [tutorial]constellations[/] to unlock bonuses for your units and tower.
Astromancy Specifics
Constellations

This codex keeps track of all the [tutorial]constellations[/] you find. Here you can place [tutorial]jewels[/] in them to unlock powerful bonuses.\n\nThere are several slots in the constellation requiring different qualities of jewels to match!
Astromancy has a dedicated slot for [tutorial]Stardust[/]. Using such an item is optional, but can greatly enhance your created jewel.
[point_arcane]Unlocks Astromancy[/]
Add [item]Items[/] from your inventory containing [point_arcane]<sprite name="elementalpoint">Arcane[/] essence into the ingredient slots until you reach the first [tutorial]Threshold[/].
[tutorial]Stardust[/] is a rare [item]item[/] that can greatly boost your jewels or infuse them with unique properties.\n\nAdding [tutorial]Stardust[/] is optional.
Hunting down the wolves, you arrive at a cave. The entrance is smothered in darkness and low growls come from within.

Inside the cave, you find the large beast that bit one of your own. It tears strips of flesh from a deer, grunting and snarling, while more wolves wait their turn.\n\nYour presence doesn't go unnoticed for long. A low growl rises from the beast as it catches your scent.
Pushing further, you find a pack of snarling wolves, all protectively surrounding an old, naked man. He appears to be unharmed, but shivering.

No! The weak exclamation comes from the old man. He slowly sits up, raising his hands. "They only want to defend me."\n\nWith a pained groan, he continues. "I'm a hunter. Was. A few weeks ago, I killed a giant wolf. But as I struck the final blow, the beast turned into a human. With his last breath, the young man told me he was cursed. I don’t know who or what placed the curse on him… only that I carry it now."

As one of your troops drives their weapon into the giant wolf’s flesh, it lets out an eerily human howl. Then, before your eyes, its fur recedes, revealing a frail old man. \n\nHe collapses with a sigh, whispering, "Free, at last."
Each full moon, I transform. I have no recollection of what I do as a wolf, but... He blanches. "I pray to the Allfather that I don’t hurt anyone during those times."

You bit one of mine. Now you'll pay.
Is there a cure?
He looks despondent. "I wouldn’t know who to ask." Then, his face brightens with sudden hope. "Can you help me, grand mage? I’ll wait here for you - no matter how long it takes! Please, help me."
Alright, let me think.

You have heard of changelings before but ahad little interest in them. Now, you search your memory for cures. \n\nSome say the spell can be broken by ingesting a concoction of Aria and Lenya. Others claim that Moonsilver is the only option to permanently free the victim of the curse.
Let's try Lenya and Aria.
Your troops quickly put an end to the man and his wolves. He collapses with a sigh, whispering, "Free, at last."
I have some Moonsilver that might help.
We'll come back.

As the full moon rises in the night sky, a strangled sound escapes your bitten companion. They double over, clutching their sides as their breathing turns ragged. Bones snap. Muscles twist. Their scream warps into a guttural snarl as fur bursts from their skin.\n\nWithin moments, the transformation is complete. What was once your soldier now stands as a towering beast, panting heavily, eyes filled with primal hunger.

You press the rare metal against the man's skin. A pained howl rips from his throat as his flesh begins to sizzle and burn. He writhes on the floor, his body convulsing violently - until, before you can intervene, his body is consumed and leaves nothing but a pile of ash.\n\nThe wolves, startled by the brutal death of their leader, scatter in all directions, vanishing into the night.
That was horrifying!

You enhance the brew with a few whispered incantations and hand it to the man. He takes the flask, eyes filled with hope.\n\n"Bottoms up." He drains it in one swift motion, then shudders. For a moment, glowing runes snake across his skin - flickering, shifting - before vanishing without a trace.

The wolves tilt their heads, ears twitching in confusion. One by one, they rise, sniffing the air as if searching for something lost. With low whines, they slink away into the night.

The man watches them go before turning to you with a wide grin. "Thank you, master mage. I can feel its no longer stirring inside me."

Gesturing deeper into the cave, he adds, "There are some things back there - items I took while under the spell. You’re welcome to them. Consider it a token of my gratitude."

Suddenly, everything is bathed in red. Looking up, you see what was once a waxing silver moon now a deep, blood-red disk.

Slowly, the crimson glow withdraws, and the moon returns to its normal form.

The triumvirate turns to you, satisfaction gleaming in their eyes. "You have served Nor well. For that, you shall have access to the most exquisite of our shops and services. Nor's blessing to you."

The stars hold wisdom beyond mortal reach, but with careful study and precision, their secrets can be unlocked. I should create a sanctuary of cosmic knowledge - a Celestial Archive!
In this humble chamber stars can be charted, jewels shaped, and celestial power begins to take form.

As the light fades, the mind sharpens, enhancing wisdom and inner strength.

Astral Mandate

Gaze into the stars trying to catch a glimpse at a [gold]Constellation[/].\nIf there is none, this instead gives you the [tutorial]distance[/] to the nearest valid location where a constellation is found.
Stargazing

A unit in this stack can [tutorial]Stargaze[/] in order to collect [gold]Constellations[/].

Multiple Constellations are hidden throughout Eo, each observable only from one specific point on the map.

Stargazing can be attempted from any point on the map and requires a turn. If a constellation is visible from that point, it will be added to your collection. If not, a hint will be provided with the [tutorial]distance[/] to the nearest point at which a constellation can be observed.

As the full moon rises, Miyabi staggers, his breath quickening. Then, with a guttural snarl, his body contorts - bones stretching, muscles swelling - until a towering beast stands where once stood a man. Eyes gleaming with primal power, his claws dig into the earth as he lets out a thundering howl.\n\nWatching this awe-inspiring transformation, seemingly triggered by the full moon, a single thought shoots through your mind.
Marvelous! I'll make good use of his power!
Marvelous! I'll make good use of this!

These slots are connected by [tutorial]Star Lines[/] usually dedicated to a specific [tutorial]Essence[/] <nobr>[mPointElemental][mPointArcane][mPointDeath][mPointLife]</nobr> and provide increasing bonuses the more of the essence you feed it.

Every essence point of a jewel placed in either slot of that connection counts towards that progress.

There are also overarching [tutorial]Unlocks[/] for the whole constellation in the bottom left corner for you to achieve!

To apply the jewels and unlock the bonuses, press the [tutorial]Fuse[/] button. Alternatively you can also revert your changes.

Once fused, the jewels cannot be retrieved but only replaced by new ones.

Explore the world with your assistants to find additional constellations!
